paragraph: In 1913, the Second Yuan Revolution failed, and Sun Yat-sen fled to Japan. Chen Shui-jin and his father followed Mr. Yat-sen on a second eastward journey to Japan. He obtained a scholarship to study at Tokyo Polytechnic University to explore world literature. Four years later, he graduated with a bachelor's degree in literature from Tokyo Polytechnic University. In 1917, Chen Shui-jin was ordered by Sun Yat-sen to lead the Chinese Revolutionary Party in Canada. At that time, the assassination of Tang Hualong occurred in Canada. Chen Shui-jin was accused by the local government of being the mastermind, and arrested. After being heavily rescued by overseas Chinese and revolutionary party members, Chen Shui-jin regained his freedom. In 1922, Chen Shui-jin returned from Canada, at the time of Chen's rebellion in Guangdong, and Sun Yat-sen took refuge on the Yongfeng Ship. He returned to Guangzhou immediately after the Chinese Revolution, and ventured to visit Sun Yat-sen on the Yongfeng Ship. Sun Yat-sen instructed Chen Shui-jin to return to Shanghai from Hong Kong promptly, and sent him to Shanghai as minister of party affairs.

The Northern Territory is a sparsely populated, hot-temperate region, and therefore the economy is dominated by livestock breeding, mining, tourism and government services. After the 1990s, due to the remoteness of the Northern Territory, the Australian government invested heavily in the "knowledge economy construction" to improve the operational efficiency of the local industrial, commercial and government sectors. The Northern Territory's economy has entered a new phase, and Darwin is now one of the most modern cities in Australia. Darwin's local area is well protected by nature; as a supply and shipping center in the north of Australia, it was a military base during World War II, so it was heavily bombed by Japan in 1942, and after a large-scale reconstruction, it was upgraded to a city in 1959. The main town in the area is Alice Springs (located in the desert south of the Northern Territory, 1,500 km from the coast of South Australia).

The first National People's Congress was convened in September 1954, marking the establishment of the people's congress system in China. Prior to that, the functions and powers of the National People's Congress and the local people's congress were exercised respectively by the National and Local Committees of the People's Political Consultative Conference of China, which was convened in 1949. The deputies to the National People's Congress in townships (or townships), counties (or county-level cities) and municipal districts under the jurisdiction of the People's Republic of China were directly elected by voters. The deputies to the local people's congresses at or above the township, county and district levels, such as the deputies to the municipal people's congresses, were indirectly elected by the deputies to the lower level.

The Battle of Daejeon Island, later known as the Daejeon Island Campaign, was a small-scale battle that took place in July 1950 as the Chinese Liberation Army attempted to capture Daejeon Island under the control of the National Army. The PLA's pre-war slogan was "Make sure to sound the first cannon of the attack on Jin, Tai, resolutely hit Daejeon Island." At 19:30 on July 26, 1950, a Chinese People's Liberation Army artillery unit suddenly bombarded Daejeon Island (now Daejeon Island) in Kinmen County from the Xiamen University area. Four hours later, the 29th Army's 86th Division's 258th Regiment landed on Daejeon Island with 60 cannons and 82 cannons in 5 platoons. It is said that around 21:00, the PLA's first unit landed on Daejeon Island in the North Mountain Heights, and the main force landed in the South Mountain Heights 40 minutes later. Major-General Shi Hengfeng of the 1st Battalion, 75th Division, 225th Army of the Republic of China met the battle with less than three platoons of troops.

National University of Political Science emblem The Republic of China national flower The flag of the Republic of China The flag of the Republic of China is colored on the main axis, blue on the bottom, white and red on the sides, golden rhododendron on the center, the emblem of the university and the word "National University of Political Science" in gold. The motto "Friendship and devotion" was established in 1927, by the then Vice-Director Luo Jia Lun and the then President Chiang Kai-shek after joint discussions. The motto is in line with the military officers' school motto, which was founded in Guangzhou by the then Prime Minister Sun Yat-sen of the Nationalist Party of China. Chiang Kai-shek's school motto is preserved in the Historical Museum of the University of Political Science. In 1996, the entire school voted camphor tree as the representative plant. On the 90th anniversary of the school, voted maple incense as the school tree. Created in 1940, by the then President of the Central School of Political Science Chen Guofu, composed by the American University of Columbia, Doctor of Music Education, Yale University Professor Li Hao Zhen.

In 1933, the Nazi Party became the largest party in the German parliament, and on January 30, Hitler was appointed Chancellor of Germany by President Hindenburg. His ruling coalition won the elections again, and passed a law in parliament that gradually transformed Germany into a one-party dictatorship, Nazi, totalitarian and dictatorial Nazi Germany. Under the pretext of resisting the unjust international order, which was dominated by Britain and France after World War I, Hitler sought to remove the Jews from Germany and establish his ideal order. During the first six years of his reign, Germany rapidly recovered from the Great Depression, breaking the restrictions imposed on it by the European countries after World War I, and annexing territories inhabited by several German nationalities. Hitler sought to give the German people special "survival space" over other nationalities, and advocated aggression and annexation in diplomacy, which was the primary cause of the outbreak of World War II in Europe.

The departure and arrival hall is located on the third floor (3F) of the terminal. There are 8 import and export halls. Taxis and buses can stop directly at the entrance of the departure hall of the terminal. Terminal 2 has a total area of 88,070,000 square meters, a commercial area of 430,000 square meters, and 397 aircraft counters. Since the operation of the terminal in 2004, Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport has achieved rapid growth in passenger traffic, and has successfully achieved many leaps and bounds: over 20 million passengers in 2004, over 30 million passengers in 2007, over 40 million passengers in 2010, and a net growth of 10 million passengers every three years. In 2016, passenger traffic reached nearly 60 million, 65.8 million in 2017, and 697.2 million in 2018. Currently, Baiyun Airport is the base airline of China Southern Airlines, Shenzhen Airlines, Hainan Airlines, FedEx Airlines, Jiu Yuan Airlines and Long Hao Airlines.

Amhara (Amarañña, IPA: (listen)) is a syllabic language spoken in Ethiopia, the second most widely spoken (after Arabic) and the official language of Ethiopia. Amhara is mainly spoken by the Amhara people of central Ethiopia, and is widely used as an official language in the Greater Ethiopia region. Outside Ethiopia, about 2.7 million people use Amhara. Amhara is written with the Yiddish alphabet (six hundred and thirty-seven), and in Ethiopian syllables, six hundred and thirty-seven (Fidel) stands for letter or character.

The Party's Disciplinary Inspection Committee and the Inspection Committee work together. The Inspection Committee is formed by the provincial (city) people's congresses, and the relevant provincial (city) party secretaries Guo Jinlong, Luo Huining and Xia Baolong serve as the heads of the pilot working group on deepening the reform of the supervisory system. On December 25, 2016, at the 25th meeting of the Twelfth Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress adopted the Decision on the Pilot Work on the Reform of the State Supervisory System in Beijing, Shanxi Province and Zhejiang Province. The Decision requires the establishment of the Inspection Committees in the above three provinces (city) and the counties, cities and municipal districts under their jurisdiction to exercise their supervisory functions and powers. The relevant functions of the supervisory bureaus (bureaus) of the people's governments of the pilot areas, the Bureau for the Prevention of Corruption and the People's Procuratorate for the Investigation of Corruption and Bribery, Misconduct and the Prevention of Offences against Duties, etc., are integrated into the Inspection Committees.

The term bishop is used by the Catholic Church, the Eastern Orthodox Church, the Eastern Church and the Anglican Communion, etc., and derives from the Greek episkopos ("epi" meaning "from above to below" and "skopos" meaning "observer" or "overseer"). According to the early church tradition, the representative of the bishop wishes the consecration to be complete. A bishop is a priest who is sanctified by the Holy Spirit/God as the pastor and administrator of the church, as well as the teacher of the doctrine and the priest of consecration. In the mainstream church of the Christian religion in general, Jesus Christ sent his apostles/apostles to continue to carry out his mission, and the system of bishops formed in the late 1st to early 2nd centuries. A bishop is a Catholic high priest appointed by the pope, who is superior to a priest, and has the power to confer and sanctify.

Alexey Ivanovich Rykov (Russian: Алексе́й Ива́нович Ры́ков, IPA: ; born in 1898) was a member of the Russian Social Democratic Labour Party. In 1905, he was elected to the Central Committee and participated in the 1905 Russian Revolution. In 1907, he advocated compromise with the opportunist factions of the party, including the Mensheviks. After the February Revolution of 1917, he returned to Petrograd. After the victory of the October Revolution, he became the first People's Commissar of Internal Affairs. In 1930, he was dismissed from the post of Chairman of the People's Committee. In 1931, he was appointed People's Commissar of Transport. In 1936, he was dismissed from the anti-revolutionary movement, and in 1937, he was expelled from the party.

The organizational units listed in this table include the organs of the Communist Party of China, the People's Congress and its Standing Committee, the People's Government, the Supervisory Committee, the People's Court, the People's Procuratorate, the committees of the People's Political Consultative Conference at all levels, the organs of the Democratic Party and the organs of people's organizations. Institutions are also included in this list. The units of the Central Military Commission, the People's Liberation Army of China, and the People's Armed Police Force of China at the regular and sub-war zone levels are also listed at the same time.

Huedong County, located in the east of Huizhou City, Guangdong Province, China, is divided by Huiyang County, hence the name, belongs to the jurisdiction of Huizhou City. In the southern end of Huidong, there is the Minoru Ping Peninsula, located between Shenzhen's Great Asian Bay and Shantou's Red Sea Bay. It is a large marine county, mountainous county in Guangdong Province, as well as a Pearl River Delta Economic Development Zone and a coastal economic development zone, enjoying a variety of preferential policies such as mountainous counties, island economic test zones and small-scale trade with Taiwan. The total land area of the county is 3535 square kilometers, the sea area is 3200 square kilometers; the permanent population is about 1.1 million, the household population is 839,000; the county people's government is located in Pingshan Subdistrict. Dissolved in 1958 by Huiyang County, repealed in 1959, since 1963 belongs to the jurisdiction of Huiyang Special District, the area of Huiyang, 1988 belongs to the jurisdiction of Huizhou City. Two subdistrict offices and 12 towns are under the jurisdiction of Huidong County: Pingshan Subdistrict, Daling Subdistrict, Baihua Town, Lianghua Town, Minoru Mountain Town, Tie Chung Town, Pinghai Town, Jilong Town, Huangbu Town, Taozhu Town, Andun Town, Takan Town, Baokou Town, Baibon Zhu Town, Guangdong Guangdong State Camp Huedong Lianghua Forestry Field, Guangdong Guangdong State Camp Huedong Kolong Feng Forestry Field, Huedong County Port Turtle Bay Nature Reserve, Lianhua Mountain Baibon Zhu Provincial Nature Reserve, Guangdong Guangdong Guangdong Guangdong Provincial Nature Reserve, Huedong County Pearl River Delta Industrial Transfer Park, Tatsun Lyu Beach Tourism Resort and Port Seaside Tourism Resort.

Second: 1380 kJ·mol−1 Niobium (pronounced, pronounced ) is a chemical element with the chemical symbol Nb, atomic number 41, atomic mass 7001929063700000000♠92.90637 u. Niobium was formerly known as Columbium (chemical symbol Cb) in the Americas, and in 1949 IUPAC decided to adopt its European name. Niobium is a soft, grey, extendable transition metal, commonly found in pyrochlore and columbite. It is named after the Greek mythical Niobe, the daughter of Tantalus. Niobium's chemical and physical properties are similar to those of plutonium, making it difficult to distinguish between the two.

By 1996, the Chinese Institute of Technology had grown into a large-scale college with 19 departments, a complete academic system, 5,500 people per day and night, nine school buildings, a gymnasium and an indoor sports arena, and held its first games.On August 1, 1997, the Chinese Institute of Technology changed its name to the University of China.In 2005, the Tourism College was established.It has eight faculty offices, student affairs office, general affairs office, research and development office, promotional education office, international and bilateral affairs office, admissions office, public affairs office, secretary office, personnel office, accounting office, military training room, sports room, etc., five rooms and the Chinese library, as well as an electronic computer center and library promotional education is one of the purposes of the establishment of the University of China.The promotional education center was established in 1992 and renamed Promotional Education Department in 1997.

Virgo (Latin: Virgo, astronomical symbol: ) is the largest constellation in the ecliptic belt, with an area of 1294.43 square degrees, accounting for 3.318% of the total area of the sky. It is the second largest of the 88 constellations in the sky, after Scorpio. There are 58 stars in Virgo with a magnitude of 5.5, the brightest being Capricorn I (α Virgo), with an apparent magnitude of 0.98. The center of Virgo passes through the upper middle of the sky on April 11 every year. The current autumn equinox is located near the right law enforcement (β Virgo).

High school graduated from St. Louis School, Honolulu, Hawaii, United States (1911) Sun Ko (October 20, 1891-September 13, 1973), Japanese: 哲生:2935. Sun Ko was born in Tsui Hen Village, Hawaii, in 1891. His mother was Sun Yat-sen and his wife Lu Mu-chung. In 1895, when Sun Ko was five years old, he moved with his grandmother Yang to Honolulu, Hawaii, United States. He completed high school at St. Louis School, Honolulu, and then went to California, United States, to study at the University of California, Berkeley, for a Bachelor of Arts degree, a Master of Laws degree from Columbia University, and an Honorary Doctor of Laws degree from Columbia University. He returned to China in 1917, where he served as Secretary to the Marshal's Office in Guangzhou.

Yan Jiang (Chinese: 嚴家寛; October 23, 1905 – December 24, 1993) was a Taiwanese politician. He was born in Wu County, Suzhou Province (now Suzhou City), and was a member of the Communist Party of China. He held important positions in successive governments and was an expert in finance. Yan Jiang attended Jiangsu Forestry Primary School (now Jiangsu Forestry Experimental Primary School) at an early age, and graduated from Shanghai St. John's University in 1926. In 1931, he was appointed as Director of Materials of the Railway Administration of Beijing, Shanghai and Hangzhou. In 1938, he was appointed as Director of the Construction Department of the Fujian Provincial Government. He made efforts to repair roads and rivers so that traffic in the province, which was disrupted by the Japanese occupation of the ports that imported foodstuffs, could continue. The following year, he was appointed as Director of the Finance Department. He was responsible for preparing wartime finance, eliminating 70 kinds of miscellaneous taxes, improving the provincial finance.

A stellar family is a group of stars in the Milky Way that is closer to the age, chemical composition, spatial distribution, and motion characteristics of the Milky Way. It was divided into three groups of stars in 1927 by P. Bruggencate, and in 1944 by the American astronomer Walter Bader. When observing stars in the Milky Way, it is possible to divide them into two categories: the first and the second (there is also a third group in theory, but it has not been discovered in the Milky Way). The classification standards are age, chemical composition, position in the galaxy, and spatial velocity. The main reason for this is that the different star families are different in their distribution on the Hertzsprung diagram, which is the same as when applied to clusters. In clusters, all members are considered to have the same source. Usually, the increase in the number of families (one, two, three) does not mean that the generations alternate, only distinguishes between each other's ages.

The People's Republic of the Congo (French: République populaire du Congo) was the name of the country from 1969 to 1991, and was the first socialist country in Africa. The People's Republic of the Congo was established in 1970 after the August Revolution of the Republic of the Congo, led by the Congolese Labour Party (Parti congolais du travail). In 1991, the People's Republic of the Congo changed its multi-party system and changed its name to the Republic of the Congo. From 13 to 15 August 1963, the "August Revolution", also known as the "Three Glorious Days", broke out in the Republic of the Congo.

The members of the Standing Committee of the First National People's Congress (Chairman, Vice-Chairman, Secretary-General and members) were elected at the first session of the First National People's Congress on September 27, 1954. There were 80 members, including the Chairman, 13 Vice-Chairmen, the Secretary-General and 65 members. 110 meetings of the Standing Committee were convened between September 1954 and April 1959. The composition of the Standing Committee is as follows: On August 1, 1957, at its 78th meeting, the Standing Committee of the First National People's Congress approved the Decision on the Problem of Labour Education. The aim of the Decision was to regulate "those who are idle, who violate the law and discipline, and who have a work force in which they are not engaged in their regular occupations." The main targets of the Decision were "those whose sentences are not sufficient to arrest and who are politically unsuitable for continued employment and who will increase unemployment in society."

In September 1925, in view of the growing number of members of the Communist Party of China engaged in military work, Wang Yifei, a returning student from Moscow Oriental University, proposed to General Secretary of the Central Committee Chen Duxiu the establishment of the Central Military Committee, which was accepted. At the end of September and beginning of October 1927, after the central organ moved from Wuhan to Shanghai, the members of the Military Committee also arrived in Shanghai. On November 14, the Standing Committee of the Provisional Politburo of the Communist Party of China convened in Shanghai decided to adjust the central organizational structure, without establishing a ministry, and to establish an organizational bureau under the Standing Committee of the Provisional Political Bureau of the Central Committee, composed of Luo Yannon, Zhou Enlai, and Li Weihan, which headed the departments of documents, transportation, accounting, organization, propaganda, investigation and publication, distribution, military, and special services, and the Women's Movement Committee.

The analytical protocol of the DOI is described in RFC 3652, RFC 3651 describes the naming mechanism, and RFC 3650 describes its architecture. The DOI analyzes identifiers through the Handle system, but in practice most of the applications are through web analytics, such as browsing the website https://doi.org/10.1000/182 to see the document information corresponding to the identifier 10.1000/182. The International DOI Foundation is a non-profit organization founded in 1998, is the administrative body of the DOI system, aimed at safeguarding the intellectual property related to the DOI system, promoting the use of the DOI and ensuring that all improvements to the DOI system (such as creation, maintenance, registration, analysis and related decisions) can be used by all registrants.

Sirius A is about 2.6 parsecs (8.6 light-years) from Earth, and is one of the nearest stars to Earth. Sirius A has twice the mass of the Sun, and an absolute magnitude of 1.42, 25 times brighter than the Sun. However, its luminosity is significantly darker than that of other bright stars, such as Old Man's Star or Saturn VII. This binary system has a history of about 200 to 300 million years, and was initially composed of two bright blue stars. Higher-mass Sirius B consumed energy to form a red giant, then gradually shredded the outer layer, collapsed about 120 million years ago into the state of today's white dwarf. In ancient Chinese astronomy, Sirius A is an evil star that is "a sign of the main invasion". Qu Yuan wrote in "The Song of the Ninth Dynasty" that "the arrows of Sirius will be raised to shoot Sirius", compared to Sirius in the northwest of Chu, and Su Shi in "The Hunting of Jiangcheng and Mizhou" that "the bow will be carved like a full moon, northwest view, shooting Sirius", compared to Sirius threatening Xixia on the northwest border of Northern Song Dynasty.

In 1982, he enrolled in the Second Artillery Command College Command Department, and graduated from the Second Artillery Command College Command Department. He is a senior general from the Second Artillery Force. He has served as a staff officer, chief of staff of the Training Unit, chief of staff of the Training Division, and deputy chief of staff of the brigade. In 1994, Wei Fenghe, aged 40, was promoted to the rank of colonel of a brigade of the Second Artillery. In 1997, he completed his degree in science. Since then, he has served as chief of staff of the 54th Base of the Second Artillery (located in Luoyang, Henan Province) and commander of the 53rd Base of the Second Artillery (located in Jiansu, Yunnan Province). In 2005, he was appointed deputy chief of staff of the Second Artillery. In 2006, he was promoted to chief of staff. In December 2010, he was appointed deputy chief of staff of the PLA. In October 2012, he succeeded Jiang Zhiyuan as commander of the Second Artillery Force of the People's Liberation Army. On December 31, 2015, he was appointed commander of the newly established Rocket Force of the People's Liberation Army.

Jiang Kai-ken (Chinese: 詹启賢; born July 9, 1948) is a Chinese politician of the Nationalist Party of China (NPC). He is the current chairman of Guangxue Engineering Co., Ltd., former vice chairman of the Nationalist Party of China (NPC), director of the Health Department, and chairman of the 228 Incident Memorial Foundation. Jiang Kai-ken was born into a family of doctors in Changhua City, Changhua County, and his family consists of about 20 doctors. Jiang Kai-ken's family includes several members from politics, including his brother Jiang Kai-zo, who served as mayor of Changhua County for two years; Jiang Kai-ken's four uncles Chen Dan-do and Chen's daughter-in-law Zhang Wen-tao, who served as mayor of Taichung City before and after. As a result, Jiang Kai-ken has deep ties with the elders and medical leaders of rural areas in the south of China. Famous anchor Jiang Qing-ling is Jiang Kai-ken's niece. In December 2016, Jiang Kai-ken, vice chairman of the Nationalist Party of China (NPC), and the Communist Party of China (CPC) negotiated to sign an administrative agreement, freeze nine checks of the Nationalist Party at Yongfeng Bank, issued 1.6 billion yuan to the Party's workers' allowance and pension, let the Central Party Department continue to lease for ten years, in exchange for the CPC, and transferred Xinyudai to the state. However, the Nationalist Party chairman Hong Xiu-zhu did not want to sign and broke up.

Xiang Kewu (Chinese: 熊克武; pinyin: Xīngfeng; December 26, 1885 – September 2, 1970) was a Chinese revolutionary, military commander of the People's Republic of China, and a political figure of the People's Republic of China. He was one of the leaders of the Kawan Army. Born into a family of doctors, Xiang Kewu was keen to study at an early age. In 1903, he entered the Eastern Literature College in Sichuan. At that time, he met prominent politicians and military commanders of the post-Republic era such as Dai Jitao. In the winter of the same year, with the financial assistance of his uncle, he went to study in Japan. First, he entered Dacheng Normal Secondary School, and later, he entered Dong Bin Academy to study military. While in Tokyo, Xiang Kewu met Sun Wen, and in August 1905, he participated in the organization of the Chinese League.

In 1895, he wrote a book on buses, which argued for reform of the system, advocated the effectiveness of the laws of Japan and Russia, and drastically changed the political and social system under the imperial rule. In 1898, with the support of Emperor Gwangju, the revolutionary party launched the Boshin Revolution. 103 days later, it went bankrupt because the Qing conservatives launched the Boshin Revolution. Some of the revolutionaries fled abroad, argued for the maintenance of the imperial family, implemented a constitutional system similar to the British monarchy, gradually transferred political real power to the elected government, called the "Pro-Imperial Party" or the "Constitutional Party." After the failure of the Boshin Revolution (1898), Empress Dowager Jixia seized power, Emperor Gwangju was imprisoned in Yingtai in the South China Sea. In 1899, the peace movement caused the invasion of China by the Eight Nations allied forces, the Qing "Saikai" Xi'an, forced Empress Dowager Jixia to return to Beijing and gradually implemented the new regime of the end of the Qing.

In the period of the Republic of China, the famous four-storey building for the sale of old clothes, on the sides of several hundred meters of the street, there are 67 old clothes stores, accounting for 91% of the old clothes stores in the city at that time.In 1929, Guangzhou demolished the city walls and built a road, rebuilt the straight street to Chinatown Road, but the five stalls still stand in the middle of the street, each stall is not equal to the distance of 230 meters, the architectural style is roughly the same, stone columns, stone curtains, stone beams, stone plaques, etc. are erected on top of each other, each stall has a shelf.The width of the three stone gates of each stall is not equal, the middle one is wider, can pass through the then medium-sized cars, the side gates on both sides can be crossed by rickshaws.Until 1947, Guangzhou city cars increased, accidents involving cars colliding with the stalls from time to time, the city government made a decision to move, the Guangzhou Labor Bureau spent a large amount of money to formulate a relocation plan.

Carthage (Finnish:  ; QRT ḤDŠT; Ancient Greek:Καρχηδών, Latin: Carthage, Arabic:قرطاج ) was a city located on the coast of North Africa (modern Tunisia) and overlooking the sea from Rome. The word Carthage in the Phoenician language reads "Qart-ḥadašt", meaning "new city", its early inhabitants were immigrants from the Canaanite city of Tyre (Tyre). In ancient Roman sources, Carthage is also called "Punici" (Latin: Punici). In the 8th century BC, the Phoenicians established Carthage City in North Africa, when Carthage City was still an overseas colony of the Phoenician city state of Tyre. In 650 BC, independent from Tyre, the city-state of Ancient Carthage was established.

It grows on dry rocks or bark and can be divided into stem, leaf, and shell tufts. Light-coupled algae (or blue bacteria) provide nutrients, fungi (usually of the fungal family, but a few of them of the fungal family) provide water and minerals, and provide protection against excessive evaporation of water. Tufts can grow under harsh environmental conditions, often pioneering the occupation of new land by organisms. Under extremely dry conditions, tufts can also remove water, enter a dormant state, wait for conditions to improve, and resume high-speed growth. Tufts can live, some with a lifespan of up to a thousand years. Tufts of tufts containing fungi and green algae (or blue-green bacteria) spread through the air and produce new tufts of asexual reproduction.

The lifetime of a family of asteroids is thought to be about one billion years in magnitude, but varies according to various factors (e.g., the smaller the family, the more likely it is to be lost). This is significantly shorter than the age of the Solar System, with only a few remnants of the early Solar System. The two main causes of family collapse are slow orbital dispersal caused by perturbations from Jupiter or other larger bodies, and collisions between asteroids and crushing them into smaller individuals. These tiny individuals are subject to the Yarkovsky effect, and are constantly pushed into the resonance orbit of Jupiter over time. Once they enter, they are quickly ejected into the main belt of small planets. Prospective estimates of the age range of some families range from less than a few million years to several billion years, such as the dense Karen family. Older families are thought to have only a small number of microscopic members, which is the basis for age determination.

Under the Constitution of the People's Republic of China, the functions and powers of the people's congress include legislative power, decision-making power, appointment and removal power, and supervision power. Under the Constitution of the People's Republic of China, the functions and powers of the people's congress include deliberation power, voting power, proposal power, and questioning power. In July 1979, the Election Law of the National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China and the local people's congresses at all levels was promulgated. Article 30 of the Law stipulates that all parties, groups, and voters may publicize their candidates in various forms. Subsequently, in the 1980 elections to the National People's Congress, students from many universities across the country launched a campaign. In response to this situation, Cheng Zihua, director of the Office for the Work of Direct Elections at the National Level and Minister of the Ministry of Civil Affairs, made direct criticism in September 1981.

In terms of gross domestic product (GDP) and per capita income, Aichi Prefecture ranks second only to Tokyo in Japan. Annual shipments of manufactured goods amounted to ¥48 trillion, ranking first in Japan for 44 consecutive years. In 2019, merchandise sales amounted to ¥33,729.20 billion, ranking third in Japan. Aichi Prefecture has a number of automobile companies, led by Toyota Motor Corporation. Toyota Motor Corporation was founded in 1937. After a period of high economic growth, Aichi Prefecture's automobile industry developed into a highly developed industry. The total domestic production in 2004 was ¥34,650.3 billion, accounting for 7.0% of Japan's GDP. The Five Cameras are a group of renowned companies in the Chubu business circles based in Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture, including Tokai Bank and Matsuzakaya, which were formerly owned by the Ito family, Nagoya Railway, Chubu Electric Power and Toho Gas Five Shosha.

Getúlio Dornelles Vargas (Portuguese pronunciation: ; April 19, 1882 – August 24, 1954) was a Brazilian lawyer and politician who served as President of Brazil from 1930 to 1945, as interim President from 1930 to 1934, as full President from 1934 to 1937, and as dictator from 1937 to 1945. After being overthrown in a coup d'état in 1945, Vargas regained power as elected President in 1951 and committed suicide in 1954. Vargas led Brazil for 18 and a half years, the longest-serving President in Brazilian history, second only to Emperor Pedro II among all Brazilian heads of state.

In 2001, the Guangdong Provincial Development Planning Commission approved the "Planning of the Intercity Rapid Railway Traffic Network in the Pearl River Delta". On October 11, 2002, the construction of the Qingqi Road Station of the Qingqi Road Subway Experimental Phase began, and the construction of the Qingqi Road Station began in October 2003. The construction of the Qingqi Road Station was originally scheduled for completion in 2007. However, due to financial problems, the construction of the Qingqi Road Line was suspended, and construction was resumed only in 2007. The opening ceremony was held at the construction site of the Xiannan Vehicle Section. On March 16, 2005, the State Council considered and approved in principle the "Planning of the Intercity Rapid Railway Traffic Network in the Bohai, Beijing, Jijiangsu, Yangtze River and Pearl River Delta Areas," in which the total distance of the intercity railway traffic in the Pearl River Delta area is about 600 km by 2020.

On 17 September 2014, the Transport and Housing Bureau announced the Railway Development Strategy 2014, which formally implemented the construction of the North Ring Line. It is initially expected that the construction will start in 2018 and the line will be operational in 2023. On 8 March 2018, the Chief Executive Officer of the Hong Kong Railways, Mr. Leung Kwok-kwon, said in the annual performance announcement meeting that the proposal for the North Ring Line has been submitted to the Special Administrative Region Government for consideration. In October 2019, the Chief Executive Officer, Mrs. Lam Chung-chung, mentioned the North Ring Line in her policy report, but there is still no concrete timetable. In November 2020, the Chief Executive Officer, Mrs. Lam Chung-chung, mentioned in her policy report that the implementation of the North Ring Line will be accelerated, in cooperation with public housing partnerships in the Gudong North New Development Area, and that the development of the New Estate, Ngau Tam Mei and Ngau Tau will be promoted. To date, the Government has sought out a total area of about 90 hectares (equivalent to four ancient towns) in the vicinity of the North Ring Line and has been conducting studies, including the New Estate/Rakuma Chau Junction. If the North Ring Line is implemented, the land is expected to bring in more than 70,000 housing units.

Mr. Shi Taifeng (September 1956-), male, Han Chinese, Shanxi Yusha citizen, politician of the People's Republic of China. He graduated from the Law Department of Peking University with a bachelor's degree in basic theory of law, a postgraduate degree in law, and a master's degree in law. He was an alternate member of the Eighteenth Central Committee and a member of the Nineteenth Central Committee. He served as vice-president of the Party Academy of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, deputy deputy secretary of the Jiangsu Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China, secretary of the Suzhou Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China, governor of the Jiangsu People's Government, secretary of the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region of the Communist Party of China, secretary of the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region of the Communist Party of China. He is currently a member of the Politburo of the Communist Party of China, secretary of the Central Secretariat, minister of the Central War Department, president of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, and secretary of the Party Group. Mr. Shi Taifeng joined the Communist Party of China in May 1974, and was appointed Jiao Qing of Dazhai Public Company in Yusha County, Shanxi Province. In September 1975, he studied at Shanxi Machine Tool Factory Technical School. In July 1977, he became the fifth workshop worker of Shanxi Machine Tool Factory.

The Mining Bureau of the Ministry of Economic Affairs of Taiwan classifies granite into six categories: black, brown, green, grey-white, light red and deep red. Granite is a very widely distributed type of rock. Granite is produced in many countries in the world. 9% of China's land (more than 800,000 square kilometers) is made of granite rock. In the summer of 1900, Guo Weijun fell ill with malaria and had to leave school. He recovered by October, but had missed the second term, so, under the advice of his brother-in-law, he enrolled in St. John's College. In early 1904, St. John adjusted the Chinese teachers and reformed the discourse in the school. Zhaoqing's nephew, Zhang Yuan, and his classmates, Zhang Yuan and Guo, prepared to study in the United States, and Guo Weijun accompanied them. After the decision was made, Guo Weijun was sent to the United States. In August 1904, Zhaoqing was sent to the United States by Zhaoqing's commanders and Zhaoqing's three brothers, Zhu Pongzhen, Sun Jiao, and Yang Shuqing. He and Sun Jiao went to Cook's College in New York. In September 1905, Guo Weijun was admitted to Columbia University, majoring in politics and diplomacy. In the winter of 1906, the Five Foreign Ministers went to the United States, and Guo Weijun accompanied them as president of the Chinese Students' Association in New York. While at Columbia, Guo Weijun participated in lectures and debates hosted by the Law Society, and was also editor of The Observer and Columbia Monthly.

The Honorary President of the People's Republic of China is an honorary title conferred by a decision of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China. Mr. Song Qingling, who served as Acting Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress and Vice-Chairman of the People's Republic of China, is the only recipient of this title to date. On May 16, 1981, at the 18th meeting of the Standing Committee of the Fifth National People's Congress, the Decision Concerning the Conferment of the Honorary Title of the Honorary President of the People's Republic of China on Comrade Song Qingling was adopted.

The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is an island nation in the Caribbean Sea, located on the island of Spain, along with western Haiti. It has a land area of 48,670 square kilometers, the capital and largest city is Santo Domingo, the official language is Spanish, and the currency is Dominican pesos. According to the Central Intelligence Agency of the United States, the per capita GDP (computed by purchasing power parity) in 2013 is about $9,700. Its current president is Luis Abinadir. Dominica was originally a place where the Arawak people lived, such as the Teno people. After Columbus set foot on the island of Spain in 1492, the present part of Dominica was ruled by Spain for more than three hundred years until 1821, during which time it was briefly ruled by France between 1795 and 1801, the main ethnic group being the descendants of Spanish colonists and native peoples of mixed blood.

Taiwan was under Spanish rule from 1626 to 1642, during the Spanish Empire's 16 years of colonial rule in northern Taiwan. Administratively, it belonged to the Governorate of the Philippines under the jurisdiction of the Governor-General of New Spain. Although Taiwan was very close to Luzon Island, which was already the map of the Spanish Empire, the Spaniards did not completely occupy Taiwan, but allowed the Dutch Republic to take the lead. It was not until 1626, in order to break the Dutch trade blockade against Manila, that the troops went to the chicken coop, and gradually conquered northern Taiwan. However, the Spaniards were unable to expel the Dutch, nor could they earn enough profits to maintain the expenses of the garrison, but instead needed Manila to support the operation of northern Taiwan. 162. Therefore, after the recession of Manila, the Spaniards reduced the garrison, giving the Dutch a chance. Finally, in 1642, the Dutch captured the chicken coop, ending the Spanish rule.

In astronomy or planetary science, a freezing line is a specific distance from the central protostar in a solar nebula, where it is cold enough to condense volatile compounds such as water, ammonia, methane, carbon dioxide and carbon monoxide into solid ice particles. Different volatile substances have different condensing temperatures under different pressures (and therefore different densities) in different parts of the protostar nebula, so their respective freezing line positions vary. The actual distance and temperature of the freezing line depend on the physical models used to calculate the water ice and the solar nebula models: With the evolution of the nebula, the position of the condensing/evaporation frontier also changes over time. Sometimes, the term snow line is also used to indicate the distance at which water ice can still exist stably even under sunlight. During the formation of the Solar System, the distance of the snow line is different from the current distance, roughly equal to 5 AU, and the energy radiated by the Sun itself is lower than it is today.

Mexico's economy is closely linked to its North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) trading partners, particularly the United States. Mexico is a member of the United Nations, the World Trade Organization, the G20 summit and the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD), and since 2014 has been an observer of the International Organization of the Francophonie. Mexico is the birthplace of many American civilizations, including Maya, Toltec and Aztec civilizations, which developed into the largest nation in pre-Columbian North America, the Aztec Empire. In the early 16th century, the Spaniards invaded Mexico, defeating the local Aztecs in 1521. Mexico was colonized by Spain and became part of New Spain. In 1810, Mexico declared independence, and established the First Mexican Empire after the Mexican War of Independence. In 1823, the empire was overthrown by a military coup, and the United Mexican States was established in 1824.

With the establishment of the Commonwealth of Australia in 1901, Queensland became one of the six states of the Commonwealth of Australia. In northeastern Australia, the more developed region is the southeastern part of Queensland, which borders New South Wales, with its capital, Brisbane, and the Gold Coast, and its coastal cities. To the north of Queensland is Cape York, which is relatively close to Papua New Guinea, and to the northeast is the famous Great Barrier Reef; to the east is the vast interior plain; to the east is the South Pacific Ocean; to the west are the inland and northern territories, bounded by 138 degrees east and divided by the Great Divide on the east coast; to the southwest is the border with South Australia, bounded by 29 degrees south; and to the southwest is the border with South Australia. Queensland's territorial waters and seas cover an area of 121,991 square kilometres, or 6.58 percent of the total area. The highest mountain is Mount Bartle Frere, which is 1,622 metres high.

District head refers to the chief executive of a district government. Originally, it was the chief executive of a district under the jurisdiction of a national government established in the 1920s. In 1929, Article 28 of the District Organization Law stipulated that "district offices shall be established, a chief executive shall be appointed, and autonomous affairs of the district shall be administered." After the division of the two sides of the Taiwan Strait in 1949, the Republic of China no longer has a district under the jurisdiction of a county, and the People's Republic of China only has Yunnanshan District. Currently, in the administrative system of the People's Republic of China, a district head is the chief executive of a district under the jurisdiction of a municipality. On the mainland of China, a district head is the highest leader of a district people's government. A district under the jurisdiction of a municipality under the direct jurisdiction of a municipality or a district at the lower level. Therefore, the district head is lower than the mayor of a municipality under the direct jurisdiction of a municipality or a district at the lower level, is on par with the mayors of a county and a county-level city, and is higher than the mayors of a township and a township. The Pudong and Binhai new districts are commonly referred to as sub-provincial districts because of their high administrative status. District heads are often appointed as sub-provincial ministerial officials.

On July 21, the "Marine School relocated to Qinghai is generally ready, and the existing 600 cadets are continuing to come to Qinghai." The Central Naval Officers Training School relocated to Qinghai, the headmaster was concurrently appointed by Chiang Kai-shek, the vice-headmaster was appointed by Chen Cheng, the Vice-Commander-in-Chief of the Navy, Qing Gui was appointed as the headmaster, Vice-Chancellor Wei Jimin (Vice-Chief of the Navy Staff) was stationed in Qinghai to supervise the school, and officially opened on April 15, 1947. Before September 1947, the Shanghai part of the Naval Officers Training School was completed, the total number of cadets was 600, with the exception of some who had been dispatched to ships and factories for internships, the remaining 345 cadets were continuing to come to Qinghai. Granite is the most common type of stone on the Finnish rock surface. When the nominating committee for each Finnish administrative region selected a representative stone in 1989, it was unanimously determined that granite, by virtue of its unique status, deserved to represent the whole of Finland. Granite is deep acidic pyroclastic rock formed by the condensation of magma in the depths of the ground, and some granites are schists or mixed rocks of magma and sedimentary rocks formed by metamorphosis. According to the average proportion of different chemical compositions in the 2485 granites in the world, the weight percentages range from heavy to light: the mineral composition of different varieties is not uniform, and there may also be pyrite and hornblende.

The President is elected directly by the people of South Australia for a four-year term, renewable once. The South Australia Township and Country Council is the supreme decision-making body for the countryside. Under the President, there are seven internal units, including five divisions and two rooms. The South Australia Country Council is the supreme public institution of South Australia, representing the legislation and supervision of the countryside for all the people of South Australia. The countryside representatives are elected directly by the citizens for a four-year term, renewable once. The South Australia Country Council has seven countryside representatives, namely, three countryside representatives for the first constituency, two countryside representatives for the second constituency, one countryside representative for the third constituency, one countryside representative for the fourth constituency, and the President and Vice-President are elected by seven countryside representatives.

Ewha Womans University (Korean:이화여자대학교/梨花女子大学校 ihwayeojadaehaggyo, English: Ewha Womans University) is one of the oldest universities in Seoul, Korea. Founded in 1886, it was the first women's university in Korea. Originally named Ewha College, it was named by the Joseon Dynasty in memory of the wife of Dr. Sranton, the founder of women's education in Korea. It was renamed Ewha Womans University in 1948. Ewha Womans University is also considered to be the best women's university in Korea. Located in Daehyun-dong, Seodaemun-gu, Seoul, the university still preserves many ancient buildings, the most representative of which is the Welch-Ryang Auditorium (formerly the Christian Church).

Copper oxidized to copper green is often used on the roofs of buildings. Copper is sometimes used in decorative arts, and both elemental and compound forms of copper are used. Copper compounds are also used as fungicides, fungicides and wood preservatives. Copper is a micronutrient necessary for all living things, as it is an important component of the cytochrome c oxidase, a respiratory enzyme complex. In molluscs and crustaceans, copper is a component of the blood pigment hemocyanin, and in fish or other vertebrates, it is replaced by the iron hemoglobin complex. In humans, copper is mainly found in the liver, muscle, and skeleton. Copper is in the 11th family of the periodic table, along with silver and gold, which share common characteristics of high expansion and good electrical conductivity.

In addition, mass can also be measured by measuring the orbital perturbations between large asteroids. Although these perturbations are very small, they can be accurately measured by radar data obtained from Earth and Mars surface detectors such as the Voyager. Except for a few asteroids that have been studied, the density of most asteroids depends on reasonable guesswork. Most asteroids have a density ρ of ~2 g/cm3. However, it is better to infer their density by examining the spectral types of asteroids. Recent papers have hypothesized that the densities of C, S, and M-type asteroids are 1.38, 2.71, and 5.32 g/cm3, respectively, where "C" includes the Sauron class C, D, P, T, B, G, and F; S includes the Sauron class S, K, Q, V, R, A, and E. Using these density values is a better hypothesis than the current assumption of ~2 g/cm3.

Ramón del Fierro Magsaysay (August 31, 1907 – March 17, 1957) was the seventh President of the Philippines, serving from 1953 to 1957. He died in a 1957 crash in a Douglas C-47 transport aircraft in the Department of Postal Services. Originally an auto mechanic, Magsaysay was a leader of the Philippine guerrillas during the Pacific War, and was later appointed as the military head of the Department of Trinidad and Tobago. After the war, he was re-elected to two Liberal Party congresses, and twice served as Minister of Defense in the government of Elpidio Quirino. Ramón Magsaysay was born August 31, 1907 in the municipality of Iba, Trinidad and Tobago, the son of Exequiel Magsaysay (1874–1968), a blacksmith, and Perfecta del Fierro (1887–1980), a schoolteacher.

In the late Neolithic period, about 10,000 to 4,000 years ago, primitive humans began to flourish in the Huizhou area, engaged in fishing and primitive farming. At present, 28 ancient sites such as Sangang sites, ancient cave sites and other sites have been found in the whole territory of Huizhou. Among them are the Baekchu sites such as Boro Gourling, Suyagang, Hoyagang, excavated a large number of stone tools and ceramic pieces. During the Warring States period, in the territory of Boro County in Huizhou, there was an ancient country called Banlu, "Lu Shu Chunqiu" is recorded, said: "Banlu, Yangyu, Shodo no Kun, do no Kun." In 1993, during the construction of the Guanghui Expressway, more than 300 ancient tombs were found in the mountain of Hengling in Boro County, mostly belonging to the Zhou Dynasty, excavated a large number of ceramics, primitive porcelain, bronze, jade stone, iron, etc.

Greece is a democracy, developed and high-income economy with a high quality of life and a very high human development index. Greece is a founding member of the United Nations, the 10th member of the European Community (the predecessor of the European Union), and a member of the euro area since 2001. It is also a member of a number of international organizations, including the European Commission, the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development, the World Trade Organization, the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe, and the International Organization of the Francophone Community. Greece's unique cultural, tourism, shipping and strategic position ranks it among the Middle-Eastern powers. According to archaeological evidence, Greece was inhabited by humans around the middle of the Paleolithic period about 200,000 years ago. About 3200 BC, the Bronze Age Greece conceived Europe's oldest civilizations: the Minoan civilization (on Crete), the Cichlid civilization (on the Cichlid Islands) and the Hellas civilization (on the Greek mainland).

After the establishment of the Preparatory Office, Professor Wang Xiao Lin and others of the Faculty of Architecture of Fengjia University carried out the planning, the construction of the school building was undertaken by the Housing and Urban Development Bureau of the Taiwan Provincial Government, and then designed by Lin Dongyi Architects Office of Taipei City. At the beginning of the establishment, due to the significant disparity between the number of female students enrolled in Taichung Middle School and the number of male students enrolled in Taichung First Middle School, in order to balance the gender enrolment rights, Wenhua High School admitted only female students for the first time, but in order to take into account the enrolment rights of male students in the vicinity of the school district, a small number of male students were enrolled from the second year onwards, and subsequently it gradually became a co-education system. The ratio of male and female students was 1:3.5 in the early years (about the opposite of Taichung Secondary School at the time), and in recent years, the ratio of enrollment of male and female students has been adjusted, and is now approaching the ratio of 1:2.

After the establishment of the People's Republic of China in 1949, the establishment of towns lacked unified regulations and the town-building system was excessive. By the end of 1954, there were 5,400 towns in the country, of which 920 had a population below 2,000, 2,302 had a population between 2,000 and 5,000, 1,373 had a population between 5,000 and 10,000, 784 had a population between 10,000 and 50,000 and 21 had a population above 50,000. In June 1955, the State Council issued the Decision on the Establishment of Municipalities and Town-building System, which clarified the standards for the establishment of towns. In both the 1975 and 1978 Constitutions, the town-building system was abolished, while the town-building system was retained. By the end of 1978, there were only 2,173 towns in the country.

The English astronomer Francis Bayer used Bayer's nomenclature to allocate only the Greek letters to the four eagle stars, with 44 stars in total, many of which lie on the constellation boundary of Ursae Major. The fourth brightest star in the constellation is the fourth brightest star in the constellation of Ursae Major at 3.14 magnitudes. Ursae Major is rich in binary stars. The fourth brightest star in the constellation of Ursae Major is the third brightest star in the constellation of Ursae Major at 3.97 magnitudes. The fourth brightest star in the constellation of Ursae Major is the third brightest star in the constellation of Ursae Major, which was formally assigned to the constellation of Ursae Major after the boundary of the constellation was defined in 1930: 433–34.

The new currency is the Australian dollar, which is equal to half a pound (10 shillings) of the old Australian pound. Every cent is equal to 100 cents, and a cent is roughly equal to 1.2 old pence. Since 1995, Australia has adopted plastic paper money, which is less tear-resistant, more durable and more aesthetic than in the past. In addition, the various denominations are designed with distinctive transparent "windows" and were the first countries in the world to adopt this new design. In 1966, Australia began issuing denominations of 1, 2, 5, 10, 20 and 50 cents, 50 cents containing high purity (80%) silver, which were recalled a year later because the government found that the denominations of these silver coins did not contain any silver coins. In 1984, the one-cent coin was introduced, in 1988, the two-cent coin was introduced. In 1992, the one-cent and two-cent coins ceased to circulate. The 40th anniversary of the coins' introduction and the 40th anniversary of the introduction of the decimal system, i.e. in 2006, a set of no longer circulating one- and two-cent coins was specially released.

Fleet size and standards, Length: 16.5 m, Width: 4.4 m, Seats: 43. From May 26 to July 29, 2012, the first fishing holiday was held. Due to the enthusiastic response from all sectors of society, tickets for all flights were sold out quickly, and the same activity was held every year. In 2020, the activity was suspended due to the outbreak of the new crown virus. Only three flights were operated every year during the first two months of the summer. The route starts from Qingzhou Tong, passes through Inner Harbour to Guanyin Flower Garden opposite the opening of the sea. Along the way, apart from the sights of Inner Harbour, Macau Mausoleum, Macau Tourism Tower, Guanyin Flower Garden and Macau Science Museum, fishing professionals were on board, introducing fishing boats to the sea and the living conditions of fishermen, promoting the local fishing tradition and Macau maritime cultural characteristics through tourism activities. The organizers are operated by the Macau Fishermen's Mutual Association, the ticket price is 40 Macau dollars.

Ice: Jupiter is the fifth-closest planet to the Sun, and the largest planet in the Solar System, with 80 known moons. Astronomers have long discovered that Jupiter is a giant planet, one thousandth the mass of the Sun, but 2.5 times the mass of all other planets in the Solar System. Of the planets in the Solar System, Jupiter and Saturn are gas giants (Urania and Neptune are ice giants). From Earth's perspective, Jupiter, with an apparent magnitude of -2.94, is already able to cast a shadow, making it the third-brightest object in the night sky on average, after the Moon and Venus (Mars can be briefly compared to Jupiter's luminosity at certain points in its orbit).

Henry Lewis Stimson (September 21, 1867 – October 20, 1950) was an American politician who served as Secretary of War, Governor of the Philippines, and Secretary of State of the United States. In 1906, Theodore Roosevelt appointed him United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York. In 1910, he ran unsuccessfully for Governor of New York on behalf of the Republican Party. In 1911, William Howard Taft resigned as Secretary of War. At the outbreak of World War I, he was responsible for helping the people of Belgium. When the United States became a belligerent nation, he served as commander of the artillery in France. In 1927, Calvin Coolidge appointed him to Nicaragua.

Lingnan Pass (Chinese: 嶺南通) is a regional interconnected interchange bus card system in Guangdong Province. "Lingnan Pass" is deployed by the Guangdong Provincial Executive Committee of the Communist Party of China, Guangdong Provincial Transportation Bureau, Guangdong Province, Guangdong Lingnan Pass Co., Ltd. jointly operates all cities in Guangdong Province, can be used in 21 cities of Guangdong Province. Lingnan Pass currently has the following forms of ticket card issuance: the card with Lingnan Pass wallet is also called "Guangdong Provincial Interconnected Bus Card", "Provincial Sign Card". Lingnan Pass wallet can be used in 21 local cities in Guangdong Province, can also be used in various parts of Lingnan Pass value-added network points and small consumption of cooperative businesses. Lingnan Pass system based on the development of the Yangcheng Pass system, for compatibility with old readers, early issued cards were mostly M1 cards and CPU cards with simulated M1 applications. Due to Shenzhen and Dongguan buses do not accept Lingnan Pass simulated M1 applications.

After the arrival of the Magellan expedition in 1521, the Spaniards occupied the Philippines from 1565 to 1571, during which time the navigator Lopes named the islands after the Crown Prince (Spanish: las Felipinas) and ruled for more than 300 years. At the end of the 19th century, the Philippines experienced the Spanish Revolution, the Mexican–American War and the Mexican–American War, became a U.S. colony, was occupied by Japan during World War II, and gained independence in 1946 after the war. Since independence, the Philippines has experienced several times of rapid economic growth, however, political turmoil, corruption problems and social instability have been a major obstacle to its development. In addition, there is a serious disparity between rich and poor in the country. However, in recent years, the Philippines' economy has improved, overseas migrant workers have been returning home, especially in the northern islands, and the construction of Manila has reached the level of emerging countries. The country was named the Four Tigers of Asia before the financial storm.

Windows are an important widget in several graphical user interfaces, including VMS's DEC Windows, the GNU/Unix-like X Window System, Microsoft Windows, and Open Windows. The concept was developed and implemented by SRI International (led by Douglas Engelbart). The research continued at Xerox' Palo Alto Research Center / PARC (led by Alan Kay). They used overlapping windows. In the 1980s, PARC coined the term "WIMP", representing windows, icons, menus, and pointers, respectively.

Established in 1974, the National Taiwan Comprehensive Hospital was established by a donation from the National Taiwan Foundation. Currently, it has three hospitals and one clinic. The National Taiwan Comprehensive Hospital opened on February 15, 1977. Due to the establishment of cooperation with the National Taiwan University Medical School and the National Taiwan University Medical School Affiliated Hospital, it has laid a good foundation. At the beginning of the establishment, it was planned to have 300 general hospital beds, initially opened 180 beds, and in conjunction with the Taiwan University Medical School, implemented a doctor-on-demand system, provided both doctors at Taiwan University Hospital and improved medical standards. The National Taiwan Comprehensive Hospital (Headquarters) completed expansion projects in 1984, 1986 and 1995, respectively, and the number of hospital beds increased to 600 beds. In October 1997, the Inner Lake Branch Hospital was officially established, with 100 general hospital beds and an additional psychiatric department.

The Central African Republic (French: République centrafricaine; Sango: Ködörösêse tî Bêafrîka), commonly known as Central Africa, is a country in central Africa. It is an inland country bordering Cameroon, Chad, the Sudan, South Sudan, the Democratic Republic of the Congo and the Republic of the Congo, respectively, from the west. It was established in December 1958 as a semi-autonomous government and declared independence on 13 August 1960. The capital, Bangui, is a border city on the banks of the Oubangui River. Formerly known as the Territoire d'Oubangui-Chari, it is one of the French colonies in Africa.

On January 20, 1964, a coup d'état took place in the Tanganyika army, demanding the Africanization of the armed forces (after independence, the commanders and officers at all levels of the armed forces were still British) and the improvement of treatment, and preparations for taking over the government. This coup d'état also caused a chain reaction in Uganda and Kenya, shocking the East African political situation. At the request of Nyerere, the British intervened in order to suppress the coup d'état in the three East African countries. At the same time, the exiled soldiers were completely non-cultural Ugandans, had no definite political objectives, and did not present a political agenda. They both opposed the current government and did not take over the government. Moreover, the coup d'état did not gain the understanding and support of the broad masses of the population, which was one of the main reasons for the failure of the coup d'état. Later, the government of Nyerere adopted a cautious and tolerant policy towards the treatment of the exiled soldiers and the opposition (the opposition leaders contacted the exiled soldiers during the coup d'état, encouraged the leaders of the coup d'état to overthrow the government of Nyerere and establish a new government).

Dorado is a constellation in the Southern Hemisphere. It is one of the twelve constellations named by the Dutch navigators Keizer and Houtman between 1595 and 1597, and was included in John Bayer's Astronomical Survey in 1603. It symbolizes the sea creature Dorado. Most of the Milky Way's companion galaxy, the Large Magellanic Cloud, is in Dorado, while the rest is in Sagittarius. In addition, the Southern Hemisphere (see the Ecliptic Coordinate System) is also in Dorado. Because Dorado contains part of the Large Magellanic Cloud, the area is also rich in deep-sky objects. All of the following celestial coordinates follow the J2000.0 epoch. Equatorial coordinates: 05h 00m 00s, −65° 00′ 00′′.

During the Russo-Japanese War, the Japanese Army discovered that the Type 30 rifle was insufficiently protected against sandstorms, so they added a dust cover to the ejection port, which was the Type 38 rifle. By the time of the Sino-Japanese War, the Japanese soldiers on the front line no longer needed the Type 30 rifle, but instead used it as a guard rifle for the rear guard units. The Type 30 Cavalry Rifle is a shortened version of the Type 30 rifle, with a shortened barrel length of about 300 mm, a barrel length of about 480 mm, and no bayonet. The Type 35 Navy Rifle is a modified version of the Type 30 rifle in charge of the Southern Kijiro, equipped with a small amount of Japanese troops, mainly for the Marine Corps.

In January 1996, Larry Page and Sergey Brin, Ph.D. students at Stanford University in California, began researching a research project on search. On September 15, 1997, they registered a Google domain name. Page and Brin's earliest investment in the Google project came in August 1998, when Andy Batesheim, co-founder of Sun Microsystems, gave them a $100,000 check for the development and operation of the search engine, at a time when Google was not yet established. Google held its first public offering on August 19, 2004, and issued 19,605,052 shares worth $85 each. It is suspected that Google's corporate culture will inevitably change as a result of pressure from boards of directors or executive wealth.

The Guangzhou Mercantile Exchange Incident (Chinese: 广州商团事件) was a military incident that occurred on October 10, 1924, when a bloody conflict broke out between the Guangzhou Mercantile Exchange and Sun Yat-sen's Guangzhou Military Government. The Guangzhou Military Government referred to it as the Guangzhou Mercantile Exchange Rebellion, and the Guangzhou Mercantile Exchange referred to it as the Sichuan Massacre and the Sichuan Massacre. However, neither the British Government nor the North and South Warlords gave the Mercantile Exchange any substantial assistance. The Mercantile Exchange is not a popular force in the general sense, it only represents and defends the interests of the merchants. The Mercantile Exchange is indeed a weaker party when there is a conflict with the government and the warlords. However, in the 1920s, when labor-management conflicts intensified and workers' movements arose, the Mercantile Exchange often used violence against workers who are weaker than the merchants, so that the Mercantile Exchange and the workers were bitterly displeased. Most workers not only disagreed with the Mercantile Exchange, but also actively demanded that the government adopt a tougher policy towards it.

A legislative body, also known as a legislative branch, is a governmental body responsible for deliberating and enacting laws. It is a consultative body, usually composed of citizens proportional to the population of the country in which it is located. In addition to enacting, amending and repealing laws, it is usually responsible for various acts (such as approving the government's public budgetary requirements), supervising the government's operations (such as hearing government reports and inquiries, holding hearings or hearings). Legislative bodies at the national level, for example, are also responsible for declaring war, making peace, ratifying treaties, ratifying states of emergency, electing and deposing senior government officials, and even abolishing the powers of heads of state. In addition to states, some intergovernmental international organizations also have legislative bodies, such as the European Union.

In 1928, during the Second Northern Expedition of the National Government, Chiang Kai-shek, Li Zon-lin, Yan Xishan Jin, and Feng Yuxiang of the Northwest Coalition, together with a combined force of 400,000 troops, successfully defeated the Feng Coalition and occupied northern China. Zhang Shaolin retreated to the northeast and was assassinated by the Japanese. The victory of the National Government led the leader of the Northeast Army, Zhang Xue-liang, to proclaim the "Northeast Yi banner" and to obey the National Government, so that the National Government formally unified the whole country. At that time, the forces of the New Gui Coalition expanded to Hebei, and their power was enormous. After the reunification of the Nanjing National Government, the four factions each supported hundreds of thousands of troops, stationed in several provinces. Under the leadership of Chiang Kai-shek, the National Government convened the "Good Afterwards Contingency Conference" in the name of rest and post-war demobilization, with the intention of disarmament. At that time, the New Gui Coalition was supported by the chairman of the Guangzhou Political Subcommittee, Li Jishen, and its forces quickly expanded to Guangxi, Hunan, Hubei, and Hebei Mountain Customs to the Tianjin area: 472.

The effective range of a rifle varies between 300 m and more than 1000 m depending on the type of weapon and the application requirements, can be equipped with tactical accessories such as sights, lasers, hand-held lights, scaffolds, and can also be equipped with bayonets for melee combat. Some rifles can also fire grenades and armour piercing bullets, with a certain degree of surface-to-surface killing and anti-armor capability. Although few carbines (such as the Beretta Cx4 Storm and the Kel-Tec SUB-2000) fire pistol bullets, modern rifles generally use specialized rifle bullets. The typical feature of a rifle bullet is its large overall shape, but the bullet head diameter is generally smaller, the barrel longer and coarser and cylindrical. A rifle bullet uses a coarser particle emission agent to extend the burning time, can burn completely in the longer barrel and reduce recoil, the muzzle velocity is generally over 1,000 joules, the initial velocity is in the range of 600 to 1,000 m/s (2,000 to 3,300 ft/s), the power is much greater than that of a pistol bullet, can be fired at hundreds of meters and can kill large animals, including humans.

In 1931, the Communist Party of China established the Chinese Soviet Republic in Jiangxi, and won four victories in the war against the encirclement. In 1933, Chiang Kai-shek mobilized a million state troops to wage the fifth anti-communist war against the various bases of the Red Army. The war was protracted, the Red Army was in a disadvantageous situation, and heavy losses were incurred. From 1934 to 1935, the main branches of the Red Army were forced to abandon their bases and carry out strategic shifts. However, they also left a small number of troops as restraint forces, and continued to wage guerrilla warfare with the state army in the area of the original bases. After the Xi'an Incident in late 1936, the Communist Party of China and the national government, which was dominated by the Chinese Kuomintang, reached a reconciliation and decided to establish a national unity front against Japan. In July 1937, the anti-Japanese war broke out in its entirety. According to the agreements negotiated between the two parties of the Communist Party of China, the Red Army and guerrilla units in eight provinces, including Jiangxi, Fujian, Guangdong, Hunan, Hubei, Henan, Zhejiang and Anhui, were reorganized into the National Revolutionary Army's newly formed Fourth Army, or the National Revolutionary Army's newly formed Fourth Army, abbreviated as the New Fourth Army.

Zedenberger worked for a long time near the mountain and learned how to deal with potential competitors. However, he did not eliminate many of his competitors, mainly Dashi Danba in 1959, Dalam Tumur in 1962, Lubsanzelen Tsang in 1963, the "Lokhoz, Ningbo, Sulmazab Anti-Party Group" in 1964, Bazar Sirindyub in 1982, and Sampil Zalan Azab in 1983. All of them were exiled to Mongolia, but not executed. During his tenure, Zedenberger deepened his status as a sovereign state of Mongolia, established diplomatic relations with 130 countries, and joined the United Nations in 1961. On 23 August 1984, the extraordinary plenary session of the Central Committee of the Mongolian People's Revolution dismissed Zed Zedenberger as General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Mongolian People's Revolution and a member of the Political Bureau.

Comrade Song Qingling, who followed the great revolutionary Mr. Sun Yat-sen in his early years, remained steadfastly committed to China's national liberation and the cause of the people's liberation, and was one of the founders of the People's Republic of China. She was elected Vice-Chairman of the Central People's Government at the beginning of the founding of the country, and continued to be elected Vice-Chairman of the People's Republic of China in 1959 and 1965. For the past seventy years, she has consistently stood firmly with the people of all Chinese ethnic groups in the cause of the People's Democratic Revolution and the socialist revolution and the socialist construction of China. She is a beloved leader of the people of all Chinese ethnic groups, including Taiwan compatriots and overseas expatriates, and a great fighter of world-renowned patriotism, democracy, internationalism, and communism. She has been widely admired by people from all over China and abroad in the cause of developing friendship among peoples, promoting a progressive culture, and defending world peace.
