Dynamic models of stars in galaxies or clusters of stars are often compared or tested against stellar kinematics data to study their evolutionary history and mass distribution, and they are used to detect the presence of dark matter or supermassive black holes through the effects of gravity on the orbits of stars. Quantities of motional velocity of stars towards or away from the Sun are called radial velocities, which can be measured from the Doppler effect of the spectrum. Transverse or proper motion requires a series of positional observations of distant background objects. Once a star's distance is determined by other measurement methods, such as parallax, the velocity of space can be calculated. The motion of the Sun relative to the local stationary standard is called peculiar solar motion. The spatial velocity components of the galactic coordinate system in the Milky Way are usually denoted by U, V, and W, in units of km/s, U in the direction of the center of the galaxy, V in the direction of the rotation of the galaxy, and W in the direction of the north pole of the galaxy.

The crossing of the cold front often brings short rainfall, sudden drops in temperature and dew point; after the cold front, the wind turns clear, often blowing from the east or north, and the weather is clear for about one or two days. When the northern anticyclone moves east from the land mass, the above situation repeats itself. Two cold flows to Hong Kong, usually about 5 to 10 days apart. Fog is common in spring. Because the sea temperature near Hong Kong continues to rise, there is very little fog in May. Layer clouds, common in late winter and early spring, also gradually become cloudy, precipitation is also dominated by sudden rainfall and thunderstorms. Because the hot air begins to move north, the cold air is often still wandering, in addition, the speed of land, water and air temperature rise is different, spring is the most rainy season in many parts of the world. There is a famous rainy season in southern China, there are often strong storms in Europe, and tornadoes often occur in North America.

In 1969, the Supreme Revolutionary Council seized power and established the Democratic Republic of Somalia, during which the war with Ethiopia broke out but was unsuccessful. In 1991, the overthrow of the regime of Siad Barre, which plunged Somalia into civil war, the declaration of independence of northern Somaliland, during which most areas of customary and Islamic law were restored. In the early 2000s, many interim federal governments were created, and a transitional national government was formed in 2000. Following the signing of the 2004 Nairobi Comprehensive Agreement, Somalia established a transitional government. By mid-2012, the rebels had lost most of the territory they had occupied, a new interim constitution was adopted in August 2012, an eight-year transitional period ended on August 23, 2012, a president was elected on August 29, a new president was elected by universal suffrage on September 10, a presidential cabinet was elected on September 17, with the approval of the federal parliament, and on September 21, Somalia was transformed into a federal state with autonomy for all member states, while constitutional government was restored.

On March 6, 1927, the right-wing military officers under the command of Ni Bi, the representative of the Nationalist Party of China in the First Division of the National Revolutionary Army, shot and killed the vice-chairman of the Jiangxi Provincial General Workers' Council and the chairman of the Ganzhou General Workers' Council, Chen Zhenxian. Subsequently, the Chiang Kai-shek government continued to destroy the party's left-wing-led party departments and newspapers in Jiujiang, Anqing, Ningbo and Nanjing, shooting and arresting Communist Party members and workers in protest marches. From March 10 to 17, after the Second National Assembly of the Kuomintang, of the eighty-eight members of its supervisory committee and candidate committee, about one-third were members of the Communist Party of China, one-third were members of the pro-communist left, the ministers and secretaries of all departments of the Central Party Department of the Kuomintang, and more than one-half were members of the Communist Party.

The station has an island platform, located at the bottom of the ground between Da Shadi East Road and Guang Xin Road. Da Shadi East Station currently has two entrances and exits for passengers. The station originally had a D-port, but was closed on April 9, 2021 due to the construction of the 7th line interchange. Da Shadi East Station is adjacent to the former Wong Po District Government and some residential areas, so the station has a certain amount of traffic during the early and late peak hours. Due to the opening of the rear section of the 21st line to intensify the traffic pressure of the early peak hours of the 5th line, the station has been implementing traffic control measures during the early peak hours of working days since December 18, 2019, and then cancelling the normalized traffic control measures. Da Shadi East Station originally appeared in the 2003 plan. When the 5th line was planned, it was changed to the south of Maogang junction to the northeast to join Da Shadi Road, then extended east to west along Da Shadi Road, and the station was also set up midway, originally planned as Da Shadi Station, the location is basically the same as the present.

The Standing Committee of the Central Executive Committee of the Kuomintang of China, abbreviated as the "Central Standing Committee", is the highest decision-making and executive organ of the Kuomintang of China during the mainland period. At the same time, the Central Standing Committee exercises legislative functions, and the majority of the right of re-determination of the Kuomintang of China is exercised by the Central Standing Committee. After the First National Congress of the Kuomintang of China in January 1924, the congress system and the committee system were implemented. The highest decision-making organ during the inter-sessional period of the National Congress is the Central Executive Committee, "the Standing Committee of the Central Executive Committee is organized by the alternate standing members of the Central Executive Committee, and performs its duties during the inter-sessional plenary meeting of the Central Executive Committee, and assumes its responsibilities to the Central Executive Committee." "the three alternate standing members of the Central Executive Committee, organize the secretariat, and carry out the day-to-day affairs of the Party," the first plenary session of the First Central Executive Committee deemed that the three alternate standing members of the Central Executive Committee, Liao Zhongkai, Dai Jitao and Tam Pingshan, were standing members of the Central Executive Committee, assisting Sun Yat-sen in handling the day-to-day affairs of the Central Executive Committee.

Guangzhou 2019 Crohn's disease aggregate epidemic in August-September 2022 refers to the 2019 Crohn's disease aggregate epidemic in Guangzhou, Guangdong Province, People's Republic of China, which broke out from August 30, 2022. On September 11, with the lifting of the control measures of Daishi-kaido Dawei Village, Panyu District, Guangzhou, the current crohn's disease aggregate epidemic in Guangzhou officially ended. From August 31, the first buses started, a large number of buses were cancelled. On August 31, the Guangzhou Transportation Department took measures to close all entrances and stop external operation services (the trains in Jiangnanxi Station, City Second Palace Station, Xiaogang Station, City Second Palace Station, Line 8 Xiaogang Station, Baogang Avenue Station, Phoenix New Village Station, Tong Fuxi Station, Line 2 and Line 8 Changgang Station, Line 8 and Guangzhou Fuxi Station, Changgang Station and Shayuan Station only retain the transfer function inside the station).

An X-ray burst source is an X-ray binary that exhibits a periodic rapid increase in luminosity (usually 10 or higher orders of magnitude) and peaks in the electromagnetic spectrum. This astronomical physics system consists of an accreted dense object (usually a neutron star, occasionally a black hole) and a donor main sequence star. The donor material falls to the surface of the neutron star and accumulates in a cluster there until hydrogen fuses into helium, producing X-rays. As a donor main sequence star, the binary system comprising the donor star can be classified as either a high-mass star (more than 10 solar masses (M☉)) or a low-mass star (less than 1 solar mass), abbreviated HMXB and LMXB respectively. The observation of an X-ray burst source differs from observations from other X-ray transient sources (such as X-ray pulsars and soft X-ray transients) in that it exhibits a rapid rise time (1-10 seconds), followed by a softening spectrum (low-temperature blackbody characteristics).

In the Yuan Dynasty, there was a Kukan who, although he was thirty miles from Kunshan, lived in a thousand mounds, was good at southern rhetoric, and was good at making ancient poems. He was a friend of Yang Tiefei, Gu Aei, and Niyuan Zhen, and called himself Fenggetsu Sanjin. He wrote ten volumes of "Tao Shinnoshu" and eight volumes of "Fenggetsu Sanjin Lefu," and lived in the world, and was good at making Southern music, and at the beginning of the country, he was called 'Kunshan Lane.'" Takanori Sei's Biwaki called him 'the founder of Southern music,' and he also had a relationship with Gu Aei, so the Biwaki also used Kunshan Lane to sing.:48 However, the early Kunshan Lane was not really a Kunkyu until Wei Liangyu improved it during the years of Zhengde and Jiajing. Wei Liangyu studied Northern music early on, but did not achieve it, so he attacked Southern music. In Taikura, he collaborated with Northern composer Zhang Notang and others, and improved Kunshan Lane, adopted Chinese rhythm, alphabetic lane, 'water mill, beat cold plate', so that Kunshan Lane played its delicate gentle characteristics, hence the name 'water mill tone' and 'water mill lane.'

In 1981, he was elected to the Taipei City Council for the first time. In 1986, he was the first member of the Democratic Progressive Party to form a coalition, serving as a member of the Standing Committee of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and a member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. In 1990, he was elected to the Taipei City Council as a member of the Legislative Committee of the Communist Party of China in the election of additional members of the Legislative Committee of the Communist Party of China, and began his two-year parliamentary career. In December 1994, Chen was elected to the Taipei City Council in the mayoral election, thereby resigning as a member of the Legislative Committee of the Communist Party of China and becoming a mayor. During his four-year term as mayor of Taipei City, Chen's achievements included promoting social policy innovation, being elected as the first directly elected President of the Republic of China in the election of the President of the Republic of China in 2000, with a 39.3% vote, ending the long-term rule of the Kuomintang in Taiwan since 1948, and making a speech in which he proposed a four-to-one no; in the 2004 election of the President of the Republic of China, he received 50.11% of the vote, and was re-elected with a margin of 0.22%.

一口通商, Western countries called the Canton System or Canton System, was the policy of China from 1757 to 1842 before the signing of the Treaty of Nanjing, the Qing Dynasty stipulated that Western merchants could only trade in Canton (called Guangzhou), but Chinese merchants were not restricted by this decree. After China entered the Ming Dynasty, the prohibition policy was implemented for nearly 200 years, until the Ming Longqing year (1567), Fujian governor Tsuze Min asked for the prohibition, implemented the "ship-pull" system, was granted. However, the Ming government opened only one trading port in Zhangzhou, Fujian Province. In the early Qing Dynasty, in order to weaken and eliminate the anti-Qing forces such as Zheng Xue, the prohibition was implemented once. Kangxi 22 (1683), the Qing army settled Taiwan. Kangxi 23 (1684), the Qing Dynasty officially opened the sea, allowing people to trade abroad.

Li Keqiang is a resident of Jiuzhai Village, Wuwei Township, Dingyuan County, Anhui Province. Li Keqiang was one of the first students of the Law Department of Beijing University after the resumption of the Chinese National Entrance Examination in 1977. During his studies at Peking University, Li Keqiang studied under Li Yining and other scholars. Li Keqiang served as the President of the Standing Committee of the Northern University Students Association and obtained a Ph.D. in Economics from Peking University. Li Keqiang joined the Communist Party of China in May 1976. Li Keqiang has served as Secretary of the Central Secretariat of the Beijing University Students Association, Secretary of the Central Secretariat of the Chinese Communist Youth League and Vice-Chairman of the National Youth League since 1982. Li Keqiang was the First Secretary of the Central Secretariat of the Communist Youth League from 1993 to 1998. Li Keqiang served as Deputy Secretary of the Central Secretariat of the Henan Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China from June 1998 to July 1998, Deputy Governor of Henan Province and Deputy Governor of Henan Province from February 1999 to February 1999, Governor of Henan Province from December 2002 to January 2003, Secretary of the Central Secretariat of the Henan Provincial Committee and Chairman of the Henan Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China from December 2004 to November 2007, Secretary of the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China and Chairman of the Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China.

Bolesław Bierut (Polish pronunciation:, one of the founders of the Polish Workers' Party, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Polish United Workers' Party, first president of the Polish People's Republic, later chairman of the Polish State Council, chairman of the Council of Ministers). Born in Lublin, he worked as a typist and clerk at a young age. At the age of 20, he joined the Polish Socialist Left. In December 1918, the Socialist Left merged with the Polish-Lithuanian Social Democratic Party to form the Polish Communist Workers' Party (later known as the Polish Communist Party), and he became a communist revolutionary. In 1926, the Kraków Uprising broke out in Poland, in May Joseph Piłsudski carried out a coup d'état, established a dictatorial government, and the Polish Communist Party was banned and disbanded. In 1927, Bierut went to the Soviet Union and joined the Communist International.

He graduated in 1917 with a degree in political economics. He then went to the University of Paris, France, where he obtained a doctorate in law in 1920. Upon his return to China, he became a lecturer at Peking University and founded the weekly magazine Modern Commentary. In June 1927, he was appointed Director of the Legislative Bureau of the National Government. In December of the same year, he was transferred to Hubei Province as a government commissioner and head of the Department of Education. In October of the following year, he was appointed arbitrator of the Permanent Court of Arbitration in The Hague. In November, he was appointed a member of the Legislative Yuan. In March 1929, he was appointed President of the National Wuhan University. In December 1931, he was elected the fourth candidate of the National Kuomintang as a member of the Central Inspection Commission. In April 1933, he was promoted to the position of Minister of Education of the National Government. In June 1935, he was appointed the first councilor of the National Academy of Sciences.

National security (also known as national security or national defence) refers to the maintenance of the continuity of a state through the use of economic, military, political and diplomatic means. In the past, national security was defined as the maintenance of territorial integrity and political independence by means of defence, free from the threat of any foreign military force. Today, it includes any non-military means of countering non-traditional external or internal threats, protecting the lives and property of citizens, and ensuring that citizens are free from anxiety, fear and deprivation. Military is the fundamental guarantee of national security. By establishing a standing army, the state has the capacity to deter and resist foreign military aggression, and to ensure that it can be defeated within the first hour.

By 1971, the guerrillas of the Liberation Front of Mozambique, with the help of Soviet weapons, controlled vast rural areas of the country, and a quarter of the territory fell into the hands of the guerrillas. In 1973, the situation in Mozambique became more confused, the guerrillas' power increased, and the demoralized Portuguese army was forced to retreat from the jungle in the north to several cities. After much talk, the Portuguese government had to negotiate with the guerrillas in preparation for the independence of Mozambique. On 8 September 1973, at 19:00, the Portuguese Foreign Minister, Mario Sules, and the leader of the guerrillas, Machi, held talks in the capital of Swaziland, Lusaka. The two sides signed an agreement on an immediate ceasefire, and Portugal allowed the guerrillas led by the guerrillas to form the Provisional Government of the Blacks of Mozambique, and to achieve complete independence within nine months.

Dr. Zhou Rukawa, a dentist, founded Zhongshan Dental College (Zhongshan Dental College) in 1960 as a precursor to Zhongshan Medical University in view of the shortage of dentists in Taiwan after World War II. Two years later, the school was renamed Zhongshan Medical College (Zhongshan Medical College), followed by nursing and medical technology. At that time, dentistry, medicine and nursing admitted high school graduates, dental training was first extended for four years and then for five years, medical training was first extended for four years and then for five to six years, nursing training for three years was all three majors, medical technology admitted junior high school graduates were trained for five years and belonged to five majors. The specialized school was upgraded to independent college Zhongshan Medical College in 1977, in July 2001 was upgraded to University Zhongshan Medical University, and in August of the same year, the attached hospital was authorized to reform and be renamed "Zhongshan Medical University Affiliated Hospital".

Belo Horizonte (Portuguese: Belo Horizonte), also known as Belo Horizonte, is the fourth largest city in southeastern Brazil, with a population of about 2.1 million and an area of 334 square kilometers. It is the seat of the state government of Minas Gerais and is the political, economic and cultural center of the state. The city has more advanced industries such as metallurgy, jewelry processing, automotive manufacturing, textiles, and food. It was originally known as the Kularderre farmstead. Brazil's first planned city, construction began in 1893 on a scale of 200,000 inhabitants, was completed in 1897, originally named Ciudad de Minas (meaning "Mining City"), replacing the southeastern mountainous city of Orupreto as the capital of the state, and became a center of agricultural and pastoral products and mining in the surrounding area. After World War II, with the construction of railways and highways, industry grew rapidly, from 180,000 in 1940 to 1.23 million in 1970, the city greatly exceeded the original plan, becoming one of the fastest developing cities in Brazil.

In 1913, he fled to Japan with Sun Yat-sen. In 1914, Liao was appointed Deputy Director of the Finance Department of the Chinese Revolutionary Party. Later, he joined Sun Yat-sen in opposing Yuan Shikai, participated in the law-enforcement movement, and published articles in the Kuomintang publications praising the October Revolution. In 1921, Sun Yat-sen was elected President of the People's Republic of China in Guangzhou, and Liao was appointed Deputy Director of the Finance Department. Later, during the first period of the Communist Party of China, Liao was appointed as a member of the Central Executive Committee of the Kuomintang, Minister of Finance, Minister of Workers, Minister of Farmers, and representative of the Huangpu Military School Party. On March 12, 1924, Chiang Kai-shek sent a letter to Liao Zhongyai from Fenghua, stating that he had an opinion on the "Cooperation of the Communist Party of China."

He went to Japan on November 12, 1927 after his defeat at the Battle of Ninghan. In April 1929, he again fell to Chiang Kai-shek, participated in the war between Chiang Kai-shek and the Gui warlords, was president of the Military Council of the National Government and commander-in-chief of the Fifth Route Army of the National Revolutionary Army. In October, he participated in the Sino-Pacific War, and in December, he again joined the anti-Chiang Kai-shek group of the Yi banner, and was commander-in-chief of the Fourth Route Army of the National Salvation Army. After the defeat, he went into exile again in 1930. In 1931, he was a member of the Standing Committee of the Guangzhou National Government and the Military Commission. After the coup d'état of 1918, he returned to the Nanjing National Government and was again president of the Military Council of the National Government. In 1935 (24 years of the People's Republic), he was appointed director of the National Government Training Directorate, and in April 1935, he was awarded the rank of colonel. In November 1937, when the Japanese army attacked Nanjing, he fought to the death and took the initiative to become commander-in-chief of the capital's garrison.

The Territory is a Non-Self-Governing Territory of Australia under the direct jurisdiction of the federal government. As the Territory is not part of any state, residents of the Territory are elected to the House of Representatives from the Fenna constituency to the northwest of the Territory and to the Senate from the Territory in federal elections. Currently, the Territory has a population of only 611 (2001 Census). The Territory is a natural harbour 16 km long north-south and 10 km wide east-west, located 150 km south of Sydney. In 1915, the federal government purchased land in the Territory from the State of New South Wales as the port and coastline of the Australian Capital Territory.

The Chinese Communist Party (CPC) has proposed a two-state system in which Hong Kong, Taiwan and Macau retain the capitalist economic and social political system, while the other mainland regions continue to implement the socialist system with Chinese characteristics; in addition, it has proposed that Hong Kong and Macau may continue their own political system, legal system, economic policy, financial affairs, governance system and foreign relations for 50 years.

The Chinese Soviet Republic (November 7, 1931 – September 22, 1937) was the Communist Party of China under the support of the Soviet Union and the Communist International. On November 7, 1931, the first national congress of the Chinese Soviet Union was solemnly opened at the Xie Shrine in Yeping Village, Ruijin. On November 20, the congress elected 54 members of the Central Executive Committee of the Chinese Soviet Republic, including Mao Zedong, Yang Ying and Zhu De, and proclaimed the establishment of the Provisional Central Government of the Chinese Soviet Republic. On November 27, the first meeting of the Central Executive Committee elected Mao Zedong as Chairman of the Central Executive Committee and Chairman of the People's Committee, and the congress decided that the Provisional Central Government of the Republic should be established in Ruijin.

On December 19, 2013, the "Joint Meeting of Political Groups to Promote the Peaceful Unification of the People's Republic of China" composed of 15 groups, including the New Alliance, the New Party, the Promotion of Peaceful Unification of the Straits of China, the China Unification Alliance, the Promotion of Trade and Industry Unification, the China Unification Promotion Party, the Labor Party, the China National Unity Association, the Self-Strong Association of the Republic of China, the Huangpu Four Seas Coalition of the People's Republic of China, the Zhongyi Comradeship of the Republic of China, the Optimus Association of the Republic of China, the China National Democratic Unification Party, the Xinhongmen Party of China, and the China Patriotic Coalition of the People's Republic of China, convened a meeting in the Alumni Hall of Taichung University, presided over by Xu Lianhong, and after the meeting, issued a joint declaration supporting the unification of the two sides.On September 26, 2014, Xu Lianhong, as the chairman of the New Alliance and the leader of the New Party, led the "Joint Visiting Group of the Peaceful Unification Group of Taiwan" in the People's Assembly Hall to meet with the CPC Central Committee General Secretary Xi Jinping, expressing the wish to see the unification of China.

2010 SO16 is the provisional name given to a near-Earth asteroid discovered by the Wide Field Infrared Survey Satellite. Its orbit has been described by Christou Apostolos and David Asher of the Irish Astronomical Observatory of Armagh, with a diameter of only a few hundred meters and a luminosity of 20.7 mag. 2010 SO16 has a "horseshoe orbit" that allows it to share a stable orbit with the Earth without collisions. It is one of the few asteroids known to have a horseshoe orbit, including (3753) Crutney. However, it is neither an Apollo-type asteroid nor an Aden-type asteroid, as its semi-major axis is neither less than nor greater than 1 AU, but oscillates between about 0.996 and 1.004 AU over a period of about 350 years.

Ulaanbaatar (Mongolian: ᠠོᠠ, Bao Pei: Ulaγan Hüü, Cyrillic:紅хүү; 23 December 1906 – 8 December 1988) was a Mongolian politician of the Communist Party of China, leader of the People's Republic of China and the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, and the founding general of the People's Liberation Army. Ulaanbaatar was the highest-ranking ethnic minority person in the history of the People's Republic of China. He joined the Chinese Socialist Youth League in 1923; joined the Communist Party of China in 1925; was a deputy member of the 8th Politburo of the Communist Party of China, a member of the 10th Central Committee, a member of the 11th and 12th Politburo of the Communist Party of China. He served as vice-chairman of the People's Republic of China, vice-chairman of the 4th, 5th and 7th Standing Committees of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, vice-chairman of the 5th Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, deputy prime minister of the State Council, and minister of the War Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.

The President of the Republic of China is the Head of State of the Republic of China. Established in 1948, he inherited the functions of the President of the National Government. Under the provisions of the Constitution of the Republic of China, the President of the Republic of China, on behalf of the Republic of China, exercises the right to conclude treaties and declare war and peace; to promulgate laws, issue orders, declare martial law, exercise the right of amnesty, pardon, commutation of sentences and restoration of rights, appoint and dismiss military officers and confer honors. The President of the Republic of China is also the Commander-in-Chief of the Three Armies, commanding the National Army, Navy and Air Force. Under the provisions of the Revised Articles of the Constitution of the Republic of China, the President of the Republic of China may issue emergency orders by resolution of the Council of the Executive Council, and when the Legislative Council passes a motion of no confidence in the President of the Executive Council, after consulting the President of the Legislative Council, declare the dissolution of the Legislative Council. In addition, the President of the Republic of China has established the Presidential Office as a bureaucratic body and the National Security Council as an advisory body.

During the Qin and Han Dynasties, it was under the jurisdiction of Kaiyang County, Nankai County. Three years later, in 1524, Kaiyang County was established, and it was under the jurisdiction of Chaozhou Prefecture until the end of the Qing Dynasty. From the period of the People's Republic to 1958, it was under the jurisdiction of Chaomei County and Chaoshan County. In 1958, Kaiyang County was abolished, and it was divided into Puning County and Chaoyang County. In March 1961, Kaiyang County was restored, and it was under the jurisdiction of Shantou Administrative District. In 1983, it was under the jurisdiction of Shantou City. In 1992, Kaiyang City was established after Kaiyang County was abolished, and Kaiyang County belonged to Kaiyang City. The whole territory of Kaiyang County lies south of the North Regression Line. It has a subtropical humid climate, abundant sunshine, abundant rainfall, and little snowfall throughout the year. The average annual temperature is 21°C, the average annual precipitation is about 1723 mm, and the average annual sunshine is 2039 hours. Kaiyang County is located on the southeastern coast of Guangdong, and is often hit by strong tropical storms during the summer and autumn seasons.

However, the independence of Outer Mongolia was not recognized by the Qing Dynasty and the Republic of China governments. It was only recognized by Tibet and was not widely recognized by the international community, and the ambiguous attitude of Russia, which secretly supported its independence, was also ambiguous. In 1915, the Sino-Russian tripartite treaty of 1915, Outer Mongolia renounced its independence, and China promised to give Outer Mongolia a high degree of autonomy. In November 1919, the government of the Republic of China in Beijing declared Outer Mongolia "abolition of autonomy", abolished the Sino-Russian treaty, and sent troops to occupy Outer Mongolia, but was defeated by the White Army led by Enchin in February 1921, the Chinese North Sea army was expelled from Outer Mongolia. In July 1921, the Mongolian Revolutionary Army, with the assistance of the Soviet army, successfully repulsed the forces of the Russian White Army, a new constitutional monarchy of a communist nature was declared, Suharto became military minister, Boktokhan's power was limited, and he became a symbolic head of state.

Special education schools originated in Europe in the 18th century. Some progressive teachers and doctors proposed various theories to lay the foundation for special education. Gradually, deaf education, blind education, weak-minded education, etc. were formed. In the 19th century, some doctors and (or) teachers proposed theories of therapeutic education. The development of psychology in the late 19th century gave rise to the psychology of special children, and "special education" emerged. In the mid-20th century, the concept of special education was broadened. The study of special education extended from school-age children with disabilities on a large scale to early diagnosis and educational training of preschool children with disabilities, while special education extended to secondary and higher education and vocational education of young people with disabilities on a larger scale. Various disciplines (education, psychology, medicine, sociology, linguistics, philosophy, electronics, listening, etc.) were closely combined and intertwined in the study of education, psychology and rehabilitation of children with disabilities.

Guangzhou Metro Line 2 is one of the lines operated by Guangzhou Metro in Guangdong Province, China. It is part of the urban rail transportation system. The entire line is underground and marked in blue. It is 31.8 km long, roughly north-south, with 24 stations, one car park and one car park. The line starts from Guangzhou South Station in Panyu District and ends at Jia Wo Wanggang in Baiyun District, using six sections of Class A trains. Currently, Line 2 is roughly north-south, starting at Guangzhou South Station in Panyu District, crossing the western part of Luopu Plate, crossing the Pearl River into the Pearl River District, passing the Pearl Passenger Terminal, Dong Xiaonan Road, then turning north into Jiangnan Avenue, along Jiangnan Avenue northwards, crossing the Pearl River at about 50 meters on the west side of the Pearl Bridge. Passing the Pearl Square, Guangzhou Qiyi Road to the People's Park, then turning west to the People's Park, crossing Lianxin Road over Dongfeng Zhong Road, then crossing Yuxiu Park, Jiefang North Road, Guangzhou Railway Station to the intersection of Sanyuan Road and Guangyuan West Road in Baiyun District, then crossing the Baiyun New City (Old Baiyun Airport) Central Axis Line and Guangyuan Road roughly to the northeast, passing the Shanxi side of Baiyun District, and finally arriving at Jia Wo Wanggang Station.

The total floor area of the main building is 28,708 square meters and was designed and constructed by Zong Mei Architects and Shimizu Construction Co., Ltd. The architecture of the station is based on the concept of "landscape symbiosis" and the roof of the sloping roof is covered from west to east. The internal columns of the station are structured with tree branches and trusses, thereby extending the natural landscape of the outdoors, and the use of cornices, double-layered glass, and lilies and other architectural materials, responding to the climate of the Jiangnan Plain and the characteristics of traditional Minnan style architecture. The station is similar to Chiayi Station in the Jiangnan Plain, the difference is that the shopping mall space on both sides of the Tainan station is larger. The square in front of the station is surrounded by the arc walls of the concept of Taiwan's city walls, and the water pond at the front is planted with Taiwan's South White River special lotus. Tainan Station is an early high-speed railway station, including the station: the 60 km section from Kaohsiung Taisha to Tainan Sixth Avenue is also the location of the early train test cars.

Reagan was elected to office at the age of 69 years and 349 days, the oldest person ever to be elected President of the United States, a record that stood until 2017, when he was defeated by Donald Trump at the age of 70 years and 220 days.Reagan defeated former Vice President Walter Mondale in the 1984 presidential election to win the largest number of 525 votes in the history of the United States presidential election, 97.6% of the electorate's 538 votes.This is the second largest gap in the history of the United States in modern times, only behind Franklin D. Roosevelt in the 1936 U.S. presidential election against Alf Landon, when Roosevelt won 98.5% of the 531 votes, or 523.Reagan's economic policies were supply-side economics, known as Reagan economics, which reduced income taxes by 25%, reduced inflation, lowered interest rates, expanded military spending, increased government deficits and bonds, eliminated loopholes in taxation rules, continued to deregulate commercial activities, and allowed the U.S. economy to start a very thriving economic growth in 1982, after experiencing a dramatic recession in 1981-1982, until the end of his term and continued into his presidency.

In June 1990, the former Research Center for Rural Policy of the CPC Central Committee and the Research Center for Rural Development of the State Council were merged into the Research Center for Development of the State Council. The date of establishment of the Research Center for Economic Development of the State Council was set as July 9, 1980, as a commemorative day for the establishment of the Research Center for Development of the State Council. In 1994, the Information Network of the Research Center for Development of the State Council was opened. On August 21, 2017, the launching ceremony of the China International Development Knowledge Center and the press conference of the Progress Report on China's Implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development were held in Beijing, and the General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee and President Xi Jinping sent a congratulatory letter. The China International Development Knowledge Center is a subsidiary institution of the Research Center for Development of the State Council, and the establishment of the China International Development Knowledge Center is an initiative announced by Xi Jinping at the United Nations Development Summit in September 2015.

In the wild, tigers, leopards and humans are the main enemies of Asian elephants. Each group consists of several to dozens of elephants. They do not have a fixed habitat and are widely distributed. The main habitat of Asian elephants is thirteen countries, including India, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Myanmar, Thailand, Vietnam, Indonesia and Malaysia in the tropical regions of Southeast Asia and Southeast Asia, covering an area of about 440,000 square kilometers. In ancient times, Asian elephants were active in two river basins of Western Asia, extending eastwards to the Yellow River basins of China. Since the Qing Dynasty, their natural habitats in China have been compressed to the area of Mt. Wuxian in Yunnan Province, and the Western Twin Banna, Pu Er, and Lincang in the southern part of Mt. Aeru. However, in recent years, their activity has been between the northern border of Koda Yuxi and Kunming. Asian elephants are often used in Southeast Asian countries to transport timber, etc. in forest areas where transportation is difficult.

According to the text "On Stone Age Sites in Taiwan" published in the Tokyo Anthropological Society Magazine in 1902, Taichung County is home to many stone-working sites, including the "Tochijojo" area (later renamed "Nucheng", now Nucheng City), the earliest records of prehistoric sites in Taichung County:72. During the Joseon and Ming Dynasties, there were no records of the development of the Taichung County by the Han people, the development of the Han people began in the Kangxi and Yongzheng periods of the Qing Dynasties:790. During the Qing Dynasties, Taichung was an important transportation point for the circulation of goods and freight, as many Han people used the area to trade with foreign ships, and gradually formed small villages. In 1750, the influx of immigrants, with a population of more than 20,000 people, cleared the Dadu River, and traced the river back to Taichung. Due to the convenience of transportation, combined with the hard work of immigrants, Taichung quickly became the most prosperous area in the Taichung Basin, laid the foundation for the prosperous development in the future, and joined the three major settlements in Taichung, the earliest area in the Taichung Basin to develop: 1548.

Shen Rui Lin (1874-1945), Chinese, politician and diplomat of Zhejiang Province. Shen Rui Lin was a leader of the Qing Dynasty, a member of the Embassy of Belgium to the Qing Court in 1902. In 1908, he was appointed Deputy Counselor of the Embassy of Germany and a member of the Society for the Protection of Fine Arts and Copyrights of All Nations. In 1909, he was appointed Counselor of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Qing Dynasty. The following year, he was appointed Ambassador to Austria-Hungary. After the establishment of the People's Republic of China in 1912, Shen Rui Lin was appointed Ambassador to Austria-Hungary. In August 1917, the North Atlantic Government declared war on Austria-Hungary, and Shen Rui Lin returned to China. From August 1918 to September 1920, he was Deputy Chairman of the Peace Research Society.

The Democratic Republic of the Congo (French: République démocratique du Congo, abbreviated RDC) is a country in central Africa, short for Democratic Republic of the Congo (DR Congo), Congo (Kinshasa) Democratic Republic of the Congo is the world's most populous French-speaking country, the world's 16th most populous country, and the fourth most populous country in Africa. Democratic Republic of the Congo is a member of the United Nations, the Non-Aligned Movement, the African Union and the Common Market of East Africa. Democratic Republic of the Congo was formed on 30 June 1960 as an independent country from the Free State of the Congo and the Federated States of the Congo.

Assuming that a system is composed of a homogeneous material with homogeneous physical and chemical properties, it is said that the system has only one phase, also known as phase state, or phase of matter, as distinct from other phases of motion in the physical cycle. A homogeneous system, also known as a monophase system, is a simple system consisting of only one phase. A more complex system may be heterogeneous in some respect, such a system is called a homogeneous and heterogeneous mixtures or a heterogeneous system. In analysis, a heterogeneous system can be divided into several systems, each system having only one phase, all of which are homogeneous:3. For example, a solution after careful agitation is a homogeneous system, having only one phase.

Broadcasting refers to the act of transmitting information to the public by means of electronic communications technology such as sound, images, video, etc., which belongs to the category of communication media. Compared to electronic communication forms such as telephone and early radio, it is characterized by "one-to-many", one-way transmission of information to a wide audience. Broadcasting is divided into two main types, radio broadcasting that transmits sound content, and television broadcasting that transmits sound and visual content simultaneously, of which radio broadcasting began to be popular in the 1920s and developed earlier. The unit or facility that provides broadcasting content is called a radio station, also called a radio station, which includes a radio station and a television station. The concepts derived from broadcasting but differing in form are narrowcasting and random video.

At present, the administrative area is divided into 47 villages and 1,236 neighbourhoods. The name of Docheng District derives from the local defensive "wall" (around the present district public office), during the Qing Dynasty administrative division belonged to the "Freshwater Hall swinging fort", during the Jing Dynasty belonged to the "Docheng Zhuang, Haishan County, Taipei Prefecture", when Haishan County still included Itabashi Street, Sanxia Street, Yinghua Street, Zhonghe Zhuang (now Itabashi, Sanxia, Yinghua, Forest, Zhonghe, Yonghe), etc. After the post-war local self-government area was reorganized, Docheng was reorganized into Docheng Village, Taipei Prefecture. Due to the continuous increase in population, increasing industrial and commercial development, on June 26, 1993, after the population exceeded 150,000, it was formally reorganized into Docheng City, Taipei Prefecture. According to the statistics of the New Taipei City Government Civil Affairs Bureau, by the end of 2021, Docheng District had about 91,000 households, a population of about 237,000, the largest and the smallest villages in the district were Yongning Li and Qinghua Li, respectively, and by the end of 2021, the two villages had a population of 8,722 and 1,616, respectively.

Brown dwarfs are secondary stars with masses between the heaviest gas giants and the lightest stars, typically between 13 and 75 or 80 Jupiter masses. Unlike stars in the main sequence, brown dwarfs are not massive enough to sustain the fusion reaction of hydrogen (1H) into helium in the core. However, they range between 13 MJ and 65 MJ. They are all classified by their spectra, with brown dwarfs classified as M, L, T and Y-type stars. Within the visible light wavelength range, brown dwarfs are very faint. The known planet-orbiting brown dwarfs are 2M1207b, MOA-2007-BLG-192Lb, and J044144b. The nearest brown dwarf to Earth is Luman 16, discovered in 2013, which is a pair of binary stars 6.5 light years away.

Established in April 1922, Taiwan South Provincial Chiayi Girls' High School. Unconditional surrender of Japan in 1945, the end of World War II, President Chiang Kai-shek's orders, on behalf of the Allies, accepted the surrender of Japan. The National Government of the Republic of China sent a temporary military takeover of Taiwan, the school was changed to Taiwan Provincial Chiayi Girls' High School in December 1945. In order to avoid the effects of the war, in 1955, the Taiwan Provincial Chiayi Girls' High School was established in Tainan's back wall, with primary, secondary, and both male and female students. In 1959, the back wall division was established as an independent school, Taiwan Provincial Chiayi Girls' High School (now the National Chiayi Girls' High School). In 1968, when extending the national education, implemented the supporting policy "provincial high school, municipal junior high school", junior high school was closed. After the end of the junior high school, in 1970, the name was changed to Taiwan Provincial Chiayi Girls' High School.

Qu Wu (Chinese: 屈武; pinyin: Qu Wu; 16 July 1898 – 13 June 1992) was a Chinese statesman from Weinan, Shaanxi Province, Republic of China. He was the son-in-law of the former leader of the Nationalist Party of China. He was born on 16 July 1898 in Shimohe Town, Weinan County, Shaanxi Province. When he was four years old, his father fell ill and his mother died of depression shortly thereafter. His grandmother raised his three younger brothers and sisters. With the support of his uncle Guo Yutang (Qing Dynasty Jinshi), Qu Wu entered private school at the age of six and entered the Jingxian Higher Primary School at the age of nine. When his uncle Guo Yutang died in 1908, his grandmother was unable to attend school for Qu Wu.

At the beginning of 1977, he was recommended to the Law Department of Peking University to become the last trainee of the Workers' and Peasants' Militia. He was the president of Li Keqiang's faculty. During his studies at Peking University, Yuan Chunqing served as deputy secretary of the Communist Party of China at Peking University, chairman of the Northern University Students' Association and vice-chairman of the National Academy of Sciences. Yuan Chunqing graduated from the Law Department of Peking University in early 1980 and joined the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. During his tenure in the Central Committee, Yuan served as an officer, deputy director, office director, deputy minister and minister of the Ministry of Education; secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, secretary-general of the National Academy of Sciences, director of the National Minority Labour Commission, vice-chairman of the National Academy of Sciences, party secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. He worked in the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China for 17 years. During this period, Yuan Chunqing was awarded a master's degree in law from China University of Political Science and Law in 1990 and a doctorate in management from Hunan University's International School of Business in 1997.

Power outages are also referred to as power failures or power accidents. Power outages are caused by accidents in the supply of electricity or are planned to occur. Power outages generally refer to the lack of electricity supply in a certain area. They are a disaster. Power outages are planned by a person, possibly for reasons such as blockage of electricity, maintenance of electricity facilities, retaliation or threats to others. The purpose of power outages can also be: to reduce the amount of electricity consumed when there is a shortage of electricity, or to enforce lighting controls or even restrictions on electricity consumption. For example, Hong Kong implemented lighting controls in 1973-1974 due to the first oil crisis. In cities, fluorescent tubes, LED signs and large display screens are kept lit at night. Heavy lights often make it difficult for residents to sleep, so some cities have introduced regulations requiring businesses to turn off advertising signs and display screens at night.

On August 10, 1809, Ecuador declared its independence, but was soon recaptured by Spain. After decades of struggle, the country was completely liberated from Spanish control in 1822. In 1825, it joined the Republic of the Big Brother, but the country was dissolved in 1830. The Republic of Ecuador was formed as a result. Since the establishment of the country, Ecuadorian politics has not been on track, the civilian and military governments were replaced 19 times, until 1979, officially governed by the civilian government, established a constitution, and has been in existence for more than 20 years. On April 15, 2007, a referendum was held. On June 12, 2019, the Supreme Court of Ecuador ruled in favor of same-sex marriage, its ruling on July 8, 2019 announced that same-sex marriage would be officially effective and open to registration. In October 2019, the Ecuadorian government, in response to a large-scale protest over the cancellation of fuel subsidies, temporarily moved the government from the capital, Quito, to the first city, Guayaquil.

Until July 1859, it was officially leased jointly with France by the Qing Dynasty government. After its choice of this small sandbar in the middle of the Pearl River (quite close to the Guangdong Thirteenth Line, China's only foreign trade zone during the Qing Dynasty's closure), the island was filled in and a lease was signed in 1861. Four-fifths of the western part of the island was assigned to the British Mandate of Guangdong, about 44 acres (264 ha), and one-fifth of the eastern part to the Mandate of Guangdong, about 11 acres (66 ha). The Chinese government relinquished all rights to the sandbar by paying an annual rent of 1,500 yuan. Each of the British and French Mandates had a bridge connecting it to Hebei (China's border). Over the next half-century, the two countries gained many privileges on the island, government agencies and enterprises were moved in large numbers, major consulates and political and financial organizations were established there, and for a considerable period of time the island was treated unfairly by the nearby Chinese, making it the target of protests and attacks by activists of the National Liberation Movement in China and even nearby countries.

Wu Winghui (born March 25, 1865, in Chinese characters, male, Jiangsu Wujin, politician of the Republic of China, founder of the People's Republic of China, member of the Central Academy of Sciences). Wu Winghui's calligraphy, his works include "The History of the Ancient and the Ancient," "The Illustration of Heaven," "The Tale of the Upper and Lower Ancients," and "The Tale of the Lower and Middle Ancients." Wu Winghui was originally from Wujin County, Changzhou Prefecture, Jiangsu Province. He was born at Xueyang Bridge at the junction of Jiangsu Wujin and Wuxi. Early in his life, Wu Winghui studied under the tutelage of Huang Yi Zhou at Nanjing Academy of Sciences. In 1891, Wu Winghui was selected as a candidate. After coming into contact with Western culture, he pursued anarchism and later participated in the National Revolution led by Sun Wen. Sun Wen's belief in peace and the story of the Old Soldiers of Heaven is told by Wu Kei-hung. He was considered a possible informant in the Suzhou case. After the release of Zhang Tai-jin from prison, he criticized Wu Winghui's secret meeting with the Qing court official Yu Ming-cheng. He was also a member of the West Mountain Conference of the early right wing of the Kuomintang.

Carrefour (French pronunciation: ) covers an area of 2,400 to 23,000 square metres (about 800 to 7,000 sq ft) and offers 20,000 to 80,000 products. As of June 2017, Carrefour has 1,507 wholesale stores, of which 243 are located in France, 458 in other European countries, 338 in Latin America, 370 in Asia and 94 in other countries. In some markets, wholesale warehouses open to individuals are being developed, such as Atacadão. The Kuiper belt is the source of short-period comets, such as Halley's Comet. Since the discovery of Pluto, astronomers have argued that it should be excluded from the Solar System. Because Pluto's size is similar to that of the larger asteroids in the Kuiper belt, it was argued at the end of the 20th century that it should be included among the Kuiper belt asteroids; Pluto's moons should be considered as its companions. In August 2006, the International Astronomical Union (IAU) removed Pluto from the category of exoplanets and assigned it to a new type of dwarf planet, along with Ganymede and the newly discovered Uranus. The Kuiper belt should not be confused with the hypothetical Oort Cloud, which is more than a thousand times larger than the former. Objects in the Kuiper belt, along with members of the Disc and any potential Oort Cloud objects, are collectively referred to as extra-Neptunian objects (TNOs). Pluto is the largest object in the Kuiper belt, and the second known extra-Neptunian object is Uranus in the Disc.

The Qing government only had to appoint Xu Jingcheng and Zhang Zhuang as the road superintendent and assistant ministers, and signed the 35-article "Zin Zhen Railway Loan Draft Contract" with Ying Huifeng and Dehua Banks on April 9, 1925 in Guangxu. From 1905, under the influence of the Guangdong-Han Railway Reclamation Movement, the gentlemen of Jiangsu, Lu and Su Provinces demanded that the "Zin Zhen Loan Draft Contract" be abolished and handed over to the local government. The railway plan was proposed for many years by Li Hongzhang, Liu Mingchuan, Zeng Jiao, Yuan Shikai, Yong Xing and other senior officials of the Qing court, and the end points of the line were constantly changing: Beijing Qing, Beijing Zhen, Zin Zhen, etc., and finally changed to Nanjing Pukou in 1908. Initially, the direction of this north-south railway plan was: the railway turned southeast in Xuzhou, along the west bank of the Great Canal of Beijing and Hangzhou, successively through Shuqiang, Huai'an and Yangzhou, and finally across the Yangtze River, and the Zhenjiang linked Shanghai to the Zhenjiang railway.

It covers 220.8 degrees of the night sky, accounting for 0.535 percent of the total, and can be seen in 88 modern constellations in the 65th row, south of 52 degrees north latitude. Lacaille assigns the Greek letters α to λ to the stars in the constellation of Lacaille by the Bayer nomenclature, which skips ι and κ. Lacaille belongs to the nautical instruments, not an essential part of the "Southern Ship", and in the 18th century the constellation of Lacaille was subdivided into the constellations of Boötes, Taurus, and Canis Majoris. The Greek letters assigned to the stars by the Bayer nomenclature are independent of the constellation of Lacaille. The 3.68-magnitude Canis Majoris is the brightest star in the constellation. Lacaille shows the star Kappa Lacaille but does not assign the Greek letters, and Gold later felt that the star was bright enough to assign the letter Kappa. T Lacaille is located about 4 degrees northeast of Canis Majoris. TY Lacaille is an eclipsing binary with a magnitude ranging from 6.85 to 7.5 with a period of 3.2 days. AK Lacaille is a red giant and a semi-regular variable star of spectral class M5III, with a brightness ranging from 6.09 to 6.51 magnitudes.

The national flag of Lesotho is a three-coloured transverse flag in 2:3 scale, with a blue, white and green stripe as the base, and a black Basotho cap in the middle. Blue represents the sky, rain, white symbolizes peace, and green represents the blue earth of Lesotho. The black Basotho cap represents the people of Lesotho, composed of black people. The flag was launched on 4 October 2006 to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the independence of the Kingdom of Lesotho and to express the people's desire for peace. The 2006 version of the national flag of Lesotho, the third generation of the national flag adopted after the independence of the country, reproduces the theme of the 1966 version of the national flag, the Basotho cap, and the main colours inherited from the 1987 version of the national flag, white, blue and green, organically combining the characteristics of the first and second generations of the national flag.

Havana is the capital and largest city of Cuba, and Santiago is the second largest city. It is commonly believed that the word "Cuba" comes from the Taíno word "coabana", meaning "rich land" or "good place". In 2011, Raúl Castro succeeded his brother Fidel Castro as first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, and began a series of reforms until the normalization of relations with the United States in 2014, when Cuba was frozen. In 2018, Miguel Díaz-Canel became the new Chairman of the Cuban State Council, and the National Congress of People's Power passed a constitutional amendment, including the establishment of a tenure system for leaders and the recognition of private property, which was passed in a referendum in 2019. Under the new constitution, Cuba will establish the positions of President and Prime Minister, replacing the previous positions of Chairman of the State Council and Chairman of the Council of Ministers.

The Australian Capital Territory (ACT) is the seat of the Government of the Commonwealth of Australia and the smallest but most populous state-level administrative region in Australia. It lies entirely within the province of New South Wales and covers an area of 2,358 square kilometres. The capital of the Australian Capital Territory, also the capital of the Commonwealth of Australia, is located in the northern part of the territory, in Canberra. In the late 19th century, when the British colonies of Australia negotiated the formation of the Commonwealth, there was disagreement over the location of the Commonwealth capital between the two largest cities, Sydney and Melbourne. As a result, the Commonwealth Constitution of Australia, which came into force in 1901, stipulated that the new capital must be located within the province of New South Wales but must be within 100 miles of Sydney — thereby ensuring that the new capital would remain fairly distant from both Sydney and Melbourne.

Heritage Day is the national holiday of South Africa on 24 September. On this day, South Africans celebrate their cultural, religious and traditional diversity throughout the country's long history. In KwaZulu-Natal Province, Heritage Day is known as Chaka Festival to commemorate King Chaka of the Zulu. Chaka is an important figure who united the different Zulu people to form a cohesive nation. Every year, local people gather in front of the tomb of King Chaka to mourn him. In 1995, the new South African Parliament opposed the designation of 24 September as a national holiday, and the result was not accepted by the largely Zulu-affiliated Inkatha Liberal Party (IFP). Finally, the Parliament and the Liberal Party reached a consensus to designate 24 September as Heritage Day and as a national holiday.

Currently, Djibouti has the largest base of U.S. troops in Africa. Before the colonial invasion, Djibouti was ruled by the three sultans of Hausa, Tajula and Obok. In 1850, the French invaded Djibouti, occupied the entire territory in 1888, and established the French colonial government of Somalia in 1896. After World War II, African countries launched independence movements, and the independence of French Somalia was complicated by the rivalry between the Issa and Afar peoples. In 1967, the French government granted its de facto autonomy to the French overseas territories by a referendum. Subsequent parliamentary elections resulted in an overwhelming victory for the Progressive Party, which belonged to the Afar peoples. The Issa-dominated Independent African Peoples' Alliance also expanded its forces to demand independence. Therefore, on December 31, 1975, France declared its agreement to the independence of French Afar and Issa territories.

Earth's land covers 29% of the Earth's surface. "Continents" and "continents" are synonymous in English, but have different meanings in Chinese. In Chinese, "continent" is a term that focuses on natural geography, referring to an area of land larger than Greenland; while "continent" is a term that focuses on geopolitics, referring to a definite delimitation of continental boundaries that includes not only the mainland as a subject, but also the surrounding islands and even the continental shelf. Geographical education in different countries is determined by the education departments of the countries. Therefore, the boundaries and names of blocks and continents are often different. The seven continents are the most common demarcation pattern, with the seven continents ranging from large to small: Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe and Oceania/Australia Asia. Some countries, such as the United States and Australia, do not consider Oceania to be an island.

Deng Xiaoping's new ideas were quickly questioned by supporters of Mao Zedong's ideology and supporters of political liberalization, and at the same time, the reform and opening-up policies caused many social problems. On April 15, 1989, the death of Hu Yaobang, the former secretary-general of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, triggered student and mass mourning activities, thus prompting large-scale student demonstrations. After the end of the Sixty-fourth Incident in 1989, the thirteenth Central Committee of the Communist Party of China convened, decided to remove Zhao Ziyang's duties as the secretary-general of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, thus establishing Jiang Zemin's leadership position within the Communist Party of China, and establishing the third generation of central leaders, including Li Peng and Li Ruiyuan.

With the establishment of Guangzhou Second Bus Company on September 1, 1980, the former Guangzhou Bus Company was renamed Guangzhou First Bus Company. From 1984 to 1985, due to very low financial investment, the company borrowed money from banks and hired employees to purchase buses, and formed a new dedicated fleet. In November 1986, five bus routes and 12 units along the line, including Guangzhou Cultural Park and South Building, launched the "Friendship in the Car" campaign, and established the slogan "Friendship in the Car, Honesty as a Passenger." In 1987, double-decker buses were introduced in the form of advertising compensation, and in 1992, a reform was implemented on 13 bus routes, namely "Get on at the front door, get off at the back door." In August 1993, unmanned buses were introduced on 202 dedicated bus routes. On September 13, 1994, Hong Kong Lei Yi Industrial Co., Ltd. and Guangzhou First Bus Company jointly established the Sino-foreign cooperative bus enterprise Guangzhou Xinho Bus Co., Ltd.

Line 5 of the Guangzhou Metro is one of the operational lines of the Guangzhou Metro, which belongs to the City Tram Transportation, and is represented by the red color. This line is an east-west main line of the Guangzhou Metro network, currently has 24 stations and one carriage section. Currently, the line runs from Fangcun Kaukou, Lai Wan District, west to Wenchuan, Huangpu District, east. The carriages are composed of six L-shaped trains. Line 5 runs roughly east-west, slightly n-shaped, starting on the south side of Fangcun Avenue West, Kaukou Passenger Station, east side, along the Pearl River Bridge, the north side of the Pearl River Bridge, and the Pearl River Bridge radial line in parallel across the Pearl River to Da Tan Sha Island, from Tan O Station from the elevated platform into the underground, east through the South Shore Road and Zhongshan 8 Road intersection, then turn north through Pingxin Village, through a built-up area to West Village Station. Then laid out along the Ring Road Corridor. After the South Gate of the Zoo, turn south to Yang Mei Station.

In 1904, he entered Jiangsu Higher School in Suzhou, and the Qing government stipulated that graduates of the high school could be regarded as leaders, according to their grades, and awarded corresponding positions. In 1907, he graduated, because of rumors outside the school at the time, the school received bribes for malpractice, causing dissatisfaction among the students. A student beat the school supervisor who malpracticed, the school authorities falsely accused him of inciting the students, and told Jiangsu patrol to arrest him. Later, he was released by his teacher Tao Xiaoxiang. In 1908, he went to the same village Chen resigned as the author of the Chinese New Journal because of illness, he recommended him to take up this post, so he took up the post from Shanghai to Shantou, where he met a close friend Lin Yichang. In the spring of 1909, the newspaper president Xie Yiqiang and Xie Liangmao introduced him to join the League.

Driving direction is an important part of the traffic rules of the world. It regulates the position of vehicles on the road to avoid confusion and accidents. Driving direction can be divided into vehicles driving on the left side of the road and driving on the right side of the road. On the basis of safety and other factors, traffic regulations in most countries do not allow the driver's seat to drive on the side of the road. Therefore, left-handed drivers almost all drive on the right side of the vehicle, called the right rudder, right axle or right-hand drive; while right-handed drivers drive on the left, called the left rudder, left axle or left-hand drive. 34% of countries drive on the left, 66% of countries drive on the right. In ancient China, pedestrians, horses and vehicles generally stop and walk on the left side of the passage, called "left-handed".

In the late 1990s, Yahoo!, MSN, Lycos, Excite, Chimo, and many other entry-level websites grew rapidly, and these entry-level companies expanded their services by merging with each other, hoping to increase the amount of time users spent on the site. On October 8, 1997, Yahoo! acquired Four11, the Internet mail service of Four11, Rocketmail eventually became Yahoo! Mail, and Yahoo! also acquired ClassicGames.com, the predecessor of Yahoo! Games.

Symbols of chemical elements are usually one or two letters long, while some artificial elements' IUPAC provisional symbols are three letters long. During the reign of Ming Cheng Tai, "Zenhua Li" was established on both sides of Zeng Wenxi, returned to the jurisdiction of Tianxing County, and dispatched troops to settle there. "Zenhua Li" is far more extensive than the present-day Zenhua District, even within the present-day Nanxi District, later divided into "Zenhua Li West Fort" and "Zenhua Li East Fort." During the Qing Dynasty, this place was located inside the bend of Zeng Wenxi River Road, called "Wanli Sha"; later, the Chinese gradually gathered and developed the city, renamed "Wanli Street", belonged to Anping County, Tainan Prefecture, and had the jurisdiction of "Cruise." After Taiwan was ceded to Japan by the Treaty of Imaguan, in 1895 (Japan Meiji 28), the Japanese colonial authorities first established "Zenhua Military Station Command", military jurisdiction of "Zenhua Li East Fort" and "West Fort"; in 1896 (Japan Meiji 29), it was renamed "Zenhua Military Camp", the same year began to implement civilian rule, changed to "Wanli Administration Office".

After graduating from university, he joined the army on October 8, 1972, was assigned to the Naval Reserve Service, received three months of basic training in the Republic of China Navy Marine Corps, was subsequently promoted to the rank of Lieutenant Commander, Naval Logistics Command, Left Naval Base, and retired from the Navy on August 6, 1974 as a second lieutenant, totaling one year and ten months. In June 1968, he officially joined the Nationalist Party of China. In 1974, he received the Nationalist Party of China Zhongshan Scholarship to study in the United States. In 1977, he received a master's degree in law from New York University, the same year he married his master's student Zhou Meiqing. In November 1980, his eldest daughter Ma Weihong was born in the United States. In 1981, he received a doctorate in jurisprudence from Harvard University. During his stay in the United States, he formed the Anti-Communist Patriotic League, served as a director of the Middle East Region. He was the editor-in-chief of Boston Communications for five years. He wrote essays, editorials, essays, and more than 100,000 words under the pseudonyms of "Yiwu Tai," "Wang Shaolin," "Li Nanqiao," etc., criticized the Communist Party of China, Taiwanese separatists and overseas leftists, and collected Taiwanese separatists' materials.

Social science is a field of study that emerged only after the Enlightenment movement in the eighteenth century. Over time, it has also established the scope of its research subjects, and the concepts of social science have broad and narrow meanings. In 1968, published in Taiwan, the Yuan Five Dictionary of Social Sciences further defined the following twelve social science research subjects, including: psychology, education, statistics, law, politics, administration, international relations, economics, sociology, anthropology, history, and geography. Social science includes: politics, economics, sociology is a typical social science in a narrow sense. Some disciplines, such as history, are a cross between the narrow social sciences and the humanities, but are usually understood as the humanities.

Since then, Putin has won the 2000 and 2004 presidential elections. Due to the constitutional restrictions on re-election, he was unable to participate in the 2008 Russian presidential elections. Subsequently, the candidate nominated by Putin, Dmitri Medvedev, was elected President of Russia. On May 7, 2008, after Putin stepped down as President, President Medvedev nominated Putin for the second time as Prime Minister, continuing to control the country. In 2012, Putin ran for the third time in the presidential election and won and resigned from the chairmanship of the Unified Russia Party, and ran for the fourth time in the 2018 general election for re-election, serving until 2024. On March 14, 2020, Putin signed the "Amendment to the Constitution of the Russian Federation," which he proposed, allowing him to run for two more presidents, breaking the then constitutionally restricted term. The amendment was originally scheduled for a national vote on April 22, 2020, but was delayed due to the COVID-19 epidemic, and the proposal was passed in July.

Cosmogony (also translated as cosmological evolution) refers to a variety of theories, theories and religious doctrines concerning the origin and evolution of celestial bodies and the universe. The word is derived from the Greek κορχογονία (orκορχογενία), composed of κοσμος (cosmology, the world) and ἄγ)νοι (orγέγονα, origin). Numerous theories on the evolution of celestial bodies have been proposed since ancient times. Some ancient Greek philosophers believed that chaos created the cosmos. In the ancient Chinese Taoist textbook Huainanzi Astronomical Instructions, there is a saying that "there is a boundless air, and the clear sun is the sky, and the cloudy cloud is the earth.... the cold air of the clouds is water, and the essence of the water is the moon; and the lewd air of the sun and the moon is the star."

The South African National Defence Force (SANDF) is the armed forces of South Africa. The commander of the South African National Defence Force is appointed by the President of South Africa from one of its units and reports to the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans of the Department of Defence. The current South African Defence Force was formed following the first national elections in 1994 following the end of apartheid and the adoption of a new constitution.

On April 11, 1931, Ma Bufang drove Ma Zhongying from the Three Forts and Six Dams of Minle County to the border of Zhangye to Anxi. The small fort is a village at the foot of the Hami Tianshan Mountain, a Uyghur woman Alisham, attracted the newly appointed small fort sentinel card officer Zhang Guoxuan. Zhang Guoxuan is a relative of Xinjiang Provincial President Jin Shuren, determined to marry this beautiful woman. Unsuccessful, decided to rob the bride. On the night of May 20, 1931 (April 4th of the lunar calendar), Zhang Guoxuan with 32 cartridges of live ammunition, when robbing the bride, was disguised as a bride, the accompanying strong lads captured alive, killed. Jin Shuren heard that the dispatch of troops to the general to kill the people who dare to kill his card officer, triggered a riot in the eastern frontier, the whole frontier.

In April 1984, the local population voted to annex the island to Australia. The ancestors of the inhabitants were the earliest workers and their families, most of whom were of Malay descent, who came to the island from Scotland in 1827-1831 with John Clunies-Ross. The inhabitants of the Cocos Islands, often referred to as the Cocos Malays, lived on the island of Hom with the descendants of John Clunies-Ross and are now mostly Australian citizens. In the mid-1950s, as the islands became overcrowded, many of the inhabitants of the Cocos Islands migrated to Australia, mainly to Western Australia. The inhabitants of the remaining islands were employed by the island's administrative authorities from the mainland and their families, who lived on West Island. Most of the inhabitants worked on coconut plantations on and around the island of Hom.

The term slave originates from ancient French "sclave", medieval Latin "sclavus" and Byzantine Greek "scleroios", which is due to the fact that many Slavs were captured as slaves in the early medieval wars. Slave as a term can also refer to a person who is attached to others. Slaves generally come from prisoners of war, indigenous peoples of the occupied territories, debtors, criminals, the poor, etc. Slaves in ancient and modern Europe were mostly trafficked from the coasts of sub-Saharan Africa and elsewhere. Slavery generally occurs in areas where manual industry and commerce are more developed, because slavery reduces production costs to the greatest extent. Most countries where slavery is legal also have laws capturing and punishing escaped slaves (equivalent to stealing the property of their masters). Slave ownership, also known as traditional slavery, is where slaves are treated as private property, and can be traded as commodities.

After World War II, Germany abandoned the traditional doctrine of command and control and replaced it with substantive command and control, with military orders and military government unified, with the Minister of Defense in peacetime, General Suleiman, in wartime, under the command of the Federal Chancellor; the President of the Federal Republic and unofficial command or control, only when the territory of the Federal Republic was attacked by force, with the consent of the Federal Parliament, declared a state of defence under international law. When Japan established the modern army during the Meiji Restoration, strongly influenced by the German Empire, the emperor was the commander of the army, established the headquarters of the army's staff and the navy's command department, and allowed both sides to directly report to the emperor's "report" powers, not only independently of the cabinet, and resulted in the unique situation of military orders and military government dual system, military orders were also unified into a large headquarters rather than a command department.

China Culture University (Chinese: 中國文化大学; pinyin: CCU) is a private university in Yangmingshan, Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan. It was founded in 1962. The original name of the university was "Far Eastern University". It was proposed by President Chiang Kai-shek to change the name to "China Culture College." It was approved by the Ministry of Education to upgrade the name to "China Culture University". It has been awarded the "Outstanding University for Teaching Excellence Program" by the Ministry of Education for eight consecutive years, and is a member of the "Shingxing Project University" and the "Yushu University Alliance." China Culture University has 13 faculties, 61 departments, 41 master's courses, 10 doctoral courses, and 21 departments to promote the Ministry of Education. Founder Zhang Qiyun is a historian and educator. He was the Minister of Education of the Republic of China, early on he was an important member of the South Higher School of History and the School of Economics. Afterwards, when he was appointed to teach at the National Central University, he was one of the soul figures of the National Cultural Society, a pioneer of modern Confucianism and the Chinese cultural revival movement.

State power has relative autonomy. In different historical periods, its degree of autonomy also varies. The influence on autonomy includes social crisis, social structure, administrative power. Discussion of the essence of power is a classical problem in politics. Early political scholars such as Plato, Aristotle and others believed that the essence of power is the best. By the Middle Ages, Augustine regarded power as a "secular city", that the secular world is not good. This idea has always influenced Machiavelli, and from Locke to Paine, state power has been transformed into "necessary evil". Marxism explored the essence of power from the point of view of the class, that the essence of the state is the essence of the class, and that state power is the product of an irreconcilable conflict of class interests. The city-states established by the Sumerians were generally regarded as the initial form of the state, and were later copied by many Mediterranean nations, among which the Jewish Greek Athens was the most characteristic, but in fact the most representative of the Roman Republic, and other city-states were often monarchs or aristocracies, such as Sparta in ancient Greece and Carthage in North Africa.

Steel structural engineering is an important part of Guangzhou South Railway Station. The waiting hall, roof and rain shelter of Guangzhou South Railway Station are all new rigid structures such as long span prestressed arch shell and three-way hinged arch. The roof of the station is equipped with a solar panel with an area of about 2,000 square meters. After the solar energy is converted into electricity, it is supplied directly to the station. Currently, the main structure of Guangzhou South Railway Station consists of five floors, including four floors above ground to the basement. The departure floor of the station is located on three floors above ground, for the elevated passenger waiting hall, the elevated waiting hall has an area of 71,722 square meters.
