In the 19th century, most of today's Eastern District was still a sparsely populated plain in the east and south-east of Tainan City. Due to the fact that there were no rivers in the high-lying area of Tainan, the area was mostly covered with dry land, and the wind was blowing through the sand, the industry was still dominated by farmers. Therefore, the Christian Presbyterian Church in Tainan City in the late Qing Dynasty, after the missionary work encountered the rejection of the inhabitants at that time, moved to the eastern part of the sparsely populated city. The Tainan Seminary (1882), Chorong Secondary School (1885), Chorong Middle School (1887) and the New Building Hospital in the Eastern District were established at that time and continue to this day. In the early days of Jing Dynasty, within the territory of today's Eastern District, there were a few small villages such as Emperor's Hall, Tiger's Tavern, King's Tavern, Taiya's Tavern, Go's Tavern, Xu's Tavern, Kudan's Tavern, Sanpo's Tavern, Chu's Tavern, Take's Tavern, and Tailu East.

The sun, moon, and earth must be more precisely aligned before a solar eclipse occurs. The moon must first reach the yellow and white intersection, and must converge with the time of the new moon. Moreover, the moon's orbit is elliptical, the distance between the Earth and the moon is near and far, so the moon's angular diameter is large and small. Only when the moon is close enough to the Earth is it possible to completely obscure the sun, a solar eclipse occurs. During a solar eclipse, the moon's shadow on the Earth sweeps a long path, only on this path can the eclipse be seen, so a solar eclipse is a very rare phenomenon for any single location on the Earth.

"The initial success of the National Revolution is the real beginning of the nation-building work. Our Chinese nation-building work has both domestic and international aspects." "The current stage of the National Revolution, from the completion of nationalism, to the implementation of civil rights and people's socialism." Asserting that China has only one nation, the Chinese nation. Chiang Kai-shek summarized China's 5,000-year history evolution and Confucian cultural foundations with his own world view, reviewing China's recent and modern history, asserting that the abolition of the unequal treaties is the result of belief in the Three-Nationalism, in particular, the Northern Expedition of the National Revolutionary Army and the War of Resistance against Japan. This book severely criticizes liberalism and communism, stating that both destroy traditional Chinese culture, the dispute between the two is a contradiction between Anglo-American thought and Soviet thought, and asserting that the Three-Nationalism is the "highest principle of national revolution invariant", "the only correct line of national revival", and other parties should abandon their respective claims.

Daylight saving time (DST) (also known as summer time in the United States and Canada) is the practice of speeding up the time at the expense of normal sunrise time in the summer months. A region that usually uses daylight saving time speeds up the time by one hour near the beginning of spring and returns to normal time in the fall. In 1895, George Hudson proposed the concept of daylight saving time. Daylight saving time is not generally used in Asia and Africa, so only a small minority of the world's population uses it. Sometimes, the conversion of daylight saving time makes reporting work more complicated, and disrupts travel, accounting, record keeping, medical facilities, and heavy equipment.

The Republic of Suriname (Dutch: Republiek Suriname), commonly known as Suriname (Dutch: Suriname), is a sovereign state located in North America, the North Atlantic Ocean, southern Brazil, eastern French Guiana, and western Guyana. It is currently a member of the Union of South American Nations. Formerly known as Dutch Guiana, the country was a Dutch colony in South America. It became an overseas autonomous province of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in 1954, and became independent in 1975. Suriname is the smallest country in South America in terms of both area and population, and the only country in the Western Hemisphere not part of the Kingdom of the Netherlands that uses the Dutch language as its official language. The capital, Paramaribo, is a trading port at the mouth of the Suriname River. Suriname is an extremely multi-ethnic, linguistic, and religious country, with a Muslim population of 13%, the highest proportion of any country in the Americas.

The story describes that Tang Xuanzong favored Princess Yang Yuhuan, enjoyed all day long, made his brother Yang Kunzhong to the right, his three sisters to be his wife, but later Tang Xuanzong also favored his sister, Lady Wu Kunzhong, privately summoned Princess Mei, caused Yang Yuhuan displeasure, the two finally reconciled, on the night of the seventh eve in the Changsheng Palace to the ox-weaving princess secretly vowed never to separate, is the reason of Bai Kuiyi "The Long Hate Song" "July seventh Changsheng Palace, the night half empty of private words".For the joy of fighting Yang Yuhuan, Tang Xuanzong spared no expense of a large amount of human and material resources from Hainan to collect fresh lychee for Yang Yuhuan, tread down the road to destroy crops, tread down the road to die.Because Tang Xuanzong enjoyed all day long and Yang Yuhuan, ignored the political affairs, favored Yang Kunzhong and An Lushan, after An Lushan rebellion, Tang Xuanzong and accompanying officials fled Chang'an, mutiny in Shaanxi Ma'an Po soldiers, strongly demanded the execution of the culprit Yang Kunzhong and Yang Yuhuan, Tang Xuanzong must not let Yang Yuhuan hang himself.

The so-called "All great are called Yu," "but the heavens are great." In the "Ganshi Shijing," it is said: "The filling star, the lord of Songshan, Yuzhou." The filling star, that is, the town star, Saturn. "The filling star position, that is, the central soil, the lord of Qixia." Thus, Yuzhou, filling star, and the soil of the five rows correspond to each other. In 5000-4000 years ago, Henan was the center of China's Kyushu, Henan Province is the subject of the Chinese traditional geographical concept of "Central Plains," and "Central Province," Yuzhou, "Central soil," "Central summer," "China," the word "China" originates from Luoyang City, Henan Province. Henan, historically called "Central Plains," is one of the important birthplaces of the Huaxia civilization and one of the core regions of Chinese history. Luoyang (13th Dynasty), Kaifeng (7th Dynasty), Anyang (7th Dynasty), and Zhengzhou (5th Dynasty) are all famous millennium-old capitals.

On 8 February 1963, Saddam returned to Baghdad after the Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party's seizure of power in the Ramadan coup d'état, and began to take control of the party's internal powers. However, in November of the same year, President Aliyev launched a coup d'état against the Ba'ath Party; he was arrested by the authorities in November 1964. However, in 1966, he was elected deputy general secretary of the Ba'ath Party in prison, succeeding in escaping prison the same year; by this time, Saddam was the second leader of the Ba'ath Party, succeeding only to Abdulrahman Aliyev, and began to restructure the Ba'ath Party. In July 1968, he returned to Iraq to assist in the coup d'état, overthrew President Aliyev, and restored the Ba'ath Party to power; in November 1969, he became deputy secretary of the Revolutionary Command and Minister of Publicity and Security.

Yan Huiqing (Chinese: 颜惠庆; April 2, 1877 – May 24, 1950) was a Chinese politician and diplomat from Shanghai County, Jiangsu Province. His ancestors were from Shandong Province and later moved to southern Fujian Province. His father, Yan Yongjing, came to Shanghai from Fujian early in his life as a parish priest of Hongkou Anglican Church and one of the founders of St. John's University. He studied at St. John's College, Yinghua College, and Hongkou Documentary Institute. In 1895, he went to the United States to attend high school. In 1897, he entered the University of Virginia to study. During his time there, he was a teacher at a church school and was a member of the Chinese Embassy in the United States. In June 1900, Yan Huiqing graduated.

In 627, An Lu County returned to Haifeng County, which belonged to the Lingnan Province. In 690, Wu Zetian Yuan changed Haifeng County to Leixiang County. In 742, Xu Zon Heavenly Treasure changed Leixiang County to Haifeng County. In 758, Su Zon Qian changed Haifeng County to Haifeng County. Yuri Vladimirovich Andropov (Russian: Ю́рий Влади́мирович Андро́пов, June 15, 1914 – February 9, 1984) was the Supreme Leader of the Soviet Union, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union from 1982 to 1984, Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the Soviet Union and Chairman of the Defense Council of the Soviet Union. From 1954 to 1957, Andropov served as the Soviet Ambassador to Hungary, participated in the activities to pacify the 1956 Hungarian Revolution. On May 10, 1967, he was appointed Chairman of the KGB. He oversaw the large-scale suppression of protests, which was carried out through large-scale arrests and large-scale implementation of involuntary psychiatric treatment of people considered "unpopular in society".

Margaret Hilda Thatcher, Baroness Thatcher LG OM PC FRS FRIC (13 October 1925 – 8 April 2013), commonly known by her maiden name Roberts, was a British politician who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1979 to 1990 and as Leader of the Conservative Party from 1975 to 1990.

The inhabitants of the Nguni slowly formed a group called the Southern Ndebele people, although the word "Ndebele" is translated as exile in Soto, and the river near where they lived was named after one of their chiefs, Tshwane, but because the word "Tshwane" means "little monkey" in Ndebele, it was directly translated into South African as the Apies River. Pretoria was founded in 1855 by the leader of the "Voortrekkers", Marthinus Wessel Pretorius, and named after his father, Andreas Pretoria.

In dilute aqueous solutions, phosphates exist in four forms: in strong bases, more phosphate ions (PO43−) are present; in weak bases, more hydrogen phosphate ions (HPO42−) are present; in weak acids, more hydrogen phosphate ions (H2PO4−) are present; and in strong acids, water-soluble phosphate (H3PO4) is the predominant form. More precisely, there are three equilibrium reactions: at 25 °C, there are various acidity coefficients (mol/L): at the pH of strong bases (pH=13), one finds: [H2PO4−][H3PO4] 7.5×1010, [HPO42−][H2PO4−] 6.2×105, [PO43−][HPO42−] 2.14 {\displaystyle {\frac {}}\simeq 2.14} Only phosphates (PO43−) and hydrogen phosphate (HPO42−) are visible as the predominant components.

The Republic of the Congo (French: République du Congo; Kituba: Repubilika ya Kongo; Lingala: Républiquei ya Kongó), abbreviated Congo, Brazzaville Congo or Congo (B), is a country in central Africa, with the capital in Brazzaville, bordering the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Gabon and Angola, and adjacent to the Gulf of Guinea. Historically controlled by the Bantu tribe, it became a French colony, French-speaking, and gained independence in 1960. Between 1970 and 1991, the country was called the People's Republic of the Congo, a Marxist-Leninist one-party state; in 1992, it changed to a multi-party system, but in 1997, the government collapsed in the civil war.

The Atlantic Ocean occupies 20% of the Earth's surface area, second only to the Pacific Ocean. Its surface area is estimated to be approximately 106,400,000 square kilometres (82,400,000 sq mi). The land area flowing into the Atlantic Ocean is four times that of the Pacific or Indian Ocean. The total capacity of the Atlantic Ocean is estimated to be 354,700,000 cubic kilometres (323,600,000 cubic kilometres). The average depth of the Atlantic Ocean is estimated to be 3,338 metres (3,900,000 ft). The depth of the Atlantic Ocean is estimated to be 3,926 metres (3,900,000 ft). The depth of the Atlantic Ocean is estimated to be 8,605 metres (3,900,000 ft) at the Puerto Rico Trench.

In May 1981, on the eve of her death, the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China decided to confer the title of Honorary President of the People's Republic of China on Song Qingling, the only person to have the title of Honorary President of the People's Republic of China to date, and the Politburo of the Communist Party of China also approved her joining the Communist Party of China. Song Qingling was revered by the Communist Party of China as "Mr. (Song) Qingling" and "Mrs. Sun"; was honored by Premier Zhou Enlai as "the treasure of the country" (later General Secretary of the Communist Party of China Jiang Zemin; there is a documentary of the same name); and the People's Republic of China was officially evaluated as "great patriotism, democracy, internationalism, communist warriors".

Ni Guizhen (Chinese: 倪珪珍; June 22, 1869 – July 23, 1931) was the mother of three sisters, Song Meiling, Song Qingling, and Song Meiling, and the wife of the Reverend Song Gaap. She was born in the Nijiayan people in the Shanghai Public Concession. On July 15, 1931, Song Meiling was accompanied by Lady Song, Song Xiaoliang, and Confucius Xi's children from Shanghai to Qingdao, with the protection of 18 people including the secretary of the Ministry of Finance, Zhiyuan Ben, and others: 152. On July 25, 1931, Song Meiling and Song Ziwen, Song Xiaoliang, Song Qingling, Song Xiaoliang, and Song Zi'an, and others, in Shanghai "Declaration" and "People's Daily" published "Death of Lady Song Mother Ni Tai" (152-153). Father Ni Jishan was also a Reverend, his mother's surname was Xu, and he was the descendant of Xu Guangqi. Ni Guizhen graduated from the Girls' School of Shanghai Yin Wen at the age of 17, excelled in mathematics, enjoyed playing the piano, and stayed at school as a teacher. In the summer of 1887, she married Song Gaap.

Guangzhou Bus is one of the main modes of transportation in Guangzhou. It is operated by the Guangzhou Municipal Government, which provides financial resources, the Guangzhou Public Transport Group's bus companies and some private bus companies. At the end of the 19th century, as buses were not yet widespread, the main means of transportation in Guangzhou were Japanese-imported Huangbao cars, i.e. "Oriental cars". At that time, the Huangbao car companies operating in Guangzhou - Liyuan, Xiang'an, Daiyi, Anle, etc. 10 companies had more than 200 Huangbao cars. Huangbao cars could pass guests by the route according to the door signs, which was convenient, so the business of Huangbao cars was long. After the Huangbao cars entered China, they were modified many times, and eventually converted to a motorcycle version. People were also upgrading the Huangbao cars with a batch of tricycle buses; and after the appearance of the tricycle buses, the Huangbao cars began to be phased out.

In 1932, Zhang Dongsheng and Zhang Junsheng formed the National Socialist Party of China (the predecessor of the People's Socialist Party), founded the "Regeneration" weekly, opposed the one-party dictatorship of the Kuomintang "outside the Party, no party", demanded the Kuomintang to end the training phase and implement the constitution. The Kuomintang inherited the "research department", participated in the National Senate of the Chongqing National Government. However, after the list of the second National Senate was published, the number of non-Kuomintang members decreased, in 1941, the Kuomintang and the Youth Party, the Chinese National Liberation Action Committee (later renamed the Chinese Farmers and Workers' Democratic Party), the Chinese People's National Salvation Congress, the Chinese Vocational Education Society and non-partisans formed the Alliance of the Chinese Democratic Party, hoping to become a powerful political force, counterbalance the Kuomintang, and the Kuomintang was one of the important members.

During the French Revolutionary War, European countries conquered by France, such as the First Republic of Spain, also formed regional committees to govern after the overthrow of the monarchy. After the October Revolution in Russia, the Russian Communist Party established Soviet rule, also a form of committee. Under the influence of the Soviet Union, the Republic of China also adopted a committee system during the period of national government, until 1946 after the constitutional reform, it changed to a cabinet system. In the past, many communist countries under the influence of the Soviet Union, many adopted Soviet-like committee system: such as the People's Republic of China, as the head of state, the President of the People's Republic of China, according to the legislative spirit is appointed by the National People's Congress to execute the joint resolutions of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, actually has no separate powers, formally belongs to the committee system; moreover, since the Chinese Communist Party is the sole governing party of the People's Republic of China, its highest authority - the permanent organ of the Central Committee, the Standing Committee of the Politburo of the Politburo of China as the party's highest decision-making body during the meetings of the Politburo and the closing of the Central Assembly, also corresponds to the country's actual highest decision-making body, its meetings under the auspices of the General Secretary to discuss major countries, this also has some features of the committee system.

In the early days of the Republic, the administrative districts of the country were adjusted several times, and counties replaced prefectural and provincial offices and became the most common administrative divisions at the grassroots level. The coexistence of the counties thus became the coexistence of the flag counties. Since the end of the Qing Dynasty, with the immigration of the Han and the reclamation of pastures, the Han population in Inner Mongolia has been growing steadily. The reclamation of pastures has more directly impacted the way of life of the Mongolian people. Since the 1900s, anti-reclamation has been the subject of the Dugonglong movement. Against this background, the national government has continued the management system of the end of the Qing Dynasty, and even the Manchurian government has implemented this management system, such as the Ao Han flag and the Xinhui county have jurisdiction over the same area.

In August 1959, Professor Li Weixiang, who was the headmaster of Taipei Technical Vocational School at the time, proposed that the school motto should be "Truthful, Simple, Thorough and diligent." With the agreement of Principal Zhang Dan, the school was requested to hold a school affairs meeting, and the school affairs meeting was passed, so that the school was formally endorsed by the Education Department and the Ministry of Education. The school song of the early industrial school was written in Japanese. In 1948, when Taipei Technical Vocational School was reorganized as an industrial specialty school, the headmaster at the time requested Professor Zhao Yujun to write the lyrics, and then the music teacher of the Taipei Technical Vocational School at the time, Professor Wu Kui-cheng composed the music. In the summer of 1948, the school affairs council was requested to hold a meeting, and the resolution of the headmasters of all levels of the council was passed, and the school motto was officially endorsed. (Chinese: 簡卓堅 詞 吳居徹 曲) Taipei Technical College Red Building was built in 1926 (Showa era, the 15th year of the National People's Republic), as the first surviving school building, the walls were all made of red brick and became known as Red Building.

General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union General Secretary of the President of the Soviet Union (1985–1991) President of the Soviet Union (1990–1991) After the end of the Soviet Union's foreign policy, economic reform (Russian: перестро́йка, pronounced, help·information, International Phonetic Alphabet: ) refers to a series of economic reform measures implemented by Mikhail Gorbachev, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union since June 1987. Together with the political reforms and open policies of the time, these reforms formed the key words of domestic policy during Gorbachev's rule. "перестро́йка" literally means "reconstruction", with the intention of changing the Soviet Union's stagnant economic situation.

MTR Corporation Limited (Chinese: 香港鉄道公司; pinyin: MTR; ICAO: 0066, OTCBB: MTRJY) was founded on 26 September 1975 as the Mass Transit Railway Corporation. It was privatised in 2000 and incorporated as a limited company on 26 April of the same year under the name of MTR Corporation Limited. Following the merger of two railways in 2007, the name was changed to its present name on 2 December 2007 through the transfer of operational rights to operate the network and operations of the Kowloon-Hong Kong Railway Company. The headquarters of the Hong Kong Railway Company Limited is located at 33 Defoe Square, Kowloon Bay, Hong Kong, on several floors of the Hong Kong Railway Headquarters Building and the 2nd floor of the International Financial Centre (including the 45th floor of the Board of Directors' Office). The main business is to operate the monopoly integrated railway network in Hong Kong—MTR, including the Kowloon-Hong Kong Railway Company system under the system and operational rights it has built and owned.

The Orion variable is a variable star that exhibits irregularities and luminous emission variations, usually associated with diffuse nebulae, with wavelength fluctuations of up to several magnitudes. It is believed that these are young stars that will become normal, non-variable, zero-age main sequence stars in the future. T Taurus is a Orion variable star, with fluorescent violet emission lines uniquely characterized by iron ions (Fe II) in the star's spectral spectrum, as well as emission lines of lithium, a metal that is usually destroyed in the star's nuclear fusion. FU Ori (FU Orionis) is commonly referred to as "Fuors". Its brightness first rises to 5-6 magnitudes, then sinks to a quantum level, and maintains that magnitude for decades. FU Orionis is a prototype of such a variable star, and other samples include V1057 Cygnus and V1515 Cygnus.

阮高祺. General of the Air Force of the Republic of Vietnam, formerly Commander-in-Chief of the Air Force of the Republic of Vietnam, retired from politics. Born on September 8, 1930, in Shanxi Province in northern Vietnam, he is the third and only son of a teacher named Nguyen Quoc. Nguyen Quoc was born in the early 1950s at the first and only pre-service military officer school in northern Vietnam established by the Vietnamese state with the support of France. After leaving the school, he joined the Air Force, serving as a former senator and as Commander-in-Chief of the Air Force. He served as Chairman of the Central Executive Committee, Prime Minister (1965-1967) and Vice President (1967-1971). He was an ally and opponent of President Nguyễn Văn Thiệu, and was considered an ally of anti-communist ideology until 1975. After the 1975 430 incident, he went to the United States to live. In the United States, he continued to criticize Nguyễn Văn Thiệu and Communism.

The National Government Committee is the administrative organ of the Wang Jingwei regime. According to the Law on the Organization of the National Government of the Republic of China, promulgated by the Wang Jingwei regime, the National Government Committee is composed of the President of the National Government and the members of the National Government, and the choice is made by the Central Political Committee. On March 30, 1940, when the National Government was established in Nanjing, Wang Jingwei was appointed as the Deputy President of the National Government (who was still serving as the President of the National Government in Linsen, Chongqing at the time). The Central Political Committee met on November 28, the same year, and amended the Law on the Organization of the National Government of the Republic of China, deleting the provisions that "the President shall not bear actual political responsibility" and "the President shall not hold any other official positions," and elected Wang Jingwei as the President of the National Government. In 1944, Wang Jingwei went to Japan for treatment due to his deteriorating condition, and on March 22, the Central Political Committee held an interim meeting.

The Eighth Army of the National Revolutionary Army was formed five times: in 1926, 1931, 1937, 1938 and 1941. In June 1926, the Fourth Division of the Shogun and Yeqi Brigade were reorganized into the Eighth Army of the National Revolutionary Army. Chi Tang was appointed commander, Liu Wenshima was appointed party representative and former head of the Political Department of the General Headquarters of the Enemy, Ho Jian was appointed commander of the Second Division, Li Pingxian was appointed commander of the Third Division, Liu Xing was appointed commander of the Fourth Division, Yeqi was appointed commander of the Fifth Division, Zhou Luang was appointed instructor-in-chief, Xia Toon was appointed commander of the First Division of the O Army, and Harun was appointed independent commander. In July 1926, the Eighth Army of the National Revolutionary Army participated in the Northern Campaign of the National Revolutionary Army, capturing Changsha (the Second Battle of Changsha) and Yuezhou (the Third Battle of Yuezhou). On September 6, it attacked Khangyang. In April 1927, Li Pingxian was appointed commander. In August 1928, the Eighth Army was reorganized into the Fifty-first Division of the National Revolutionary Army.

In January 1927, the Sixth Army was formed within the Northern Expeditionary Army's Jiangyu Army (Chief Commander Cheng Qian), from Jiangxi to Anhui. Cheng Qian twice rejected Chiang Kai-shek's order to suspend attacks on Nanjing on the grounds of "strong enemy forces" - Chiang Kai-shek demanded that Cheng Qian's unit wait for the Jiang Left Army, which was fighting from Shanghai to Danyang and under the command of Ho Ying-chin, to besiege Nanjing together. Cheng Qian approached the front line, attacked Nanjing on March 24, 1927, and achieved its first victory. In 1928, the Xiang Gui Joint Army attacked Tang Seng-chi, Cheng Qian's Sixth Army helped Li Zongren to open the gateway between the forces of Gui and Guangxi. However, on May 21, 1928, Li Zongren, on the pretext of "despotism, seizure of Xiang's government", imprisoned Cheng Qian, and announced that he would be relieved of his duties. Meanwhile, Cheng Qian's Sixth Army was quickly divided, and the Sixth Army was first led by the acting commander of the 17th Division, Li Mingqiao.

In September 2017, the General Office of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the General Office of the State Council issued the General Program for Establishing the System of National Parks.On March 17, 2018, the First Session of the Thirteenth National People's Congress adopted the Decision of the First Session of the Thirteenth National People's Congress on the Institutional Reform Program of the State Council, and approved the Institutional Reform Program of the State Council.According to the Institutional Reform Program of the State Council, it was decided to integrate the management functions of the former departments of the State Forestry Bureau, the Ministry of Land Resources, the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Construction, the Ministry of Water Resources, the Ministry of Agriculture, the State Oceanic Bureau, and other departments, such as the nature reserves, scenic spots, natural heritage, geological parks, and so on, and to form the State Forestry and Grassland Bureau, which is administered by the Ministry of Natural Resources, along with one agency of the National Park Administration.On April 10, 2018, the State Forestry and Grassland Bureau (National Park Administration) was officially established.

During the Wei and Jin dynasties, a book titled "Zimin Yagyu" describes the biological characteristics of vegetables and their cultivation techniques. In the Han and Tang Dynasties, following the west region of Zhangjiatong, many vegetables were imported from Hudi and Nanban. In the Song and Ming Dynasties, the poem "Wuji is full of vegetables at four o'clock every day, the first comes after the second comes alive" further illustrated the prosperity of vegetable cultivation. After the Ming and Qing dynasties, the variety of vegetables was constantly increasing. Vegetables are important by-products, and there are different types of vegetables in all seasons. Not only do they provide a variety of foods, increase appetite, but they also provide the body with the nutrients it needs to maintain its health. In recent years, there has been more evidence that consuming vegetables and fruits is less dangerous for cancer and is ten times more beneficial to the body. Vegetables are the main sources of minerals and vitamins it needs. Although vegetables are rich in nutrients and healthy health components, in order for these nutrient values to play their role, it is necessary to pay attention to the quality of vegetables.

After the outbreak of the war, Liu Changyi organized the volunteer army in Zhangjiakou. After Zhangjiakou was lost, he retreated along the Tailing Mountains with Liu Yeming's unit to Qinyang, Henan Province. In 1938, he was incorporated into the 1st War Area Yubei Detachment Army. In the spring of 1940, Liu Changyi's leadership attacked Japan near Wen County, Henan Province. It was reorganized into the Peace-Building Army Yubei Suijing Command and 21st Division. On September 21, 1941, anyway, more than 600 Japanese troops were exterminated, Nantou Huang River crossed into the 1st War Area, was reorganized into the Interim 15th Army, belonged to the 28th Army: In April 1943, the Deputy Commander of the 1st War Area Tom Eun-bak annexed the army, the 27th Division was reorganized into the 85th Army, the 1st Brigade was reorganized into the 15th Army, and the new 29th Division, the 11th Reserve Division of the 85th Army under the direct control of the 31st Army was reorganized into the Interim 15th Army. In July 1944, the 27th Division (with Xiao Jing as commander) was reorganized from the 85th Army.

The website is one of the most important Chinese news websites in the world. It publishes news information in seven languages: Chinese (简,繁), English, French, Western, Russian, Arabic and Japanese, all the time without interruption, and has a daily circulation of nearly 4,500 articles. The content is mainly news, divided into two main sections: news section and news section. It includes 14 news categories, including domestic, international, financial, securities, sports, science and technology, IT, legal, social, entertainment, education, campus, reading, automobile, etc. On August 21, 2003, it began to disseminate news, music, sports, education, science and technology, and financial multimedia programs to domestic and international audiences.

In 1937, with the help of the Soviet Union, the government of the Qing dynasty finally appeased the rebel forces in the province. In the early days of the late Qing dynasty, the Uyghurs in the territory of the Hami were administered by the Hami dynasty. In the Qing Kangxi period, the Hami chief, Nubedullah, was entrusted with the position of Zasakh, the same as the Zasakh of the Mongolian flags (flag chiefs), and Luson was the chieftain of the mainland. The descendants of Nubedullah were enfeoffed to Prince Kazuo because of military achievements. At the time of the establishment of Xinjiang province in the late Qing Dynasty, Prince Hami was not stripped of his powers and became the only domain king of the entire province. After the Xinhai Revolution, Yang Xinxiang reigned as the new ruler of Xinjiang, retaining the title and power of Prince Hami. In 1930, Prince Hami died. Xinjiang provincial chairman Jin Jinjun decided to abolish the Hami dynasty and to revert to the mainland.

On March 15, 1936, 19-year-old Zhang Chunqiao published an article titled "Let's Execute Self-criticism," under the pen name "Dick," in the supplement "Torch" of the Tai Evening Post. In response to Zhou Yang's slogan of "Defense Literature," Zhang believed that the writer Tianjun (Shao Jun's pen name) had left northeastern China too early, and that his work "The Countryside in August" was not real enough. "After the arrest of the Gang of Four," the official media accused Zhang of "serving under the command of Special Agent Cui Wanqiu in the cultural movement, pseudonym "Dick" madly attacking Lu Xun." In 1936, Song Zhending (pseudonym Wu Chengzhi, the director of the Forestry Department of Inner Mongolia after the establishment of the Chinese Communist Party), Lin Fuxing, and other party members who lost contact with the CCP party organization organized a committee of party members to prepare the CCP, and developed some left-wing members to join the Communist Party.

Tainan Theological Seminary (Chinese: 台南神学院; pinyin: 南神) is a theological seminary belonging to the Presbyterian Church of Taiwan in the southern part of Taiwan, with the aim of cultivating joint pastoral clergy and ministers to serve the Church and Taiwanese society as a God-willed nation. The founding of the seminary dates back to 1869, when Dr. Mayakovsky and Rev. Li Xiang founded the missionary training class in Fucheng after the flag, and in 1876, Rev. Buckley merged the two into Fucheng College, which had been shut down several times due to the war. The current campus was established in 1903, renamed "Tainan Theological Seminary" in 1913, and changed its name to "Tainan Theological Seminary" in 1948, and then approved by the Ministry of Education of the Republic of China in 2017 to establish "Tainan Theological Seminary of the Presbyterian Church of Taiwan," a joint university to this day. Located in the Dong'anfang Cultural Park in Tainan City, Yan'o District, Kaohsiung City [Tainan Theological Seminary] (under the Ministry of the Interior) [Tainan Theological Seminary of the Presbyterian Church of Taiwan] (under the Ministry of Education) "Original Tainan Theological Seminary School and Chapel" is a schoolhouse built during the Japanese occupation of Taiwan, that is, today's Buckley Memorial Hall and Chapel was designated as a Historic Site of Tainan City in 2002.

The Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) and the Republic of China Armed Forces (RAF) used artillery bombardment as their main tactical operations, hence the term artillery warfare. On August 23, 1958, the PLA launched the first artillery warfare, and the RAF immediately began to counterattack. In the early stages of the artillery warfare, the PLA attacked military targets on the island, and later severely blockaded the shipping lanes in order to encircle Kinmen. In the early stages of the artillery warfare, the RAF suddenly failed to defend itself, and as the fighting continued, it gradually regained its strength; it maintained the supply lines at Kinmen. During the artillery warfare, both naval vessels and air forces fought repeatedly. In early October, the PLA abandoned the blockade, changing it to "one-on-one, two-on-two" (one-on-one, two-on-two), and gradually reduced its offensive. Thereafter, the Republic of China successfully defended the Jinma area. The PRC maintained one-on-one, two-on-two until January 1, 1979, the day of the establishment of diplomatic relations with the United States, when it formally declared a ceasefire through the Letter to the Taiwan Compatriots.

A CAS number is divided into three parts by the character "-", the first part has two to seven digits, the second part has two digits, and the third part has one digit as the calibration code. The CAS number is ordered in ascending order and has no intrinsic meaning. The calibration code is calculated as follows: The last digit of the CAS sequence number (first and second digits) is multiplied by 1, the last digit is multiplied by 2, and so on, and then all the product is added, divided and subtracted by 10, and the remainder is the calibration code of the third part. For example, for water (H2O) the first two digits of the CAS number are 7732-18, the calibration code is ( 8×1 + 1×2 + 2×3 + 3×4 + 7×5 + 7×6 ) mod 10 = 105 mod 10 = 5 (mod is the residual operator) Different isomer molecules have different CAS numbers, for example, the CAS number for right glucose is 50-99-7, the CAS number for left glucose is 921-60-8, and the calibration code for alpha right glucose (α-D-glucose) is 26655-34-5.

After the October Revolution in Russia, the contradiction between the West and the Soviet Union intensified due to ideological and territorial expansionist reasons. The contradiction developed into the late 1930s, the main strategic opponent of England and France was the Soviet Union, while the conflict with Germany on Eastern European interests became more and more acute. Nazi Germany also opposed communism, and the rise of Nazi Germany prevented the Soviet Union from seizing Polish territory. Therefore, the game and struggle between the West, Germany and the Soviet Union began. Hitler planned to invade Poland, to connect East Prussia with Germany's mainland, and to intensify preparations for the expansion of aggression to the West. Faced with the aggressive mood of Germany, "Britain and France and others resigned, did not prepare to fight Germany, hoped that Germany would stop expanding", a policy of appeasement was adopted against Germany. To this end, England and France also signed the Munich Agreement with Germany, so that Hitler would be satisfied with the acquisition of the Sudetenland.

In 1937, due to the outbreak of the Pacific War, Taiwan changed to use "Central Standard Time" (UTC+9), until the defeat of Japan in 1945. In 1918, the Government of the Republic of China Central Observatory divided the country into five standard time zones, of which "Central Standard Time" is eight hours faster than the world time (UTC+8). After the return of Taiwan in 1945, Taiwan joined the Chinese Standard Time "Central Standard Time Zone". At that time, the Ministry of the Interior of the Republic of China was in charge of the relevant affairs of the time zone, the Central Research Institute and other organizations were responsible for the actual allocation of time. According to the time zone stipulated in the "Method of Implementation of Standard Time in All Regions of the Country" promulgated by the Government of the Republic of China in 1947, all Taiwanese radio and television stations used the term "Central Standard Time" when reporting. In 2005, the Standards Review Bureau of the Ministry of Economy stated that a set of national time standards has now been established, which is a unit of measurement of time in Taiwan, does not include the term "Central Standard Time" or "Taiwan Time" and does not intend to name it.

King Haakon and his government fled the United Kingdom, the Germans intended to use the Norwegian heavy water factory to produce heavy water for the production of atomic bombs, but were destroyed by the Allies. The German military controlled the entire territory of Norway until the German surrender on 8 May 1945, when the army in Norway was disarmed. World War II ended as one of the victorious nations. In 1949, Norway joined the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. In 1945, the Norwegian people's cruelty to Norwegian women and their children, street demonstrations, torture, and other inhumane acts, which were associated with the Germans, was satirized as a "new generation of Nazis." In 1957, Haakon VII died, and his son succeeded him as Olaf V. In 1959, he joined the European Free Trade Union. In 1972 and 1994, he voted twice to join the European Union, but did not pass, and since then the proportion of people who opposed joining the European Union has been higher than those who supported joining the European Union.

It is an international system of states, transnational corporations and organizations that began with the signing of the Treaty of Westphalia in 1648. Sovereignty is a term that is often misused. "Perhaps there is no more controversial concept than sovereignty," said Lassa Oppenheim. "From the moment it was introduced into political science until today, there has never been a concept that has a universally accepted meaning. It is an indisputable fact." Although the terms "state" and "government" are often used interchangeably, in general, states are enduring entities, although they may disappear through voluntary means or external forces (such as military conquest). Since the end of World War II, the practice of violent abolition of state power has virtually ceased.

China's ancient inventions, such as compass, papermaking, printing and gunpowder, have contributed greatly to the development of the world. It also has an advanced agriculture and handicrafts industry. China is rich in natural resources. Between 1860 and 1945, the British, French, American, German, Italian, Russian, Japanese, Austro-Hungarian and Belgian governments signed treaties and agreements in the southeastern direction of the old city of Tianjin, China. Tianjin has administrative autonomy and extraterritorial jurisdiction. At the same time, Tianjin was one of the first cities in China to reclaim the territory. In 1945, after the victory in the war against Japan, the Government of the Republic of China formally reclaimed the last two territories in Tianjin - the British and French territories, marking the end of the history of the Tianjin Territory.

In the mid-latitudes of the Northern Hemisphere, the best time to observe zodiacal light is in the western sky after the complete disappearance of the dawn of spring, or in the eastern sky before the dawn of autumn. Because zodiacal light is very faint, moonlight or light pollution can easily cover the ecliptic light. The intensity of the ecliptic light decreases with distance from the Sun, but it can also be observed on very dark nights to envelop the entire ecliptic. In fact, the ecliptic light is scattered throughout the sky, accounting for about 60% of the total brightness of the night sky on clear moonless nights.

On March 13, 2017, at the 12th NCC's 5th meeting, Special Representative Leung Chong-ying was elected Vice President by 2,066 votes in favor, 13 against and 16 abstentions. Leung Chong-ying also served as both Head of State and Chief Executive. Since May 2018, Leung Chong-ying has used his Facebook account to "snipe" pro-democracy activists and organizations, as well as the government's education department, to become an opinion leader representing the views of the establishment. During the 2019 Anti-Reform Movement, Leung Chong-ying spearheaded the establishment of the 803 Fund, which encouraged citizens to report "riots" with a huge gold prize. Leung Chong-ying's father, Leung Chung-on (formerly known as Leung Zhao-yuan), was a police officer recruited from Shandong Weihaiwei in the early days of the establishment of the Hong Kong Police Force, commonly referred to as "the Shandong defector," who had been stationed at the Governor's Office and at the top of the mountain. Leung Chong-ying has a sister and a sister, and is the only child in the family, ranked second in the family.

Suyuan Station is a transfer station of Line 6 and Line 21 of Guangzhou Metro, located at the base of Kaizoo Avenue, Kofeng Road and Shui Xi intersection in Huangpu District, Guangzhou City, Guangdong Province, China. It was opened on December 28, 2016 with the opening of the second phase of Line 6, and on December 20, 2019 with the opening of the remaining section of Line 21. The station has three floors. The ground floor is Kaizoo Avenue, Kofeng Road, Shui Xi Road, Luogang Wanda Plaza, and other small areas or buildings. The basement floor is the station hall, the basement two floors are Platform 6, and the basement three floors are Platform 21. The station hall of Suyuan Station is arranged in the "Na" type layout, the north-south part is Line 21, the east-west part is Line 6, and the station hall of Line 21 is divided into two parts north-south by the station hall of Line 6. Currently, the station hall has ticket vending machines, vending machines/charging machines, a customer service center and other facilities.

Chávez entered the Venezuelan Military Academy at the age of 17. In 1975, he received a degree in military science and engineering as a second lieutenant, then served for several months as a candidate lieutenant, and was then admitted to study political science at the Simon Bolivar University in Caracas, but did not obtain a degree. While at the university, Chávez and several partners conceived a left-wing nationalist theory, they called it "Bolivarianismo", inspired by the 19th-century Venezuelan revolutionary Simon Bolivar, who also influenced the Peruvian dictator Juan Velasco Alvarado and many socialist and communist leaders. During these years, Chávez also became passionate about sports news and cultural activities.

This was the first taxi service in Guangzhou. By 1933, the city had 631 taxis, all from the United Kingdom, the United States, Japan and other countries. Its orbit has an eccentricity of 0.0022 and an inclination of 0.02° relative to the equator of Saturn. It is in the same orbit as Saturn. Saturn XII is located on the L4 Lagrangian point of Saturn, 60° in front of Saturn IV. Saturn IV has an average diameter of 1118 kilometers. Saturn IV is mainly composed of ice, but it is the third densest of Saturn's moons (1.5 g/cm3, Saturn II and Saturn VI are in the first and second positions), so its interior must contain a considerable amount of silicate rock. Saturn IV has an irradiance of 0.55 and is darker than Saturn III and Saturn II. Saturn IV has a surface temperature of -187 °C. Its rotation period is the same as its orbital period, and is 65 hours 41 minutes, so it rotates synchronously with Earth's satellites.

Following the events of 1991, President Yeltsin confiscated the archives and property of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union and handed them over to the Russian government. The building where the Communist Party of the Soviet Union had its headquarters was also sealed off an hour after the General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union resigned in Gobachev. On 6 November 1991, Yeltsin declared the Communist Party of the Soviet Union to be an illegal organization and ordered that its activities in Russia be banned. The Communist Party of the Soviet Union ceased to exist. On 26 December 1991, the Soviet Union formally dissolved and ceased to exist. Following the dissolution of the Soviet Union, the legacy of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation and the Communist Party of the Commonwealth of Independent States was inherited. The supreme organ of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union was the General Assembly of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, abbreviated as the All-Union Party Congress. Depending on the historical period, the All-Union Party Congress was convened once every 1 to 5 years, but it was not convened between 1939 and 1952.

The earliest constitutional monarchy in the world was the United Kingdom. As early as 1215, King John was compelled to sign the Great Charter, which provided for the rights of the nobility and the church to be protected from the king, restrictions on the king's power to levy taxes, and guarantees of public liberty and property rights. This was both the earliest origin of a constitutional monarchy and the beginning of the British Constitution. However, the British monarch still had considerable absolute power, and led to the outbreak of the English Civil War in the 1640s. After the "glorious revolution" against James II in 1688, the British Parliament passed the Bill of Rights in 1689, which contained the following provisions: without parliamentary consent, the king could not enact or terminate laws, levy and control taxes, recruit and maintain a standing army in peacetime; subjects had the right to petition the king; parliaments should be convened regularly, members of parliament should be freely elected by the people, members of parliament should have the right to speak freely in parliament, the king should not interfere; there should be no separate religious court or special court, cruel punishments should not be abused, and property of specific persons should not be confiscated before judgment.

Costco Wholesale Corporation is the world's third-largest and largest chain retailer and member-stocked wholesaler in the United States, and was named by Fortune magazine in 2017, having its origins in 1976 as Price Club. Costco has more than 800 subsidiaries in 12 countries around the world, most of which are located within the United States and Canada is the largest foreign market. The global headquarters are in Ithaca, Washington, with flagship stores in nearby Seattle. Costco is closed on New Year's Day, Easter, Soldiers' Day, U.S. Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, and Christmas.

In the 7th century AD, the Arabs invaded Western Sahara. In the mid-15th century, the Portuguese invaded the area. In the 19th century, the Spaniards also invaded Western Sahara, designating it as a Spanish protectorate in 1886. In 1958, Western Sahara was transformed into a sub-province of Western West Africa. However, Spain's colonial rule in the region was opposed by three countries, namely Algeria, Morocco and Mauritania. In May 1973, with the support of Algeria, the Frente POLISARIO for the Liberation of Saguia-Amla and Rio de Janeiro (Frente POLISARIO or Frente POLISARIO for the Liberation of Western Sahara) was proclaimed. At the same time, it was decided to fight for the independence of Western Sahara through armed struggle. In November 1975, Morocco organized the Green March and 350,000 volunteers marched into Western Sahara. On 14 November, the three countries, Spain, Morocco and Mauritania, signed the Madrid Agreement, stipulating that Spain must withdraw from Western Sahara by 26 February 1976 at the latest.

In the official documents of the late Qing Dynasty, the concepts of Inner Mongolia and Outer Mongolia appeared. Inner Mongolia refers to the 49 flags of the Nezha Saq, and Outer Mongolia refers to the four provinces of Karka (sometimes including Kobdo and the Danube). From the 16th century, Russia operated in Siberia and began to trade with the Mongolian region. In 1727, China and Russia signed the Treaty of Brunswick and the Treaty of Chukotka (commonly known as the Treaty of Brunswick), confirming that Mongolia was under the control of the Qing Dynasty. Russia obtained trade and commerce privileges in Chukotka and the Outer Mongolian region. In 1854, Governor-General of Eastern and Western Siberia Muravyov said that "China should not allow the new Chinese government to extend its power to Mongolia once a coup has taken place, in which case Mongolia should be protected by Russia." The Russo-Japanese War of 1905, the Treaty of Amity of 1907, Russia's recognition of Japan's "superiority" in Korea, and Japan's recognition of Russia's "all rights" in Outer Mongolia.

The Thirteenth Army had the same attitude as the Second Division at the time of the divisional split in Ninghan, and belonged to the faction that supported the Wuhan National Government. Therefore, after the formation of the army, it did not enter the Second Northern Expedition, but was stationed in Hunan for a long time. Before the Second Northern Expedition, the army underwent a complete reorganization period. The number of the Fifth Division remained unchanged, the 38th Division was renamed the 45th Division of the National Revolutionary Army, the 39th Division was renamed the 49th Division of the National Revolutionary Army, and a part of the Eighth Army of the National Revolutionary Army was assigned to form the Teaching Division. The West Indies Federation was not the first British colony to be integrated into the Caribbean Sea. The West Indies became a single British colony in 1627, but in 1816 it was divided into Antigua-Barbados-Montserrat and St. Christopher-Nevis-Anguilla. In 1871, the British Parliament passed the West Indies Act 1871, which united the West Indies into a colony federation. The British gained some territory in the Seven Years' War Treaty of Paris in 1763, and similar measures were implemented in the West Indies since 1673, forming the British West Indies. The Governor-General was concurrently appointed Governor of Barbados, and administered the islands of Grenada, Grenadines, St. Vincent and the Grenadines, and Tobago. Each island had a Deputy Governor, and each island retained its own parliament. In 1838, Trinidad and St. Lucia joined.

On 3 February 2017, Dos Santos reaffirmed that he would not participate in this year's presidential election, but would remain President of the Angolan People's Liberation Movement, with important powers such as nominating candidates for the party's parliament and appointing military and police officials. From 10 September 1979 to 26 September 2017, Dos Santos held office for 38 years and 16 days, being the second-longest-serving African leader after President of Equatorial Guinea, Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo.

Beta Antliae and γ Antliae (now HR 4339 and HD 90156) were assigned to one side of the constellation Hydra when the boundary was drawn in 1930. The two brightest stars in the constellation, α Antliae and ε Antliae, are both slightly red. δ Antliae is a binary star, located near α Antliae, 430 ± 30 light years from Earth. T Antliae is a yellow-white supergiant, spectral type F6Iab, and a classical paternal variable with a magnitude range of 8.88 to 9.82 and a period of change of 5.9 days. HD 93083 is an orange dwarf star, spectral type K3V, smaller than the Sun and cooler than the Sun.

In 1959, he became the leader of the Congolese National Movement Party. At the end of the same year, he was elected a member of the Standing Committee of the Pan-African People's Congress. In November 1959, he was arrested by the colonial authorities during the suppression of the Stanleyville mass movement on suspicion of rioting, but was released shortly afterwards under pressure from public opinion. In January 1960, he attended the Brussels Round Table on Congolese Independence, at which he resolutely opposed the secession of the Congo and insisted on the principles of independence, unity and democracy. In May, the first parliamentary elections were held in the Congo, and the Congolese National Movement Party Electoral Union won 41 seats in the lower house of parliament, becoming the largest party. On 23 June, he was elected Prime Minister and organized the first government. On 30 June, the Democratic Republic of the Congo was established.

In the 19th and early 20th centuries, the employment of nurses in the southern United States was widespread among all classes of society. In the Victorian period in Britain, some women took care of their babies for money, either by feeding them themselves or by feeding them with cheap food, known as baby farming (baby-farming), which often resulted in infant death. In ancient Chinese courts and nobles often sought nurses to nurse their babies, and the "Rules of Procedure" stipulated that the sons of heaven, princes, and doctors were entitled to nurse them, and that the sons of men were to be fed by their mothers. The courts selected nurses strictly according to age, appearance, health, milk thickness, and color, and once selected, their dress, diet, etc., had to be arranged by the palace.
