When a large star collapses into a neutron star after an outburst of a supernova, its magnetic field increases rapidly. In the calculations of the scientists Duncan and Thompson, with a strength of about 100 million tesla (108 Tesla), in some cases up to 100 billion tesla (1011 T, 1015 Gauss), these neutron stars are called "magnets". The natural magnetic field strength of the Earth's surface is about 3.5×10-5 T near the equator, about 7×10-5 T near the poles. A supernova may lose about 10% of its mass during the outburst, a star 10 to 30 times the mass of the Sun, they need to release more mass, perhaps 80% of their own, in order to avoid collapsing into a black hole.

On the question of the unconstitutionality of the farmers' land policy, the Supreme Court of Justice has made interpretations of Explanation No. 78, 124, 125, 128, 347, 422, 561, 579, 580, 581, etc. The Supreme Court and in Explanation No. 580 of the Supreme Court of Justice have declared that Article 19(3) of the Agricultural Land Reduction Ordinance, amended on December 23, 1983, stipulates that "when the land lease term expires, the lessor shall, in order to expand the scale of operation of family farms and improve the efficiency of land use, recover the farmland, in accordance with the provisions of Article 17(2)(3) of the same Ordinance, compensate the tenant with one-third of the land value added tax after deducting the residual value of the land at the time of the land announcement" unconstitutional, and shall expire on July 9, 2006.

Zhujiang New Town (Chinese: 珠江新城; pinyin: Zhujiang Xincheng; also known as Zhujiang New Town Central Commercial District) is located in the western Tianhe District of Guangzhou, China. It is the eastern terminus of the South China Expressway, the western terminus of Guangzhou Avenue, the southern terminus of the Pearl River, and the northern terminus of the Huangpu Avenue. It covers an area of 6.44 square kilometers and is crossed by the Central Axis of Guangzhou New City. It aims to develop into a financial, trade, commercial, entertainment, foreign affairs and administrative district at the international level. It is bounded by Sincun Road and divided into two districts: the eastern district is mainly residential, the western district is mainly commercial offices. The Zhujiang New Town was launched by the Guangzhou government in 1993. It has now developed into an important commercial activity center in southern China. It is home to the Zhou Daifuku Financial Center and the Guangzhou International Financial Center. In the early 1990s, in the context of the reform and opening-up, Guangzhou's economy developed rapidly and the city's spatial structure has undergone tremendous changes. A new commercial and commercial center has gradually formed in the Tianhe District, which is centered on the Tianhe Sports Centre.

He was elected to the Legislative Assembly of Southern Rhodesia in 1948, re-elected to the Legislative Assembly of the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland in 1953, participated in the establishment of the Rhodesian Front in 1962, and was successfully re-elected to the Legislative Assembly of Southern Rhodesia as Minister of Finance and other positions. Smith replaced Winston Field as Prime Minister of Southern Rhodesia on 16 April 1964 and was the first native to be Prime Minister of South Rhodesia. Smith's Rhodesian Front won every general election from 1965 until the end of white rule in 1979, as the vast majority of blacks did not have the right to vote.

Liu Zhi (Chinese: 劉峙; June 30, 1892 – January 5, 1971) was a villager in Miaoji, Jiangxi, Jiangxi Province. He was a second-class general in the army of the National Revolutionary Army of the Republic of China. He was an instructor at the Huangpu Military Academy. He participated in the Northern Expedition, the Great Central Plains War and other battles, and was greatly admired by Chiang Kai-shek. He was the commander of the 2nd Army Group in the 1st War Area and the commander of the 5th War Area during the Chinese Civil War. In 1948, he was appointed by Chiang Kai-shek as the commander of the General Headquarters for the Suppression of Banditry in Xuzhou, but the Nanjing Defense Ministry had secrets leaked by the Liberation Army, and Chiang Kai-shek plotted to crush the whole island, so that Liu was defeated in the battle. After his resignation, Liu Zhi was appointed as a strategic adviser to the President of the Republic of China. In late 1949, he went to Indonesia via Hong Kong. In 1953, he was granted permission by Chiang Kai-shek to visit Taiwan, serving as a state policy adviser to the President of the Republic of China until his death in 1971. Liu Zhi was born into a peasant family, his father was killed by a landowner for flooding.

In January 1950, the CPC Central Committee decided to separate the Shanghai Communist Party from the leadership of the East China Bureau of the CPC Central Committee. Chen Yi, then the second secretary of the East China Bureau of the CPC Central Committee and the mayor of Shanghai, was appointed as the first secretary of the Shanghai Communist Party. In September 1982, the 12th Congress of the Communist Party of China was convened, and the Constitution of the Communist Party of China, adopted by the General Assembly, for the first time completely laid down the principles of the leadership of the Communist Party of China, further emphasized the democratic centralism and prohibited all forms of individual worship. Under the Constitution of the Communist Party of China, the CPC Central Committee no longer had a chairman, but only a general secretary. The General Assembly decided to establish the Central Advisory Committee. The standing committees of local Communist Party committees at all levels were originally composed of the first secretary, the second secretary, the permanent secretary, the secretary, etc., and deputy secretaries, standing committees, and were replaced by secretaries, deputy secretaries, and standing committees.

Each level of the pagoda has niches. The basement is octagonal, each side 5.6 meters long and the basement 1.15 meters high. It is built of red sandstone, the basement is paved with grey marble, and the eight sides of the basement are respectively carved with Bagua. The eight corners of the basement are carved with stone pilasters, the pilasters are kneeling, the head tower, or the two-handed tower, or the one-handed tower, in a vivid form, each pilaster is 0.5 meters high and 0.5 meters wide. At the corners of the tower are red leaning pillars, the pillars are black and red eaves, the walls are convoluted into white with gray. On the eaves are six columns of diamond-shaped tooth bricks, the first column is 0.85 meters high, and each column is interspersed with red and white. On the eaves of each level are four columns of diamond-shaped tooth bricks. The second level is 0.69 meters wide. Each level has wooden railings. The top of the tower has eight pointed towers, the top of the tower has iron-cast goose-shaped corner beams protruding, the tower bells are suspended, and the top of the tower has a raised tower.

Kaohsiung Medical University (KMU), or simply Kaohsiung Medical University, is a private medical university located in Kaohsiung, Taiwan. Formerly known as Kaohsiung Medical University, established in 1954, it was founded by Taiwan's first medical doctor, Professor Du Xiaoqiang. It is the first medical university and private college founded by Taiwanese, with four departments including medicine, dentistry, pharmacy and nursing. In 1999, it was renamed Kaohsiung Medical University, and became Taiwan's first higher education school named "Medical University". The medical system includes the Kaohsiung Medical University Affiliated Hospital (Medical Center), Kaohsiung Small Port Hospital (Regional Teaching Hospital), Kaohsiung Datong Hospital (Regional Hospital), Kaohsiung Qiaozu Hospital and the first outpatient clinic outside the Department of Dentistry (Gen Ling Ya Clinic).

The Soviet Union also sent personnel to assist the National Government in organizing the Northern Expeditionary Force. In 1927, Chiang Kai-shek joined the Shanghai Qing Party, and relations between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China broke down. Soviet envoys and personnel were expelled. Outer Mongolia was originally Chinese territory, and in 1911, under Russian planning, Outer Mongolia declared its independence as Mongolia. After the establishment of the Soviet Union, it continued to support the independence of Outer Mongolia. In July 1918, Zhai Shulin, a Soviet foreign commissioner, declared at the Soviet Congress that he would renounce all the materials that Russia had seized in Manchuria, restore China's sovereignty in Manchuria:32. On July 4, the Soviet government declared that it would renounce the burden placed on the Chinese people by the tsar's government under various pretexts, withdraw the armed forces of the tsar's government stationed in its consulate, and return China's various reparations to China from Russia. In July 1919, the Soviet deputy foreign commissioner Karakhan issued the first declaration to China, willing to abolish all secret treaties, unconditionally hand over the Middle East Railway, renounce the compensation of the Kuomintang and abolish all privileges.

The first phase of Line 14 was awarded the National Quality Engineering Gold Award for 2020-2020. In 1987, when the "Cross Line Network" was proposed, the northern section of Line 2 began at Sanyuanli, along Airport Road north, with Jiangxia as the terminus, and four stations were installed along the way. Until 1997, Line 2 continued to be extended along 106 National Road to the new airport. After entering the 2000s, due to the relocation of Baiyun Airport to the intersection of Baiyun and Huadu, in order to develop Baiyun New City at the airport site, the northern extension section of Line 2 was reduced to Jia Wo, the line location was changed from Airport Road to go through the old airport central axis, the entire airport road and 106 National Road southern section became without subway. At the same time, in the 2003 planning plan, the then New China Line (formerly known as "Line 9" and "Line 14") started from Huadu Motor City, first through People and Taihe, then through Guangdong Highway to the junction of Huadu Street, a total length of 60 km.

In later planning, this line was cancelled; at the same time, the originally planned New Passenger Station (now Guangzhou South Station) to Wazhou Line 21 was changed to Line 20. Subsequently, the subway line was cancelled, and the line was used as the southeastern half of the Guangfu Ring Line. On December 26, 2015, the construction of the section from Xintang via Baiyun Airport to Guangzhou North Project (i.e. the New Bai Guangcheng Interchange) was officially started, and the section from Guangfu Dongyuan Huadu to Bamboo Material was constructed by the project. The first pier of the Guangzhou South to Baiyun Airport section was completed on October 20, 2017 in Zhong Loktan Town. On November 30, 2020, the section from Huadu Station to Baiyun Airport North Station was opened for operation under the name of Guangzhou Dongyuan Interchange. The section is 22.6 km long, with a total of four stations, and initially opened to intersect with the Guangzhou Qingcheng Interchange. On July 25, 2021, the bamboo material storage yard began laying tracks.

Chan Li Chai (Chinese: 陈李济) is a Chinese pharmaceutical enterprise, founded in 1599 in the Ming Dynasty, Guinness World Records as "oldest operating pharmaceutical factory". Currently, Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan and overseas trademarks are owned by Chan Li Chai Pharmaceutical Factory Co., Ltd., while Chinese trademarks are owned by Guangzhou Baiyunshan Chan Li Chai Pharmaceutical Factory Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Guangdong Pharmaceutical Group. Currently, there are more than 500 descendants of Chen Li, most of whom moved to Hong Kong, Macau and Guangzhou by the Qing Dynasty of the Jiujiang River; and more than 200 descendants of Li still live in Xiqiao Taiping, Jiao Li Village, Nanhai District, Foshan City, the rest are scattered throughout the country.

In 1641, the Italian mathematician Tori demolished a long tube filled with mercury, then quickly inverted the opening into a basin filled with mercury, the end of which was 76 cm high. At the top of the glass tube, the mercury-free zone was in a vacuum. This experiment was called the Toricelli experiment, and the glass tube that completed the experiment was called the Toricelli tube. In 1654, the mayor of Baden, Otto von Greck, showed the emperor in Regensburg the hemisphere experiment he had designed. He made two red copper hemispheres 36 cm in diameter, with a layer of oil-filled leather in the middle of the hemisphere, so that the two hemispheres could be completely fused.

Local people's congresses at various levels may, under certain conditions, propose a motion for the removal of the chief executive of the people's government at the corresponding level. Because the administrative system of mainland China is a Party-state system, the Party exercises leadership in all matters. The chief executive is usually a standing member of the local committees of the Communist Party of China at the corresponding level, and most of the functions within the Party are held only by the secretaries of the district commissions: 61-62. Therefore, the position of the chief executive in the administrative districts of the Communist Party of China is subordinate to the secretaries of the district commissions. The chief executive officers of rare county-level districts are also called chief executives, and their positions are at the same level as those of township chiefs of other townships, and at the same level as those of township chiefs of townships under the jurisdiction of the districts. The administrative districts of China are divided into districts under the direct jurisdiction of cities and provinces, and each district has a chief executive, who is usually appointed by the mayor, unlike the mayors of villages, towns, and counties elected by the people.

Although the depreciation of the French currency was eased after the victory in the Second World War, inflation worsened again after the outbreak of the Second Sino-Japanese War, until it calmed down after the establishment of the People's Republic of China in 1949.In 1933, the National Government promulgated the Silver Coinage Ordinance, which abolished the two-digit currency and gradually withdrew the two-digit currency from the historical stage.By 1934, President Roosevelt signed the Silver Purchase Act of 1934, which stipulated that the U.S. Treasury purchased silver domestically and abroad to fill the treasury, and that the value of silver held by the United States was one-third of the gold value.

Local decentralization, decentralized autonomy, or decentralization of power is the abbreviation for "decentralization of power."The symmetry of "centralization": 1380. Strive to limit the upper powers and maximize the strength of the lower powers to prevent the emergence of dictatorships.The term is often used in politics to refer to a system in which state power is exercised by the central government and local government respectively in accordance with law, and which deliberately makes certain aspects of local power greater than the central power, so long as it does not constitute an act of secession, subversion of power, etc. that jeopardizes the foundation of the state, and the remaining powers that can be decentralized are decentralized as much as possible.Advocating the use of coercive forms by the state to return part of the power to the local government, which will significantly reduce the economic costs, human costs, maintenance costs, etc. of the central government in the exercise of power, both to ensure the growth of the overall national economy, the international status, and to focus the attention of the central government on the areas most in need of support, such as defense, military, trade, diplomacy, alliances, etc.

On January 1, 2020, the Chinese Centers for Disease Prevention and Control (CDC) published the results of a test on January 7, after sampling at the Wuhan South Seafood Market, indicating that the pathogen of "unexplained viral pneumonia" had been tentatively identified as a new type of coronavirus. On January 21, the Shanghai Basde Institute of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the Synthetic Biology Key Laboratory of the Institute of Plant Physiology and Ecology of the Chinese Academy of Sciences reported in the journal China Sciences: Life Sciences that the virus belongs to the genus Betacoronavirus. Betacoronavirus is a protein-encapsulated single-stranded RNA virus, capable of parasitizing and infecting humans and other higher animals. In the position of the evolutionary tree, it is adjacent to SARS viruses and SARS viruses, but does not belong to SARS and SARS viruses.

In June 1946, the Military Committee was reorganized into the Ministry of Defense; the Political Department of the Military Committee was reorganized into the Ministry of Defense News Bureau; the inspection work of the Political Department of the former Military Committee was reorganized into the Ministry of Defense Inspection Bureau; and the leisure work of the Political Department of the former Military Committee was reorganized into the Ministry of Defense Logistics Command Special Inspection Office. In February 1948, the Ministry of Defense News Bureau again consolidated the inspection and leisure departments, and was reorganized into the Ministry of Defense Politics and Engineering Bureau.

Dogs (scientific name: Canis lupus familiaris), nowadays commonly known as dogs, a common canine mammal, is the same animal as wolves, is a subspecies of wolves in biological classification. Dogs are one of the earliest domesticated species of humans. Domestic dogs are called domestic dogs, unmanned dogs are often referred to as "wild dogs" or "stray dogs", may affect the environment and other organisms, is one of the world's 100 largest alien invasive species. The lifespan of dogs can exceed 20 years, the average is several decades, and is similar to the average lifespan of cats. If no accident occurs, the average lifespan is longer than that of small dogs. DNA analysis shows that dogs are not only close relatives of the grey wolf (Canis lupus), but also the hybrid offspring of different grey wolf subspecies. The ancestors of modern dogs began to be domesticated in Western Europe about 110,000 to 16,000 years ago, and earlier ancient dogs that were domesticated by humans have been extinct, such as specimens found in Belgium about 36,000 years ago and in the Altai Mountains about 33,000 years ago, indicating interrupted domestication events, these earlier ancient dogs did not leave any surviving descendants.

In October 1942, the 10th Cavalry Division (Tan Yulian) was transferred to the army. In June 1943, Zhou Shihong assumed command and was transferred to the 4th and 58th Infantry Divisions. In June 1945, a new II Corps was established in Xinjiang. In March 1947, the division was reorganized into the 23rd Infantry Division. In September 1948, the number of the 91st Army was restored. In April 1949, the division was stationed in Qin'an. After the Lanzhou Campaign, one of the divisions was annihilated, some of the divisions relied on the Communist Party of China, and the remaining divisions were evacuated to Yunnan. On September 22, 1949, Commander Huang Zuhong led a small number of his subordinates to flee to Yunnan; the remaining units, under the command of Chief of Staff Zheng Zhuangwei, participated in the Hexi Uprising on September 23. In October 1949, the military department and the remaining divisions of the 191st and 246th Infantry Divisions were reorganized into the 3rd Independent Corps of the People's Liberation Army, and the 231st Division was reorganized into the 6th Independent Division of the People's Liberation Army.

Article 43 The President of the People's Republic of China convenes the Supreme Council of State when necessary and serves as Chairman of the Supreme Council of State. The Supreme Council of State is attended by the Vice-President of the People's Republic of China, the Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, the Prime Minister of the State Council and other relevant personnel. The views of the Supreme Council of State on important matters for the State are discussed and decided upon by the President of the People's Republic of China before the National People's Congress, the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, the State Council or other relevant departments.

In February 1951, after Cai Weihan and other shareholders initiated the raising of funds, the operation was resumed. In the late 1950s, during a difficult period of scarce resources, the People's Council of China held a banquet at the Guangzhou Grand Liquor House. Later, the leader of the liquor house, then still a chef Chen Ming, manipulated the knife to make a banquet of potatoes. All the styles, flavors and styles of potato dishes were different. After the reform and opening-up, in 1983, the Guangzhou Liquor House introduced a complete innovation in the way of business in Hong Kong, loaned 4 million yuan for renovation and decoration of doors, took the lead in the open tendering of the catering system, strengthened internal management, formulated food quality standards, and put forward the requirement of "customer first, quality first".

Sagittarius (Latin: ) is a constellation in the Southern Hemisphere with an area of 867.43 square degrees, making up 2.103% of the total area of the sky. It is the 15th largest of the 88 constellations in the sky. There are 65 stars in Sagittarius with a magnitude of 5.5, the brightest being Minotaur III (ε Sagittarius), with a visual magnitude of 1.85.

The CAS Registry Number (or CAS Number, CAS Rn, CAS #) is the unique numerical identifier of a substance (compound, polymer, biological sequence, mixture, or alloy). The Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) of the American Chemical Society assigns a CAS number to each substance that appears in the literature. The purpose of this assignment is to avoid the problem of chemicals having multiple names and to make it easier to retrieve data from the database. Nowadays, almost all chemical databases allow retrieval with a CAS number.

Europa (Greek: Ευρώπη) is the third most populous continent in the world, after Asia and Africa, with an average population density of 70 people per square kilometre, and 50 independent sovereign states. Europe borders Asia to the east with the Ural Mountains, the Ural River, the South-Eastern Mediterranean Sea, the Caucasus Mountains and the Black Sea, to the west and north-west with the Atlantic Ocean, the Greenland Sea, the Danish Strait and North America, to the north with the Arctic Ocean, and to the south with the Mediterranean Sea and Africa. The northernmost point of Europe is the northernmost point of Norway, the southernmost point is the Spanish Cape of Morocco. Europe is the second smallest continent in the world, only larger than Oceania, it is called the Eurasian continent with Asia, and with Asia and Africa it is called the Eurasian non-continent. Europe is strictly speaking not geologically an island, but an island separated only for geopolitical and cultural reasons. Europe is not a land completely or almost completely separated from other land by sea or other natural boundaries.

The Open Directory Project (also known as the Directory of Mozilla or DMOZ) is a large public web directory hosted by Netscape. It is the world's largest directory community, maintained and built by volunteers from around the world, and categorized according to the nature and content of the web page. Google uses this categorization framework to set up Google's web directories. On February 28, 2017, DMOZ announced that the site would close on March 14, 2017, and all data would be transferred to Curlie's website. idmoz was also established on the basis of the DMOZ database. The predecessor of ODP was "Gnuhoo", which was founded on June 5, 1998 by computer programmers Rich Skrenta and Bob Truel of Sun Microsystems of California.

.su is the country and regional top-level domain assigned to the former Soviet Union and Russia, and was launched on 19 September 1990. Although the Soviet Union has now dissolved, the domain is still in use; its users are mainly located in Russia..su domains are registered by the Russian Institute for Public Networks. After 1989, a number of new Internet domains were created in Europe, such as.pl (Poland),.cs (Czechoslovakia),.yu (Yugoslavia),.dd (East Germany), etc., including the Soviet domain.su. On 26 December 1991, the Soviet Union officially declared its dissolution.

BRT Gangdong Station is a ground-based intermediate stop of the Guangzhou Rapid Transit System (BRT), located in Tianhe District, Guangzhou, Guangdong Province, China, between Tianhe Road, Longkou West Road (Cantonese: Longkou Road (Guangdong)) and Longkou East Road (Cantonese: Longkou Road (Guangdong)). The construction of Gangdong Station was originally scheduled to begin in June 2009, but construction was delayed due to land requisition problems until October of that year, making it the slowest station in the Guangzhou BRT. On July 3, 2010, Gangdong Station became the first station in the Guangzhou BRT to install sprinkler cooling system. Before the opening of the BRT, after the opening of the BRT in 2005, and in 2020, the Gangdong area was one of the most congested areas in Guangzhou due to the dense commercial and traffic flow.

The year, also known as the Earth year or the solar year, is the unit of time between the events associated with the Earth's orbit around the Sun. The extension can be applied to any planet: for example, a "Mars year" is the time that Mars itself completes a circle around the Sun's orbit. Generally, the length of a year is taken to be the time interval between the Sun's return from a certain point along the Ecliptic to the same point on the celestial sphere. Due to the difference in the selected point, the definition of the year is as follows: Since 1984, astronomers have used the Julian year (not to be confused with the Julian calendar in the Gregorian calendar) as the unit of time for a unified year, defined as exactly 365.25 days, with an error of one day per 3,000 years compared to the regression year. In the modern Western calendar, the standard year is 365 days, the leap year is 366 days, and 1582 is 355 days.

Following the assassination of Kirov in 1934, Stalin launched a major purge of the old Bolsheviks. Zinoviev was arrested and tortured as one of the leaders of the "Trotsky- Zinoviev Anti-Party League" and was shot immediately after the first Moscow trial. In 1988, he was pardoned by the Soviet Union and restored to his honor. Born into a wealthy Jewish farming family in the Russian Empire's Yelizavetsky District (now Ukraine's Klopevnytskyi), he received a family education. At the age of 15, he began to rely on his own labor to survive, first as a teacher and then as a director of two large commercial enterprises. In 1902, he entered the University of Bern, Switzerland, initially in chemistry, then in philosophy, dropping out.

Fortresses refer to perilous passes, also known as fortresses, often located at the edges of borders or strategic areas (archived on the Internet Archive), which gradually replaced European castles. From about the 15th to the 17th centuries, fortresses were mainly a mixture of castles, palaces and fortress structures, which then began to differentiate, and the original fortresses were often specially fortified cities. In the Middle Ages, the most important defence of a castle or city wall was its height. But by the beginning of the 15th century, the idea had wavered, because at that time guns were introduced into Europe, and high walls or castles could easily collapse under fire from guns. Europe began to make its own guns in the first half of the 14th century. The initial guns were relatively small and unreliable. The guns of the 15th century were still very heavy and explosive, but their firepower was sufficient to enable any castle or city at that time to surrender after a short period of fire.

His grandfather, Chen Tianqian, was born in Taiwan Village and his grandmother, Hong Hojun, was born in Taiwan. His father, Chen Qingkun, was born in Taiwan Spring and his mother, Zhou Chaojun, was born in Taiwan. When Chen Shushan was a boy, he returned to Fujian with his parents and attended Rentang Village Primary School in Ximei Town, Nan'an County. Later, he went to Xiamen Tongwen High School with his grandfather. He was a member of the Chinese Anti-Japanese War Army and served in the first phase of the Fujian Security Executive Training School. He graduated in 1938 and joined the Chinese Anti-Japanese War Army. Chen Shushan led the Chinese Anti-Japanese War in the Battle of Kwanan-Jishima Island. During the Battle of Fuqing, he was attacked by the enemy, he was injured and lost consciousness. Fortunately, both of his units survived the disaster. After his arrival in Taiwan, he was appointed as the Commander of the Third Training Center for Newcomers to the Army, the Commander of the Fourth Division, the 51st Division, the Commander of the Eastern Police Department of the Security Headquarters, the Commander of the Second Army, the Head of the Political Warfare School, the Executive Officer of the General Political Warfare Department, the Commander of the Army Training Department, the Commander of the Eighth Army and the Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Army.

The body of the dolphin is heavy, barrel-shaped, its mouth and nose are dull, and its ears are protruding. The upper part of the skin is reddish brown and the lower part is yellowish brown. The biggest difference between the dolphin and other rodents is that the sweat glands can be found in hairy areas of the body. The dentition of the dolphin is 1.0.1.31.0.1.3. The legs of the dolphin have bracts, which aid in swimming, and the tail has degenerated, leaving only a few spots. The hind legs of the dolphin are slightly longer than the fore legs, with three and four toes, respectively. The dolphin is a semi-aquatic animal. Some of the dolphins that escape from cages have also been found in waters near other parts of the world. Although there are no exact numbers statistics, the non-South American region with the largest number of dolphins may be Florida. The dolphin is a herbivore, feeding mainly on grasses and aquatic plants. Like its close relatives, the dolphin itself cannot synthesize vitamin C, so it is easy to induce alveolar necrosis.

He often claimed to be descended from an illustrious eunuch family, but it is generally believed that the family was originally of the lower class, until his father, Diệm, passed the baccalaureate examination and was able to enter society. Diệm abandoned his plan to become a Catholic priest, stepped into the service, served on the staff of the emperor during the French colonial period, and was later promoted to minister of ceremonies and palace administration. Diệm's first wife died childless, and his second wife bore him six sons and three daughters. Diệm himself was a devout Catholic, leading the whole family to Mass every morning. Diệm was his third son, baptized in the cathedral of Shunhua, denomination Jean-Baptiste. In 1907, the French deposed the anti-colonial emperor, the emperor of Chengdu, on the grounds of mental illness.

In some combat-oriented video games, the game's background settings generally divide the player and non-player characters into two or more opposing camps, some set the player characters on the same camp against the non-player characters on the opposing camp, some set the player characters and non-player characters apart from the opposing camp as enemies, with the goal of destroying the enemy. Enemies in video games include usually lower-level monsters encountered on the general map, up to the boss. In general role-playing games, the player can generally encounter enemies on the game map, after defeating the enemy, the player can gain experience values up to the random amount of money and items dropped on the monster. Generally, game designers set the experience values and amount of money as well as the quality of the items depending on the level of the enemy.

The Republic of Vietnam (Vietnamese: Việt Nam Cộng Hòa/Vietnamese: république du Viêt Nam, French: République du Viêt Nam), commonly known as South Vietnam, is a presidential republic established in 1955 by the Vietnamese state government through the Vietnamese referendum. Its capital is Saigon (now Ho Chi Minh City), and its first president is Diệm. During the Vietnam War, South Vietnam and North Vietnam (Democratic Republic of Vietnam) were opposed, and were annihilated in 1975 by North Vietnam and the National Liberation Front of South Vietnam. Vietnam became a French colony in 1887, and was under Japanese control during World War II. In 1945, Ho Chi Minh's Vietnam Independence Alliance launched the August Revolution, proclaimed Vietnam's independence, established a socialist Democratic Republic of Vietnam, and fought the First Indochina War with France.

On September 1, 1924, he became the 10th Governor of Taiwan, shouting "Taiwan is governed not by 150,000 (Japanese) inhabitants, but by 3 billion inhabitants of the mainland", giving Taiwan's elite and intellectuals high hopes. Domestic events: 1924 Taiwan Fruit and Vegetable Stock Association was founded, promoted the export of bananas; October 1925, the Lin Bengen Sugar Association clashed with the sugar farmers (the two-line sugar farmers' union founded by Dr. Li Yuzhang) because of the harsh price of sugar cane purchases, triggered the two-line incident; June 28, 1926, Kanji and Zhao Hong established the whole island farmers' union in Fengshan; the entire eastern railway line was opened; named "Phoenix"; at the time, the Japanese in Taiwan disapproved of his policy of being close to Taiwanese, and he did not criticize "Governor Izawa is a Taiwanese"; on the contrary, Izawa often abused the Japanese's superiority, and made efforts to promote the good side of Taiwanese, so his reputation among Taiwanese intellectuals was almost the crown of all previous governors, and the intellectual class engaged in the speech machine still admired him after his departure, Lin Cheng Lu, etc. Every time he went to Tokyo must visit Izawa to pay tribute, and he also criticized the policies of all previous governors who still had power and confidence in the Taiwanese people.

Fangcun is located in southwestern Guangzhou, Jiangxi Province, China. It is convenient for land and sea transportation and is a must-visit for export to southwestern Guangzhou. Since the founding of the People's Republic of China, Guangzhou City has built and demolished Fangcun District on several occasions. The most recent one was in May 2005, when it was merged into Lai Wan District. The area was originally a desolate small island. In the early days of the Northern Song Dynasty, people from the South China Sea, Panyu and other places came to live here, fishing for their livelihoods, and called "Fangcun." Later, the inhabitants planted flowers and trees. By the end of the Ming Dynasty and the early Qing Dynasty, the area had bloomed and fruited, so it was renamed Fangcun ("Fangcun" and "Fangcun" are synonymous in Cantonese). Fangcun has long been famous for flower cultivation. It has a history of planting flowers for more than 1700 years, and is the birthplace of the Lingnan Basin landscape. Therefore, another ancient name of Fangcun is "Flowers (Flowers)", meaning "Flowers have dams", literally meaning "Flowers dams". The ancient flower land covers a large area of Fangcun Street in Fangcun District. In the Ming and Qing Dynasties, "Flowers" actually refers to the entire Fangcun.

Franjo Tuđman (14 May 1922 – 10 December 1999) was a Croatian politician, historian, military officer, and the first President of modern-day Croatia and "Father of the State." Born into a prominent Croatian family, his father was an important member of the Croatian Peasant Party. During World War II, Tuđman joined the guerrillas of Tito. Shortly after the war, Tuđman's father mysteriously committed "suicide," which he himself claimed to have been committed by Ustaša, but after Croatia's independence, changed his name to the Communist Party of Yugoslavia. In 1957, Tuđman entered the Military Academy and became president of the famous Belgrade guerrilla football club. In the 1960s, Tuđman was awarded the rank of general. After 1961, Tuđman left active duty to become a famous military historian.

In contrast to the Legislative Council of Hong Kong, Macau officials are not responsible to the Legislative Council, but only sit in the Legislative Council meetings, resulting in a situation of "questionlessness", so the Legislative Council of Macau is called "rubber stamp" by democrats. In addition, the Legislative Council of Macau has its own office building after the return of Macau; the Portuguese-era Legislative Council meetings were originally held in the Governor's Office. Under Article 71 of the Basic Law, the functions of the Legislative Council are as follows: Under Article 75, Members of the Legislative Council may table bills in accordance with the provisions of this Law and statutory procedures. Bills that do not relate to public expenditure, the political system or the functioning of the government may be tabled by Members of the Legislative Council individually or jointly. Bills that relate to government policy must be submitted with the written consent of the Chief Executive before being tabled. Moreover, the law on financial audit has not yet been enacted, and the relevant powers are merely empty words. Under Article 76, Members of the Legislative Council also have the right to question the work of the government in accordance with statutory procedures, but in the 2004 amendment to the Rules of Procedure, while relaxing oral questioning, limits the number of written questions.

Because territories are hereditary, they are combined with the word "house" to form the compound word "nation," which means a hereditary dynasty established by a family. Before the Qing Dynasty of China, it was thought that all the world's territories were owned by the emperor, so there was no clear outline of the country. The "nation" in Ancient Chinese is not completely consistent with the modern one. The meaning of "nation" in Modern Chinese, mainly derived from various political theories developed in Europe between the 16th and 19th centuries, was introduced into China in the middle and late 19th century by European nations and the United States. The word "nation" in Chinese, used in ancient times as the word "nation," in the armored text as the word  (later developed as the word or), symbolizes the armed guard of the territory. In Chinese, the word " mouth" (i.e. "wall") is added in the Golden Text, symbolizing the wall, forming the present-day country, with the meaning of city, state, capital city. The meaning of "nation" in Ancient Chinese is similar but not the same as that of "nation" in modern concepts, and "nation" and "house" were originally distinguished.

Calendar is a method of calculating time based on units of days. The time within a day is counted as time. It is mainly divided into three types: lunar calendar, lunar calendar and yin-yang calendar. The solar calendar is also called the solar calendar, its calendar year is a regression year, the current internationally accepted Gregorian calendar (Western calendar) is a kind of solar calendar, also called the yin-yang calendar; the lunar calendar is also called the moon calendar, or a kind of lunar calendar; the average calendar year of the yin-yang calendar is a regression year, the calendar month is the new moon, because the difference between the 12 new moon and the regression year is too great, so the leap month is set in the yin-yang calendar, so this method is in accordance with the lunar phase, and also in accordance with the movement of the earth around the solar cycle. The Chinese agriculture calendar is a kind of yin-yang calendar. Other time elements (units) contained in the calendar system: A calendar system designs a calendar date for each day, so the week itself is not a complete calendar system.

The architects of the Soviet Union were not reorganized like writers and artists, but were also placed under the control of the state. On April 23, 1932, the Central Committee of the Soviet Union issued a document "On the Reorganization of Literary and Artistic Societies," which ordered the dissolution of all literary and artistic societies, called upon all "artists who support the program of the Soviet regime and are willing to participate in the socialist construction to unite," and formed a unified creative society in order to achieve "multi-productivity, innovation and correctness." By July 1932, all independent architectural organizations had been abolished, and the "Soviet Union of Architects" was established. The following year (1933), the official "Soviet Architectural Society" was founded, marking the beginning of the Stalinist architectural era.

In 1927, during the Northern Expedition of the National Government, a split occurred between the Qing Communist forces led by Chiang Kai-shek in Nanjing and the Communist forces led by Wang Sewei in Wuhan. On July 1, 1926, the Northern Expedition of the National Revolutionary Army was sworn in. On September 7, the Northern Expeditionary Army captured Hankou City. On November 8, it captured Nanchang. Chiang Kai-shek went to Nanchang to attack Sun Quanfang. On November 11, the Guangzhou National Government decided to relocate Hankou to the north. On January 3, 1927, the Central Political Conference of the National Party of China voted to relocate the Central Party Department of the National Party of China to Nanchang. On February 10, the General Assembly of the Central Executive Committee of the National Party of China convened in Wuhan. After the meeting, Wang Zhaoming, Tan Yanxiang, Sun Ko, Song Ziwen, and Xu Qian were appointed as standing committee members of the National Government. On February 26, Chiang Kai-shek voted at the Central Political Conference of Nanchang to demand the withdrawal of the Soviet Communist International from Borodino.

The China–United States trade war is an ongoing trade dispute between the People's Republic of China (PRC) and the United States of America (U.S.) that began in 2018 and continues to this day. The trade dispute originated when U.S. President Donald Trump signed a memorandum of understanding on March 22, 2018, declaring that "China is stealing U.S. intellectual property and trade secrets" and requiring the U.S. Trade Representative to impose tariffs on goods imported from China, involving a total value of $60 billion under Article 301 of the U.S. Internal Trade Act of 1974. The two sides reached a consensus in May 2018 to suspend the trade war and issued a joint statement seeking a settlement.

Chen Berda (Chinese: 陈伯达; pinyin: Chen Beida; July 29, 1904 – September 20, 1989) was a Chinese Communist Party (CPC) politician and theoretician. Chen Berda was an important member of the CPC Central Committee, long-time editor-in-chief of the magazine Red Flag, director of the CPC Central Committee's political laboratory, deputy director of the Cultural Education Committee of the Administrative Council, deputy director of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, later deputy minister of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, deputy director of the State Planning Commission, head of the Central Committee's Cultural Revolution Group, head of the "56th" Group. He was elected to the Standing Committee of the Politburo of the Communist Party of China at the Eighth Session of the Chinese Central Committee's Eleventh Plenary Session, becoming the "Fourth Person" of the Communist Party of China after Mao Zedong, Lin Biao and Zhou En, and one of the five Standing Committees of the Nineth Politburo of the Communist Party of China.

As of April 2016, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has 190 member states (including Kosovo), and four United Nations member states have not yet joined: Cuba, North Korea, Liechtenstein, and Monaco. Areas with territorial disputes (such as the Palestinian Authority) are not included. The IMF aims to contribute to the stability of the international financial system through the following three main functions. The IMF's highest authority is the Governing Council. Each member region is represented by a president and a vice-president, usually the national finance minister or central bank governor. The Governing Council meets once a year in September, and each member's voting rights are determined by how much they contribute to the Fund. The Governing Council provides advice to the International Monetary and Financial Committee and the Development Committee. The International Monetary and Financial Committee has 24 members, overseeing the development of global liquidity and the transfer of resources to developing countries.

After the outbreak of World War II, Rabin abandoned his original ambitions and joined the Paramah forces of the Haganah in 1941, and was promoted to Chief of Operations in October 1947. During the Israeli War of Independence, he commanded the defense of Jerusalem and fought against the Egyptians in the Negev. Isaac Rabin joined the Paramah forces, an elite assault force belonging to the secret military organization Haganah (Jewish Self-Defense Forces, later known as the Israel Defense Forces). In 1964, Rabin became Chief of Operations of the Israel Defense Forces. He commanded the Israel Defense Forces in the Six-Day War, which overwhelmingly defeated Egypt, Syria and Jordan. After the occupation of the ancient city of Jerusalem, Rabin was the first Israeli national to arrive at the ancient city, and then delivered a speech at the top of Mount Scopus at the Hebrew University.

Czechoslovakia (Czech/Slovak: Èeskoslovensko,Česko-Slovensko, taken democratic republic, surrounded by Germany, Poland, Austria, Hungary and Romania, economically and diplomatically dominated by the Czech Republic and aided by Slovakia, politically and culturally equal. Czechoslovakia was the seventh largest industrial country in the world after World War I and before World War II (the first six named the U.S., Germany, the Soviet Union, Britain, France and Italy), with an industrial ranking higher than that of most of the industrial nations of the time such as Japan, Poland, Spain, Canada and Australia. In 1918, Czechoslovakia was dissolved by the Austro-Hungarian Empire, independent of Austria, and independent of Hungary. Due to their linguistic and cultural similarities, the Czechoslovak region inherited most of Austria-Hungary's industrial equipment, economic capacity was exceptionally strong among the newly formed small states, as well as the defences of the Sudetenland region and the highest literacy rate in Central and Eastern Europe, making it a medium-sized power.

The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (Arabic: المملكة العربية السعودية, al-Mamlakah ʿArabīyah as-Saʿūdīyah, pronounced help·info, Malaysia as the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Singapore as the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Hong Kong as the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Taiwan as the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia). The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia was founded in 1932 by Ibn Saud, who began in 1902 with the recapture of the historic territory of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, followed by the conquest of the above-mentioned four regions, the country has since ruled on the basis of Islamic principles, in the form of monarchy.

Education generally has two concepts: general and special. General education refers to all the dissemination and learning of the fruits of human civilization — knowledge, skills, and social life experiences — in order to promote the socialization and social individualization of individuals and the activities of social practices that arise in the early stages of human society; special education refers to school education, i.e. institutionalized education. In school education, teachers teach a series of courses directly to students, including reading, writing, mathematics, science, history, etc. In contrast, vocational education teaches only a single vocational skill. In addition, people can also obtain informal education from other channels, such as museums, libraries, the Internet, and life experiences. Other new forms of education are also gradually emerging. Education in Taiwan is part of the compulsory education of Taiwanese nationals. In Taiwan, children aged 6 to 15 years and juveniles are required to receive nine years of compulsory education according to law.

When the capital was built in the Yuan Dynasty, the Taili Pond was enclosed in the imperial palace, and three palaces were arranged around it, namely, Dainai, Longfeng Palace and Xingshan Palace. The area of the Taili Pond in the Yuan Dynasty was equivalent to today's North Sea and Central Sea. The three building blocks of the North Sea, South Sea and Central Sea were finally shaped in the Ming Dynasty. After the founding of the capital Beijing in the Ming Dynasty, a new imperial palace was built in 1406, the Ming Dynasty palace moved southwards on the basis of the location of the Yuan Dynasty palace, so the wall of the imperial palace was moved southwards. To enrich the landscape of the imperial palace garden, the South Sea was excavated, the excavated soil and the excavated soil of the Tsushi River were piled up into Ming Mountain (i.e. Jingshan Mountain). The North Sea, Central Sea and South Sea are collectively referred to as "Taili Pond", and belong to the Western Garden of the imperial palace. The Leopard House inhabited by Emperor Zhengde and the Jade Palace inhabited by Emperor Jiajing were located in the Western Garden. The North Sea and the Central Sea were bounded by the Jinao-Yugu Bridge, and the Central Sea and the South Sea by the Centipede Bridge. After the Qing Dynasty entered the Qing Dynasty and established the capital Beijing, the walls of the imperial palace were removed for service to the imperial court, and a large area of the Western Garden was converted into private residences. At the same time, the "Inner Red Wall" was set up around the three seas of the North Sea, Central Sea and South Sea, and the garden area was reduced to the Inner Red Wall.

Lee Jong-in (August 13, 1891 – January 30, 1969) was a Guangxi Guilin native. His father, Lee Bae-ying, was a famous teacher and had five sons and three daughters. Lee Jong-in was a secondary school student at the age of 18 in Guangxi Army Primary School. Lee joined Sun Yat-sen's camp in Guangzhou in the guise of a mighty soldier. Later, in cooperation with Bai Chong-hui and Huang Shao, he unified the whole province of Guangxi and defended the Guangzhou National Government. During the Northern Expedition of the National Revolutionary Army, he led the Guangxi army all the way from Hunan to Shanhaiguan. After the Northern Expedition, during the Nanjing Decade, he fought and participated in the internal wars of the local forces of the Kuomintang such as the Chiang Kai-shek War in 1929 and the Central Plains War in 1930, and also worked hard to run the main camp in Guangxi. During the War of Resistance against Japan, he was Commander-in-Chief of the Fifth War Area, mobilized Guangxi generals to fight against Japan, commanded many wars, and suffered a major earthquake during the Battle of Taijiazhuang.

On May 20, 1992, he was appointed by Pope John Paul II, on the recommendation of the Archbishop of Valencia, as auxiliary bishop of the Archdiocese of Buenos Aires, with the title of Bishop of the Archdiocese of Oca, Spain; and was consecrated on the following 27 May. Due to his physical incapacity, he was appointed Assistant Bishop of the Archdiocese of Valencia on June 3, 1997, as his direct successor; on February 28, 1997, when the Archbishop of Valencia died, he was excommunicated as Assistant Bishop of the Archdiocese of Valencia. On February 21, 2001, Pope John Paul II proclaimed him Cardinal and Titular Bishop of the Diocese of Santo Domingo, Rome. After his promotion to Cardinal, he was successively appointed by the Pope as a member of the Congregation for Divine Worship and the Discipline of the Sacraments, the Congregation for the Clergy, the Congregation for Institutes of Consecrated Life and Societies of Apostolic Life, the Pontifical Council for the Family, and the Pontifical Commission for Latin America.

Binoculars (field glasses; or simply binoculars, also known as field glasses) are telescopes that align two identical or mirror-symmetric telescopes on a shelf so that they are always aligned in the same direction. The user can view distant scenes with both eyes through them at the same time. Binoculars provide greater depth and distance than single-lens telescopes. Binoculars can also be combined with two short refractive telescopes to view distant targets. The most common binoculars are the right size for a pair of hands. They include an internal reflection system that can shorten the length of the telescope so that it is shorter than the focal length of the lens. In addition, it can increase the distance between the mirrors to improve depth of field. All common binoculars are Galileo-like, or use prisms to present a true image.

In July 1925, the Military Committee of the National Government was established, and the "Political Training Department of the Military Committee" was established as the highest administrative body of the National Army's political and industrial system. In February 1926, the Military Committee promulgated the "Regulations on the Representation of the National Revolutionary Army Party" and the "Regulations on the Organization of the Political Training Department", which specified the organizational regulations for the political and industrial system. During the Northern Expedition of the National Revolutionary Army, the "Political Department of the General Headquarters of the National Revolutionary Army" was added to the Military Committee's Political Training Department, and the "Political Department of the General Headquarters of the National Revolutionary Army" was added to the three departments of Party Affairs, Propaganda and General Affairs. Subsequently, the Secret Service, the International Propaganda Service and the Political Affairs Committee of the Battlefield were added. In February 1928, the Political Training Department of the Military Committee, the Sixth Headquarters and the Training Director's Department of the National Army were combined to form the "Political Department of the Military Committee"; in April, the Party Representation System was abolished.

T Coronae Borealis, also known as T Borealis, is a rare recurring nova, usually a 10th magnitude star, which last erupted in 1946 and has increased its brightness to 2nd magnitude. ADS 9731 and Sigma Coronae Borealis are both multi-star galaxies with six and five stars, respectively. Five of the Coronae Borealis galaxies are found to be a series of planets the size of Jupiter. Abel 2065 is a cluster of more than 400 galaxies one billion light years from the Sun, and belongs to the Supercluster of the Coronae Borealis. It occupies 179 square degrees of the night sky, accounting for 0.433%, and ranks 73rd in 88 modern constellations. The unique crown shape of the Coronae Borealis consists of seven stars. In addition to the brightest binary star Borealis IV, six other stars, Borealis II, Borealis III, Borealis V, Borealis VI, Borealis VII and Borealis VIII, are all 4th magnitude stars.

During his tenure as Director of the Military Law Department, the Liu Nature Incident broke out in Taiwan, and in the midst of the emotions of the U.S. Embassy, the Liu Yuan Chuu trial was held openly, and the defendants were allowed to retain their own lawyers to defend themselves, so that the mysterious military law system could be made public. In 1958, he went to the University of Bonn for further studies, and in 1963 he received a doctorate in law. After returning to Taiwan in 1963, he became a columnist for the Chuo Daily newspaper. In 1969, he was appointed as the Director of the Legal Affairs Department of the Ministry of Defense, and began his political career. Later, he served as an advisor and director of the Legal Affairs Department of the Ministry of Defense, a director of the Legal Affairs Council and the Appeals Committee of the Executive Yuan, and as a professor of the National Political University and director of the Law Institute, as well as the principal, the Minister of Education, the Minister of the Ministry of Justice, and so on. Between 1978 and 1984, he promoted the separation of trials, the establishment of a compensation system, the election of defense lawyers during investigations, and the modernization of prison administration.

In 1939, during World War II, most of Czechoslovakia was occupied by Nazi Germany, and two puppet states, the Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia and the Slovak Republic, were established in the industrial core area, even though the defunct state continued to function as the most developed industrial area in Nazi Germany. Following the February 1948 events, the Czechoslovak Communist Party established a one-party regime. In 1960, Czechoslovakia was incorporated into the Communist camp by the Soviet Union, and renamed the Czechoslovak Socialist Republic. After the Velvet Revolution in 1989, the name was changed to the Federal Republic of Czechoslovakia. In 1992, the Czechoslovak Republic and Slovakia moved towards the separation of the two countries, becoming the Czech Republic and the Slovak Republic respectively in a peaceful and bloodless manner. Czechoslovakia underwent several regime changes between the end of World War I and the Great Transition of the Soviet Union.

The Andean Mountains are 6,400 kilometers long north-south, the longest mountains on earth, the highest mountain is Acucagua, 6,962 meters high, cross-country Venezuela, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Bolivia, Chile, Argentina. In the southern part of the Andean Mountains there are several parallel Cordillera Mountains, an average altitude of about 3,350 to 3,900 meters, with Atacama Plateau. In the middle part of the Andean Mountains on Bolivian soil, an average altitude of 3,000 to 3,600 meters, divided into two branches, east and west, between which there is Lake Popo and Lake Kaka. In Peru, there are also many mountains, on which there are many active volcanoes, including Mount Chimborazo (6,310 meters), Mount Cotopaxi (5,896 meters), etc. In Colombia, it is divided into three branches, finally turning to the northeast of Venezuela, forming the Merida Mountains.

Da Sha Tau railway station, formerly known as Guangxi Railway Station, is located at the southern end of Baiyun Road in Yuxiu District, Guangzhou, China. It was the starting point of the original Guangxi Railway. It was built in 1911. Historically, it was known as Guangzhou East Station and Guangzhou Station. It was the largest passenger railway station in Guangzhou. After the opening of Guangzhou New Passenger Station in 1974, Da Sha Tau railway station was used as a passenger railway station until it was demolished in 1985. At the end of the 19th century, Hong Kong had become a British colony, the Hong Kong government began to propose to the Qing government a railway construction plan for Kowloon-Guangzhou, in order to facilitate the rapid transportation of goods and people to the Guangdong market. In 1898, the British Qiangsu Guangxi Railway borrowing rights, and under pressure from the British, the Qing government railway minister Sheng Xuanhui and Ying Shan Yi and Yang Bo signed the "Guangxi Railway Loan Draft Contract" in 1899. Under this draft contract, the Guangxi Railway planned to build 121 miles, bordered by Shenzhen (then Xin'an County) Luohu Bridge, divided into two parts, England and China.

The Prime Minister of the Republic of China (Chinese: 中華民國國務總理) is the head of the State Council of the Republic of China (Taiwan State Council) and the head of government of the period of the Northern Ocean Government of the Republic of China (Taiwan State Council). Some of the Prime Ministers of the Republic of China (Taiwan State Council) nominally exercised the powers of the "Grand President of the Republic of China" but the actual powers were held by the armed forces of the Republic of China. In addition, Yuan Shikai, when he was the Grand President, changed the Prime Minister of the Republic of China (Taiwan State Council) to the "Minister of State", this is also included. In June 1928, the National Government unified China nominally, the head of government from the position of the Prime Minister of the Republic of China (Taiwan State Council) to the position of the President of the Executive Council (Taiwan Executive Council). According to the Provisional Treaty of the Republic of China (Taiwan Provisional Law), the Provisional President of the Republic of China (Taiwan Provisional Law), has to appoint a cabinet headed by the Prime Minister. On May 1, 1914, the Northern Ocean Government changed the State Council to the Politburo, directly under the Office of the Grand President; the Prime Minister changed the name to the Minister of State. On June 29, 1916, the Beijing Government re-established the State Council, restored the position of the Prime Minister of the Republic of China (Taiwan State Council), appointed by the President of the Republic of China (Taiwan Provisional Law), but the powers were held by the Prime Minister of the Republic of China (Taiwan Provisional Law), for a time as the parliamentary system.

Many consider this to be one of the most unsuccessful Olympic Games of recent times. Transportation problems are prominent, and it is over-commercialized, with many complaining about the ubiquity of advertising. In addition, during the Games on July 27, there was an explosion in Atlanta's Olympic Park, injuring 111 people and killing one. In his closing remarks, International Olympic Committee (IOC) President Vladimir Samaranch failed for the first time to describe the Games as "the best Olympic Games in history." The Games featured 26 major events, 271 minor events. 197 countries and regions participated in the 1996 Atlanta Games. At least 20 delegations participated in the Games for the first time, including the 12 member states of the former Soviet Union, which participated in the 1992 Barcelona Games on behalf of the Commonwealth of Independent States, and these countries will participate in the Games as independent nations.

From the middle of August, under the command of the Chief of Staff of the Guangdong Army, General Dongjo Yingfan, and the Commander of the First Army of the North China Expeditionary Force, General Xiang Yue Qingji, the Guangdong Army and the North Korean Army attacked Shanxi. On August 11, the Japanese attacked the southern gate along the Pingsui Line, and captured the southern gate and Zhangjiakou on August 25 and 27. After the capture of Datong, they began to attack the Pinghuang Gate. Chiang Kai-shek concentrated more than 10 divisions of the Jin army to defend the Pinghuang Gate, the Ganmen Gate, and the area around Jinchi, and fought against the Japanese. The Jin army persisted until the night of September 30, and began to withdraw to Wutai Mountain and the area around Dai County. The focus of the North China resistance shifted to the defense of Taiyuan. In order to prevent the Japanese from attacking Taiyuan from the north, the Second War Area determined the battle line of Xinguo. Xinguo is located between Xian County and Xin County, the Dongyi Yunzhong River, the hills on the west side of the Dongpu Railway and the Jinbei Road leading to Taiyuan, are the necessary routes for the Japanese to attack Taiyuan.

Taipei Christian College, located near Guantou Bridge, was approved by the Ministry of Education of the Republic of China in May 2012 as Taipei Christian College in accordance with the Establishment Procedure for Religious Training College. It is the first Christian Education College in Taiwan to establish a Christian Liberal Arts Department. The motto of Taipei Christian College, "Awe of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom," represents the purpose and spirit of the school, which is to provide Christian liberal arts education to Taiwanese and overseas youth, teach students to have a Christian worldview and a Christian view of life, and become able Christian leaders in the church and in the workplace. The predecessor of Taipei Christian College, the Christ College, was founded in 1959 by the American missionary Dr. James R. Graham III. Dr. Graham's parents (Jimmy and Sophie Graham) were missionaries in China from 1889 to 1940, so Dr. Graham grew up in China, and after graduating from Hampden-Sydney College in the United States, he was called back to missionary work in China.

He was born in Yueyang County, Hunan Province, and was elected as a delegate to the First National Assembly in 1947.He was born in Yueyang, Hunan Province, and was fond of reading Liang Kai-chao's essays as a child.He was influenced by Liang Kai-chao, and often took up the cause of the nation's rise and fall.He joined the Marxist Research Society founded by Dong Bingwu in Wuhan in 1919 during the May Fourth Movement.He studied Russian in 1921.He was sent to Moscow by the Chinese Communist Party.He was expelled from the Communist Party because of the conflict with the leader of the Zhang Dynasty.He returned to Wuhan in 1922 to work as a secondary school teacher.He was a member of the Communist Society founded by the British during the Qing Dynasty.He left the Communist Party because of disagreement.He was dissatisfied with the political corruption of the Communist Party.

Line 22 of the Guangzhou Metro is one of the lines of the Guangzhou Metro, the current line connects Chentougang and Panyu Square in Panyu District, the representative color is orange-brown. Like Line 18, the line is positioned as the City Area Express Line. The first section of Line 22 (Chentougang-Panyu Square) was opened on March 31, 2022, and the remaining section of Line 22 (Fangcun-Chentougang) is still under construction. The extension of Line 22 north from Fangcun to Airport North Station was approved in August 2020 under the name of "Fangcun to Baiyun Airport Interchange" (Fang Baiyun Interchange) and the start-up ceremony was held on December 31, 2021. Since the entire line of Line 22 is currently located in Panyu District, Line 22 is the only line in the Guangzhou Metro line network that is currently all in the same administrative area. At the same time, the first section of Line 22 is the shortest length, the least number of stations and the first heavy rail line that uses the GoA3 level of automatic operation.

The emergence of Protestantism stems from Martin Luther, a professor of theology and a Catholic priest, who criticized the excessive use of the Holy See for the atonement of sins. The decadent corruption of the Catholic Church, the ravages of the Reformation, and the deaths of the Jesuits ultimately triggered the Reformation. Indeed, after Luther entered the monastery in 1505, he experienced a great spiritual struggle of faith, "a deep sense of guilt and a lack of the joy of God." At the beginning of the 16th century, under the high tolerance of the Catholic Church, the issue of the atonement of sins went out of control. The spirit of Protestant intransigence can be traced back to some of the forerunners of the Reformation in the 14th century, such as the Wickreeves of England, and the followers of the Lairds, the Jan Hussites of Bohemia, and the Savonarola of Italy. In the 20th century, Martin Luther launched the Reformation movement in Germany, quickly sweeping the whole of Germany, and in Geneva, Calvin's Reformation further deepened the influence of the Reformation.
